runners.name: Haku
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; penalty for recent Wolverhampton win puts him back on a career-high mark
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner who comes into this off the back off an easy success over three rivals at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) last Thursday (sixth win there); not quite sure what he achieved, though, and his penalty puts him back on a career-high mark.

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Tools At BetUK Handicap
quotes.quote: Haku is a legend, he's gone up through the ranks and he always gives his all. He's a favourite in the yard and it's great that he can come and do his job here - Mark Loughnane, trainer, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Due To Henry
runners.breeder: D Hefin Jones & Whitsbury Manor Stud
runners.comment: Half-brother to a couple of AW winners, but this looks a tough task on his reappearance
runners.spotlight: Three wins over 7.6f-1m2f on turf last year, but not seen since a heavy defeat in a warm handicap at Newmarket (1m4f, good to soft) in October; half-brother to a couple of AW winners, but this looks a tough task on his reappearance; stable also runs Forest Gate.

runners.name: Arqoob
runners.comment: Two goes over C&D in March resulted in a win and a nose defeat; respected back here
runners.spotlight: Two goes over C&D in March resulted in a win and a nose defeat; possible to excuse last month's Epsom performance (1m4f, good) and respected back here off just 2lb higher than for his win.

quotes.race: Sri Lanka - The Jewel Of Asia Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: I was a bit surprised Arqoob went off favourite. We thought he had an each-way shout, but it is tough out there as the ground is testing. He was probably not in love with it, but he does like that hill. Bryony just waited a bit longer than normal and I think that was pretty key. He winged the last and that really sealed it. He is so consistent that you could set your watch by him. We will go home and look what there is for him, but I suppose we might be thinking about the Imperial Cup later in the season if we get his rating high enough - Lucy Wadham, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was second last time at Kempton in a photo-finish, but we're still arguing about that and have asked them to look at the photograph again. They've agreed to do that. He has enjoyed being back on the Flat. We haven't ruled out running him over hurdles again when the spring ground arrives, so he's probably going to mix and match a bit. He's been running consistently in quite high-class Flat races, but he's been hard to win with and so it was slightly difficult what happened last time, even though I was pleased he ran so well. 19-03-25

runners.name: Siempre Arturo
runners.comment: 5-10 last year, but has suffered two heavy defeats on turf since returning last month
runners.spotlight: 5-10 last year including a win over 1m3f here, but has suffered two heavy defeats on turf since returning last month; needs a resurgence.

stable_tour.quote: It looked like he didn't stay 1m4f at Chelmsford on his most recent start. He's always gone nicely at home, but has been learning as he's been racing and Chelmsford was the first time he was in a proper race. His other appearances came in smaller-field, slowly run affairs and it might have been a shock against 15 horses. He might stay 1m4f in time but will go to Salisbury on Sunday for a 1m2f handicap and I think there's scope in his mark. 02-05-24

runners.name: Forest Gate
runners.comment: Half-brother to a US dirt winner, but he has a bit to prove on his return
runners.spotlight: Enjoyed the run of the race when easily winning an Epsom novice (1m2f, heavy) last September, but not seen since well held on handicap debut at York (1m6f, soft) the following month; half-brother to a US dirt winner, but he has a bit to prove on his return.

runners.name: Turquino
runners.comment: Won twice on Tapeta before disappointing on turf; major player if resuming his progress
runners.spotlight: Got off to a good start when winning Tapeta novices at Southwell (1m3f) and Newcastle (1m4f) in March, but disappointed on his turf/handicap debut at Ascot (1m4f, good to firm) this month (missed break/pulled too hard); has a bit to prove but a major player if resuming his progress.

runners.name: Calumet
runners.comment: Not always enjoyed the best of luck in handicaps; has run well here before; not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Hasn't always enjoyed the best of luck in handicaps since his 9l success in a Windsor maiden (1m2f, good to firm) last summer; has run well here before and not dismissed down another 2lb.

runners.name: Way Of Life
runners.comment: 2lb higher than for latest success over 1m3f here, but others are preferred for the win
runners.spotlight: Was ending a 31-race losing run when winning by a short head over 1m3f here 13 days ago; only 2lb higher and could go well again, but others are preferred for the win.

quotes.race: Starlight Charity Remembers Christopher Hanbury Handicap
quotes.quote: Way Of Life is just growing up. He was so raw and ignorant and gormless as a younger horse and if he had ability he kept it well hidden, but we knew something was there. I hope he doesn't get crucified for that by the handicapper - Jonathan Portman, trainer.

runners.name: Melek Alreeh
runners.comment: Was returning from 180 days off when just beaten at Doncaster last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Dual Southwell winner (1m4f, Tapeta) last year who was returning from 180 days off and having his first start after a second wind operation when beaten half a length at Doncaster (1m4f, good) last month; up 2lb but still respected with the run under his belt.

stable_tour.quote: He's had wind operations and he struggles a little bit with his wind. Arguably he's best suited by a synthetic, flat track, where it's easier and he doesn't get found out. He travels well into his races and his wind can catch him out. We'll stick to the all-weather and see where we are. 04-09-24

runners.name: Kotari
runners.comment: 2lb below last winning mark but something to prove on his first AW run since French debut
runners.spotlight: 2lb lower than for the last leg of his turf hat-trick over 1m2f/1m4f last spring, but has something to prove on his first AW run since French debut.

runners.name: Calvert
runners.comment: Returns from seven months off having undergone wind surgery; market useful
runners.spotlight: Easy winner of an uncompetitive Bath novice (1m2f, good to soft) as a 2yo and ran well in turf handicaps last summer, but heavy ground appeared to find him out on his last two outings; returns from seven months off having undergone wind surgery; market useful.

runners.name: Federated
runners.comment: Poor last time, but usually consistent and 2-2 over C&D; each-way claims if bouncing back
runners.spotlight: Has to bounce back from a poor effort at Newcastle (1m4f, Tapeta) last time, but was in good form in handicaps prior to that and is 2-2 over C&D; each-way claims.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: It was like a piece of work to be honest. The front horse went off and I had something to aim at, I picked him up well and Federated has done it nicely - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Trojan Storm
runners.comment: Won at Wolverhampton last time; a bit to prove back on Polytrack after 109 days off
runners.spotlight: Best form has come on Tapeta, as when making it sixth-time lucky at Wolverhampton (1m4f) in February; 4lb higher and has a bit to prove back on Polytrack after 109 days off.

runners.name: Dr Waksman
runners.comment: 0-8 on the Flat and over hurdles; will do well to break his duck in this company
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish gelding who is 0-8 on the Flat and over hurdles; will do well to break his duck in this company.

stable_tour.quote: He was bought as a dual-purpose horse and ran a nice race when second last time at Plumpton. He could pinch a little maiden and we'll see what there is around Easter. He'll qualify for a mark after his next run. He's no world-beater but I think he's going to be a good, fun horse over hurdles and on the Flat. 26-02-25

7:52.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Fillies' Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Miss Dolly Rocker
runners.comment: Reliable sort but she looks weighted near best off this mark and has tough draw back on AW
runners.spotlight: Reliable sort who returned for new yard with respectable third behind a big improver at Ascot (1m2f, good to firm) 18 days ago; this step back up in trip is no problem but she looks weighted to her best off this mark and has a wide draw back on AW; others are more persuasive.

runners.name: Kinetic
runners.comment: Back in the groove with wins in last two starts and highly respected in hat-trick bid
runners.spotlight: Cashed in on a reduced mark at Lingfield (1m4f, Polytrack) last month before following up under a penalty at Windsor five days later; up another 4lb but she overcame trouble for that brave success last time and still looks feasibly treated; highly respected in hat-trick bid.

stable_tour.quote: She's done very well for Deva Racing. She was well bought, having won four on the Flat for us. We were going to sell her but decided to keep her and run over hurdles. She was quite green at Newbury first time then she was beaten again at Kempton. She may go to Plumpton on Sunday. 01-01-25

runners.name: Typical Woman
runners.comment: Triple turf winner but she's 1-12 on AW and was well held over C&D on recent return
runners.spotlight: Triple turf winner but she's 1-12 on AW and was well held over C&D on her return three weeks ago; may have needed that run but she's not easy to predict and others are more convincing.

runners.name: Elterwater
runners.comment: Won three in a row on AW this year but was held over C&D last time; needs to find more
runners.spotlight: Completed an AW hat-trick when scoring at Wolverhampton (9.4f) in March but her winning streak came to an end over C&D (fourth of eight) last time; still unexposed at this trip but she needs to find more to defy this mark.

quotes.race: Weekly Free Bets With BetMGM Extra Fillies' Handicap
quotes.quote: "We always thought Elterwater could be a nice filly but she's very big and had a bit of bad luck early in her career. She's found her groove now and is progressing nicely. The team have done a good job with her at home. She's quite well bred and the long-term strategy is she could end up going back to Gary and Lesley [Middlebrook] to be in their broodmare band but we'll take her as far as she can go on the track."- Daniel Kubler, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Silver Nightfall
runners.comment: Record of 22121 since wearing a visor and is 5-16 on AW; respected back from a break
runners.spotlight: Ended last year with a clearcut win at this track (1m3f), taking form figures since wearing visor to 22121 and AW record to 5-16; drawn out wide on her return but she still looks on a workable mark and is a big player if she can pick up where she left off.

runners.name: Aiming High
runners.comment: Had tough task at Ascot latest and was in good form on AW before that; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Has popped up in front where it matters once in each of the last four years, doing it smoothly this March over 1m4f on Wolverhampton AW; close third over C&D one week later and she had a tough task behind a handicap blot at Ascot last time; should get a decent tow into this race and she has possibilities back on AW.

stable_tour.quote: She loves the all-weather and is due to run this week at Kempton on Wednesday. She loves fast ground and accumulates prize-money in her own little way. She's found out as soon as she hits a mark of 80 but while she's in the 70s she's competitive. 04-09-24

runners.name: More Than A Feelin
runners.comment: Out of sorts in her three runs this year and has stamina to prove at this new trip
runners.spotlight: Three wins at around 1m on AW last year but she's finished down the field in three runs at Kempton in 2025; edging back down the weights but she has some questions to answer and is untried at this trip; cheekpieces worn last time are removed.

runners.name: Nowhere
runners.comment: Reached the frame in last three runs but she's now 0-9 and needs to find something extra
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden but she's been running well for new yard this spring including a 2l fourth over C&D (7-2 favourite) last month; should go well again but she needs to find something extra to get off the mark; hood removed.

stable_tour.quote: She was second first time out at Kempton. She ran really well but, similar to Dashinwhitesargent, she came back with a dirty scope. 06-06-24

runners.name: Personal Best
runners.owner: Hot To Trot 1 & Mrs R Pease
runners.comment: Leicester winner who is unexposed and needs a close look on her handicap debut
runners.spotlight: 25-1 when making a winning debut at Leicester (1m, heavy) in October; held in third under a penalty here (1m3f) on return last month but that was a creditable effort from the front and she should have more to offer now switched to handicapping.

quotes.race: British EBF Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We had to talk the co-owner into running Personal Best. Dear Rosa Pease, she's been with me for 26 years and she's the breeder of Personal Best. She probably told me about six times not to run. Thank God the filly has done her well. I just thought they'd need the run today. On this [heavy] ground, you don't know quite what's going to happen. They've not had anything too demanding asked of them at home so I didn't have huge expectations -  Jonathan Portman, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: She's out of a staying half-sister to Annecdote, who Jonny trained to win at Royal Ascot. She's really nice but very much the type of big, scopey filly who'll be better with time and a trip. But she's showing up quite nicely. 02-08-24

runners.name: Vilaine Verlaine
runners.comment: Dual AW winner who still has potential and looks interesting on this step up to 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Made it 2-4 in handicaps when scoring at Chelmsford in December and she reappeared with an eyecatching fourth from off the pace at Goodwood (1m2f, good) 26 days ago; still has potential and she's not ruled out on her step up to this trip.

runners.name: Chilli Queen
runners.comment: Won a Wolverhampton maiden latest and she's open to more progress on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Has improved since upped in trip for new yard, making her breakthrough in a Wolverhampton maiden (1m4f) two weeks ago; this is a much deeper race on handicap debut but she's open to more progress back on Polytrack; hood worn in four of her five runs is removed.

quotes.race: Free Bets With BetUK Bet Club Restricted Novice Stakes (For horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Marhaba Ghaiyyath was still a bit raw and I think she'd have been more streetwise if she'd had more of a lead. She's a bit weak and won't mind coming back in trip at the moment but, once she strengthens up, she should be able to go up in distance - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Lesson Of Life
runners.comment: Unexposed handicap newcomer and she needs a close look in the market
runners.spotlight: Shaped with some promise in her three qualifying runs, most recently when third of six on Lingfield reappearance (1m4f, AW) last month; opening mark looks on the high side but it's still early days and she should have more to offer; one to keep an eye on.

7:22.race_name: Unibet Support Safer Gambling Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Mile Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Force And Valour
runners.comment: Versatile sort but assessor has not cut him much slack and was laboured at Chester latest
runners.spotlight: Versatile sort who scored over 5f/6f (turf/AW) last term and ran well over 7f at Meydan in February; however, the assessor has not cut him much slack and he returned from a break with a laboured effort at Chester (first run since gelded) three weeks ago; down the list.

runners.name: Searchingtheblues
runners.comment: Won her first two starts but has been disappointing in last three; plenty to prove
runners.spotlight: Won her first two starts in AW novices last summer, the first over C&D and than an 8l success at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta); only seen three times since then, though, and has been disappointing including in two handicaps this spring; plenty to prove.

runners.name: Binhareer
runners.comment: Redcar winner who is unexposed and needs a close look on handicap/seasonal debut
runners.spotlight: Has good pedigree and he delivered on his debut promise when readily winning a Redcar novice (soft) last October; well held as favourite in final 2yo run and gelded since, but it's still early days and he should have more to offer in handicaps this season; needs close look on return.

quotes.race: Racing TV EBF Stallions Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: Binhareer still has plenty to learn but he'll be a nice horse - Rossa Ryan, jockey.

runners.name: Tremolo
runners.comment: Has struggled in two handicaps this spring and needs a major revival back on AW
runners.spotlight: Justified favouritism in a Southwell novice (7f, Tapeta) in December but he's struggled in two turf handicaps (1m) this spring; still lightly raced and now returns to AW but he needs to get his career back on track.

runners.name: Leadenhall Street
runners.comment: Won on handicap debut at Southwell but he's not gone on from that and has bit to prove
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut at Southwell (6f, AW) in February but he's gone the wrong way in three runs since; couldn't recover after jumping the path at Lingfield last time but he's now 1-7 and has something to prove.

runners.name: Blue Rc
runners.comment: Dead-heated on Chelmsford debut and similar form last time; interesting on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Overcame inexperience and a wide trip to force a dead-heat on Chelmsford debut (6f; pair clear) in March; held under a penalty at Doncaster but was only beaten around 2l and he shaped as though this step up in trip could suit; looks open to progress now switched to a handicap and he's an interesting contender.

runners.name: Zabeel Road
runners.breeder: Mrs O Murtagh & Iirsh National Stud
runners.comment: Made encouraging stable debut at Lingfield and should be sharper this time; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Campaigned at 5f last spring/summer for Charlie Johnston, winning on debut; sold for 42,000gns and was gelded in the autumn; no impact on recent stable debut at Lingfield (7f, good to firm) but he shaped with promise in fourth of ten and should benefit from that run; not ruled out.

runners.name: Critical Aclaim
runners.comment: Unexposed gelding who won at Brighton (7f) latest and is in the mix on handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on AW in his first three starts before beating two rivals in a Brighton maiden (7f, good to firm) three weeks ago; this is much tougher on handicap debut but he's been generally progressive so far and is still unexposed; in the mix with cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Spirit Lead Me
runners.comment: Won two in a row in October but he's been vulnerable in last three runs; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Won two nurseries (1m/7f) on AW in October but he shot up the weights after that; ended last year with two respectable runs at this track but he reappeared with a laboured effort here in March; has bit to prove after another break and he needs to find more progress.

6:22.race_name: Try Unibet's Improved Acca Boosts Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.name: Henrytheninth
runners.comment: Struggled at a big price at Salisbury last July and can only be watched on comeback
runners.spotlight: 40-1 on Salisbury debut (7f, good) last July and he weakened into a remote eighth of ten; can only be watched back from 319 days off.

runners.name: Dr Strangelove
runners.comment: Made bright start when winning over 6f here last month; respected up in trip under penalty
runners.spotlight: Mohaather half-brother to six winners; weak 16-1 shot on debut here (6f) last month but he made steady headway before finishing well to reel in the favourite; has a penalty but that was a bright start and he's open to progress upped in trip.

runners.name: Fort Campbell
runners.comment: Promising third at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) in October and he's respected on his return
runners.spotlight: $210,000 yearling; ran green when fifth on Wolverhampton debut last October and he built on that with a promising third at Chelmsford (7f, Polytrack) 24 days later; that form puts him firmly in the picture and he's respected on return.

runners.name: Give Me The Night
runners.comment: 20,000gns 2yo; tongue tied for debut and he's best watched
runners.spotlight: 165,000euros yearling, 20,000gns 2yo; sixth foal; gelded half-brother to four winners, notably Nazuna (7f/1m including US; RPR 103); tongue tied for debut; best watched.

runners.name: Grey Soul
runners.comment: 80,000gns yearling; yard won a division of this last year and needs a close look on debut
runners.spotlight: 80,000gns yearling; first foal; dam Group-placed 6f/7f 2yo winner (including AW; RPR 96), half-sister to winners Oneofapear (1m1f/1m2f) and Brog Deas (1m/1m1f), out of maiden sister to US 1m Grade 2 winner Lord Smith; yard won a division of this race last year and he needs a close look on debut.

runners.name: Kyoto
runners.comment: 220,000euros yearling; interesting newcomer and he needs watching in market
runners.spotlight: 220,000euros yearling; fourth foal; half-brother to winners Spinning Memories (6f/7f inc Group 3; RPR 115), Ramazan (Listed-placed 5f-7f; 114) and Beach Road One (Swedish 7f-10.5f); dam unraced sister to US 6f-8.5f winner Memories Of Winter; interesting newcomer and he needs watching in market.

runners.name: Moonlight Bomb
runners.comment: Well held in both runs this spring, with RPRs in the 50s on both occasions
runners.spotlight: Well held at Windsor (1m) and over C&D this spring, with RPRs in the 50s on both occasions; has plenty to find and handicaps will be more suitable.

runners.name: Day Of Grace
runners.comment: Shaped with promise on recent C&D debut and she should know more this time; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to three winners and is out of a 7.4f/1m winner (including 2yo Group 3); never involved on recent C&D debut (14-1) but she made some late headway out wide and wasn't beaten far; has another wide draw but she should know more this time and is a likely improver.

runners.name: Desert Charm
runners.comment: Finished in rear at big prices in two runs this spring and latest was over C&D
runners.spotlight: Finished in rear at big prices in two runs this spring and latest was over C&D; no appeal.

runners.name: Thaloria
runners.comment: Half-sister to several useful winners and needs watching in market on debut
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-sister to winners Alrajaa (7f/1m including AW; RPR 113), Etaab (7f/1m including AW/Listed; 107), Estiqaama (1m; 103) and Farsakh (6f; 88); dam 6f/7f winner (including Listed/AW; 104), closely related to 7f 2yo Listed winner Mudaaraah; has useful pedigree and she needs watching in market on debut.

8:52.race_name: Racing TV Handicap (A Jockey Club Grassroots Stayers' & London Stayers' Qualifier)

runners.name: Cinnodin
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner, but around 10l behind Orchestra back here last time
runners.spotlight: Won the same race for the second year in a row over C&D last month, but he isn't very consistent and finished around 10l behind Orchestra back here a fortnight later; hard to know what to expect.

quotes.race: Athlone Handicap
quotes.quote: Cinnodin didn't do much wrong at Wetherby, he was just a bit unfortunate in the circumstances. We thought this race might cut up and we had it as a plan a month ago. I don't normally like going a mile and three quarters with a three-year-old this early on but he would get two miles tomorrow as he is an out-and-out stayer - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's probably his own worst enemy. He keeps running so well and it's hard to find a four-year-old 0-80 2m race, but he'll go and win once he gets one of them with a bit of pace. 18-09-24

runners.name: Orchestra
runners.breeder: S C Ecurie Ades-Hazan & Pvp Racing
runners.comment: Made all over C&D last month; respected, especially if again allowed an uncontested lead
runners.spotlight: Having his second start back from wind surgery when making all and just holding on over C&D last month (first two clear); has since finished fourth of eight in a slightly better race at Ascot (2m, good to firm); respected, especially if again allowed an uncontested lead.

runners.name: Kingdom Of Stars

prev_owners.owner: M White, Mrs A Gillies And Partner

runners.comment: Much better when fourth behind two of these on handicap debut over C&D 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: Well held in three novices over 1m2f/1m4f on turf/Polytrack last year, but much better when beaten just over a length into fourth of eight behind Gooloogong and Capone on handicap debut over C&D 13 days ago; still open to further improvement.

runners.name: Capone
runners.owner: Maximum Racing And D Ffrench Davis
runners.comment: Beaten a neck by Gooloogong on his recent return over C&D; should go well again
runners.spotlight: 3-13 over hurdles and 1-19 on the Flat, though he was returning from ten months off when running Gooloogong to a neck over C&D 13 days ago; should go well again provided this doesn't come too soon.

quotes.race: MansionBet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: That was a disaster. I left the ear plugs in and Noel said Capone never woke up. He's going to be a much nicer horse next year and it's great to give Noel a winner - Charlie Mann, trainer.

quotes.race: Best Wishes For 2019 Juvenile Hurdle
quotes.quote: Noel (Fehily) thinks I ran Capone too soon as he didn't settle today but he's a lot better than that. He won't run again for at least a month but he's a decent horse. He works very well and we've got nothing that can go with him at home - Charlie Mann, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a present from Charlie Mann when he retired. He's had a wonderful season but sadly he irritated an old leg injury when I ran him at Salisbury the other day. He couldn't get into the race on the rail and when he got clear he stretched and I think he did something funny when he crossed the road, so we won't see him in a little while. 21-09-23

runners.name: Lusaka
runners.comment: Beaten a very long way on his return from six months off at Chester 19 days ago
runners.spotlight: Five turf wins over 1m4f/1m6f for this yard, but he was much more out than in last year; beaten a very long way on his return from six months off at Chester (1m4f, good) 19 days ago and has enough to prove.

quotes.race: Thorn Baker Allianz Xenia Bath Summer Stayers' Series Final Handicap
quotes.quote: It was brilliant as we thought the ground may have gone slightly against us but I suppose Lusaka missing the start helped him a little bit to get into the race - John Flint, trainer.

runners.name: Judgementofsolomon
runners.comment: 1lb above last winning mark, but has looked better on Tapeta than on Polytrack thus far
runners.spotlight: Just 1lb higher than when winning at Pontefract (2m1f, good to firm) last September when with Sir Mark Prescott; hasn't been with this yard for long, but he has looked better on Tapeta than on Polytrack thus far.

quotes.race: Go Racing In Yorkshire Handicap (Round 5 Of The Pontefract Stayers Championship 2024)
quotes.quote: Judgementofsolomon been a little bit of a character, he's keeping a little bit back, but the extra distance really helped - Ian Mailer, part owner.

runners.name: Caprelo
runners.comment: Course winner (1m3f), but didn't quite appear to stay over C&D last time; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Made a successful handicap debut here (1m3f) just over a year ago, but hasn't built on it and didn't appear to quite see out the trip when behind three of these in first-time cheekpieces over C&D 13 days ago; blinkers are given a go this time.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Kempton in April and was  second last time at Windsor, where the ground was too quick. I'm not sure he's quite as good as Marmelo and Vent De Force, who were also out of Capriolla, but I think next year he will be quite progressive. 06-06-24

runners.name: Gooloogong

prev_owners.owner: Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith
Westerberg, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, D Smith

runners.comment: Beat three of these over C&D 13 days ago; won with a bit in hand and respected up just 2lb
runners.spotlight: Was having his second start back from a break when getting up to beat Capone by a neck in a steadily run race over C&D 13 days ago, with Kingdom Of Stars and Caprelo further behind; seemed to win with a bit more in hand than the margin would suggest and respected up just 2lb.

quotes.race: NavanRacecourse.ie Maiden
quotes.quote: Gooloogong has been progressing nicely over the winter. Ryan spoke very nicely of him and he will fit into one of the trials now - Chris Armstrong, stable representative

stable_tour.quote: He's a nice colt who came forward nicely from his only run at two to win at Navan in March. We're thinking about the Queen's Vase for him but nothing is set in stone yet. 15-06-23

runners.name: Abraaj
runners.comment: 1lb lower than when winning over C&D last summer; has undergone a second wind op
runners.spotlight: Won three times on the AW in the first half of last year, the latest over C&D from 1lb higher in June; the wheels appear to have come off since the autumn, but he returns from three months off after a second wind operation; interesting to see how he fares.

runners.name: Ghasham
runners.breeder: A O'Brien,M Al Monsour& K Al' Attiyah
runners.comment: Has only beaten one rival in three starts on the AW; best watched
runners.spotlight: Best known as a soft-ground hurdler these days and ran well on a few occasions in that sphere during the winter; has only beaten one rival in three starts on the AW, though, so best watched unless the market suggests otherwise.

quotes.race: Follow Us On Social Media Maiden
quotes.quote: Ghasham is a massive big horse and looks progressive. It was a nice performance and there is a lot of improvement to come from him. He loved that ground and was very tough - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Kissininthebackrow
runners.comment: 1lb higher than when winning over C&D last October; each-way claims on that form
runners.spotlight: Hasn't been in much form on the AW or over hurdles for a few runs now, but is just 1lb higher than when winning over C&D last October; each-way claims if back to that sort of form.

5:18.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Mbappe
runners.comment: Out of sorts in last two runs and he's still 4lb higher than for last win; down the list
runners.spotlight: Won three times last year, with the first at this track (7f) and the last two on turf at Lingfield (7.6f); creditable third from off the pace over C&D in October but he's been out of sorts in both runs since and is still 4lb higher than for his last success; others preferred.

runners.name: Foreseen
runners.comment: Ex-French; 0-10 since his debut win and has a very patchy profile; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Ex-French gelding who is 0-10 since his debut win last March; finished a close fifth at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack) in second run for current yard but he was well held over 1m4f here last time; this drop back to 1m should be fine but he has a very patchy profile and others are more convincing.

runners.name: Law Supreme
runners.comment: On dangerous mark and he didn't get much luck over C&D last week; interesting contender
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner who is 0-13 on AW but he reappeared with a creditable fourth over C&D this month and didn't get much luck on his return visit last Wednesday; remains well handicapped on his best form and could be a big factor if he gets the breaks this time.

runners.name: Vellner
runners.comment: On workable mark and market should guide on his return after 255 days off
runners.spotlight: Won off a similar mark at Ayr (1m, good) last May but has mixed record since and was well held in his final run last season; returns after eight months off but he's still unexposed on AW and needs checking in the market.

quotes.race: William Hill Lengthen Your Odds Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Vellner has been green in his behaviour but I thought it would take a good horse to beat him. He's a lovely horse and I would say that's just the start with him - Paddy Twomey, trainer.

runners.name: Between Me And U
runners.comment: Back after wind surgery with a respectable effort at Musselburgh last month; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Emphatic winner off 4lb lower on stable debut at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) last September; ended last year with a major blip but he returned after wind surgery with a respectable effort at Musselburgh last month; should benefit from that run and he's not ruled out back on AW.

runners.name: Stella Hogan
runners.comment: Two Polytrack wins for current yard but was never involved at Chelmsford last time
runners.spotlight: Has some quirks but she's won twice on Polytrack (including over C&D) since joining Mick Appleby in the autumn; fair third off this mark at Chelmsford on penultimate run but she never got involved there last time; now goes back up in trip after a short break but she needs to get back near best; eyeshields are removed and cheekpieces return.

runners.name: Rainwater

prev_owners.owner: M & M Racing, Paul Byrne And Partner

runners.comment: Well handicapped on best AW form and has claims if he can revive back in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Did well during the winter, with a Wolverhampton win (9.4f) and several frame efforts on Polytrack and Tapeta; no joy back on turf this spring but he's now only 1lb higher than for last win and has possibilities if he can revive back on AW.

runners.name: Ocean Odyssey

prev_owners.owner: J Kirkland & Mrs J M Ryan

runners.comment: Runaway win at Southwell and the drop back to 7f may have backfired last time; respected
runners.spotlight: Rejoined the Moores last month and he made an immediate impact with a runaway win off reduced mark at Southwell (1m); fluffed his lines when well treated under penalty at Chelmsford (fifth of 11) but the drop back to 7f may have backfired; 6lb higher now but he still looks feasibly treated on his penultimate form and is respected back up in trip.

runners.name: Adace
runners.comment: C&D winner who is on a workable mark and needs watching in market on her return
runners.spotlight: Went off the boil slightly in December/January on her last two starts but was in good form before that including a win here (7f) in October; returns after 139 days off but she's won over C&D in the past and she needs watching in market.

runners.name: Got No Dollars
runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford in January but he's been disappointing since and others are preferred
runners.spotlight: Recorded his seventh AW win when scoring at Chelmsford (1m, AW) in January but that was a narrow success in a small field and he's been disappointing in three runs since; others preferred.

runners.name: Cherry Hill
runners.comment: On reduced mark but she's been tailed off in last two runs and is now 1-18
runners.spotlight: Went close over C&D last October but diminishing returns since and she's been tailed off in her last two runs (AW/turf); record now stands at 1-18 and she's out of the weights on this return to Polytrack; no appeal.

stable_tour.quote: I'm very happy with her. I stepped her up to a mile at Kempton on her penultimate start but she didn't quite get home, and the return to seven furlongs at the same track on Monday did the trick, just getting up by a neck. 21-09-23

runners.name: Roundabout Silver
runners.comment: Didn't fire at Brighton last week and he's 4lb out of the weights back on AW; opposable
runners.spotlight: Some fair efforts at a variety of trips this year but he didn't fire at Brighton (1m) last week; cheekpieces now return but he's 4lb out of the weights on this return to AW and his last win was in 2023; opposable.

5:52.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Audere
runners.comment: Out of useful 5f-7f winner; first 2yo runner for yard this season and market should guide
runners.spotlight: February foal; third foal; dam 5f-7f winner (including 2yo Listed/AW; RPR 103), half-sister to Listed-placed 1m4f winner Tyson Fury, out of useful 6f 2yo winner; first 2yo runner for yard this season and market should guide.

runners.name: Coul Jane
runners.comment: Struggled in two AW runs (5f) last month and needs a transformation on this switch to turf
runners.spotlight: Out of a useful sprinter but she struggled in two AW runs (5f) last month and needs a transformation on this switch to turf.

runners.name: Mood Queen
runners.comment: Plenty to like on paper and she needs a close look on debut
runners.spotlight: January foal; first foal; dam 7f AW 2yo/1m turf winner (RPR 83), closely related to 6f Group 2 winner Lady Of The Desert, half-sister to winners King's Advice (smart 1m1f-1m6f) and Sanaadh (useful 5f-1m), out of unbeaten Cheveley Park winner Queen's Logic; plenty to like on paper and she needs a close look on debut.

runners.name: Nandita
runners.comment: 725,000gns yearling; ran well to a point on debut and should improve for that experience
runners.spotlight: 165,000gns foal, 725,000gns yearling; didn't live up to market expectations at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm; 11-4) two weeks ago but she ran well to a point behind some useful prospects in that race; should benefit from that experience and she looks a likely improver on her second start; yard won this in 2021 and 2023.

runners.name: Palmeira
runners.comment: Showed clear promise with debut third at Salisbury; big player if she can build on that
runners.spotlight: January foal out of a well-related 7f 2yo winner (RPR 76); pulled hard on recent Salisbury debut (5f, good to firm) but she still managed to finish well behind two rivals who pulled clear; that was a promising start at a biggish price and she's a big player if she can build on that.

runners.name: Quadrantids
runners.comment: Has useful pedigree but she could be one for longer trips later on
runners.spotlight: Seventh foal; sister to 1m/1m2f winner Tyrrhenian Sea (including Listed; RPR 115), half-sister to winners So I Told You (1m-10.5f including 2yo; 101) and Nivaldo (1m 2yo including AW; 91); dam 1m3f winner, closely related to German 1m4f Group 1 winners Nymphea and Nutan; has useful pedigree but she could be one for longer trips later on.

runners.name: Selmiya
runners.comment: Yard 27% with 2yos this season and this Acclamation filly is an interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 43,000euros yearling, 45,000gns 2yo breeze-ups; first foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Tupi (6f-1m Listed), Camdeboo (7f), Tukhoom (6f-1m) and Camelot Rakti (8.6f 2yo), out of Italian 1m Listed winner from family of 2,000 Guineas winner Mystiko; yard 27% with 2yos this season and this Acclamation filly is an interesting newcomer.

6:52.race_name: Try Unibet's Improved Acca Boosts Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.name: Pacific Prince
runners.comment: Well held in one run for Hugo Palmer last May; best watched on comeback for new yard
runners.spotlight: Bred to be useful but was well held at a biggish price on his Chepstow debut (7f, good to soft) last May; left Hugo Palmer for 2,000gns last summer and has been gelded since; now returns for new yard after a lengthy absence and is best watched.

runners.name: Booming
runners.comment: Tailed off in both runs for Harry Charlton and can only be watched on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-related 8.5f winner but he's been tailed off in two runs at around 1m for Harry Charlton this spring; hood worn last time is now removed and he needs a transformation dropped in trip for new yard.

runners.name: Both Of Us
runners.comment: 44,000euros yearling; has useful pedigree and he's an interesting newcomer
runners.spotlight: 44,000euros yearling; fifth foal; gelded half-brother to winners Spangled Mac (5f-7f including AW/Bahrain; RPR 106), Mrs U S A (5f 2yo; 80) and Power On (6f-1m2f including AW/Germany; 76); dam 8.6f AW winner (81), half-sister to 1m2f Group 3 winner Hannibal Barca; plenty to like on pedigree and he's an interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Khafiz
runners.comment: Well held on Newbury debut last spring and needs plenty of progress on comeback; hood on
runners.spotlight: 135,000gns foal; attracted some support into 10-1 on Newbury debut (6f, good) last spring but he faded before finishing 14th of 20; gelded since and he needs plenty of progress upped in trip after a year off; hood added.

runners.name: Nutmeg
runners.comment: Sets good standard on his initial form and 1m may have stretched him last time; key player
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns yearling; made a promising start when dead-heating for second at Southwell (7f AW) in March and the step up to 1m seemed to stretch him at Newbury (eighth of 12) last month; gelded since and cheekpieces are now added but he sets a good standard on his initial form and is a key player back in trip.

runners.name: Spy Chief
runners.comment: Ran green here (6f) 23 days ago but he should know much more this time; likely improver
runners.spotlight: Gelded 750,000gns yearling who's a half-brother to five winners, notably Al Suhail (Group 2) and Telecaster (Group 2); never involved after a slow start here (6f) three weeks ago but he made some late headway to finish sixth of 12; should know much more this time and he's a likely improver upped in trip; hood worn on debut is removed.

runners.name: Uniting
runners.comment: Two promising efforts at big prices this spring but he needs improvement on AW debut
runners.spotlight: Big prices in both runs this spring but he showed promise when fourth at Doncaster (7f, good) in March and ran to a similar level when a 4l fifth at Newbury 12 days ago; should run well again but he needs improvement to make a serious impact on AW debut.

runners.name: Cameley Days
runners.comment: Tailed off at 200-1 on her debut over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at 200-1 on her debut over C&D last month; hood worn in that race is now removed.

runners.name: Kamaway
runners.comment: 30,000gns yearling; drawn out wide on debut but she needs checking in market
runners.spotlight: 30,000gns yearling; third foal; half-sister to winners Ezaj (UAE 8.5f/1m3f dirt; RPR 88) and She Is Invincible (US 1m1f turf); dam unplaced 1m/1m3f (58), half-sister to 1m4f Group 3 winner Hazel Lavery (dam of 1m Group 1 winner The Revenant); drawn out wide on debut but she needs checking in market.

runners.name: Lastchancezouloon
runners.breeder: K A C Bloodstock & R J Hodges
runners.comment: Has plenty to find after 296 days off and handicaps will be more suitable
runners.spotlight: Well held in two 6f runs on turf last summer, with a best RPR of 58; has plenty to find after 296 days off and handicaps will be more suitable.

4:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.9)

runners.name: Kings Scholar
runners.comment: Continued the good work with reappearance win at Southwell; unraced on good/faster
runners.spotlight: Last season ended with a win (1m4f, soft) and a second (1m6f, soft) and he continued the good work with a reappearance win at Southwell (1m4f, AW) this month; strong claims if conditions suit (unraced on good/faster).

runners.name: Forza Orta
runners.comment: Has weakened quickly on both runs this term but a wind operation may have done the trick
runners.spotlight: 0-7 last year and has weakened quickly on both runs this term; however, a wind operation may have done the trick and his good course form and a dangerous mark suggest he's worth a second look.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Stayers Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: That was a good performance. Forza Orta had looked a bit one-paced over shorter distances so we decided to try something different. He got the trip well, we always thought he would eventually, and that opens an awful lot of avenues to us - Kevin Ryan, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We're aiming him at the Chester Cup but he'll probably need to win before then to get in. He travels strongly in his races, stays well and it would be lovely to get him into a race like that. We can look at all those staying races this season. 04-04-24

He is a very consistent gelding having finished in the first three in nine of his ten starts. Hamilton clearly suits him with both of his successes to date at the Scottish track, including last month over 1m5f. Last time out at Haydock he travelled like the winner but when he was let down on the quick ground it was too fast for him. He has an entry in the Duke of Edinburgh at Royal Ascot, although he may not get in off his mark. Should that be the case we will find him another race soon and I feel he is definitely going the right way. 15-06-22

runners.name: Sugar Road
runners.comment: Down the field in both handicaps but could get back on track for good yard at some stage
runners.spotlight: Six-race maiden who has finished down the field in both handicaps and needs to raise his game; however, he showed promise in maiden and novice events and could get back on track for his good yard at some stage.

runners.name: Sectarius
runners.comment: Made good start for this yard; disappointing when last seen but retains potential
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish 5yo who won on stable debut at Newcastle (1m4f, AW) last October and went close there (1m4f) next time; disappointing at Southwell (1m4f, AW) in December when last seen but a break may have helped and he retains potential; no surprise to see a big run on his reappearance.

runners.name: Letsbefrank
runners.owner: J S Morrison & Ms Carol Morrison
runners.comment: Course winner who is off last winning mark, but not at top of game on his 3 runs this year
runners.spotlight: Three wins last summer (1m3f-2m1f, good to soft-good to firm) and he's back to his last winning mark; however, he hasn't been at the top of his game on his three runs this year and could do without one of his slow starts.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Letsbefrank is getting very lethargic in his races and he was never on the bridle. He's tough and game, but the Johnston horse got a soft lead and you know they'll always keep going. But this horse keeps digging, he's tough. I'm lucky I'm the one pointing him, but this has been the plan for Jim and his team since the winter. He's had all the races mapped out, credit to him. To win one race is hard but to win three takes some doing - Paul Mulrennan, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been frustrating at the start of this year. We did such a good job with him last year, so it just swings and roundabouts. We've given him a couple of runs and he was a little bit better at Thirsk, but he was still playing games. I've taken my foot off the accelerator a bit and we're treating him for ulcers and various health things. He had quite a hard season last year so maybe we're paying for it, but I'm sure he'll bounce back. He's still got an engine. 07-05-25

runners.name: Tafsir
runners.comment: Five wins last year (three here); however, down the field on all three outings this season
runners.spotlight: Five wins last year, three of them here (various ground); however, she's finished down the field on all three outings this season (two here).

quotes.race: Racecourse Live Streams On Racing TV Extra Handicap
quotes.quote: Tafsir is a well-bred filly so it's good to get a win, but Paul's given her an absolute peach of a ride. He's gone down the brave man's route down the inside rail and has won quite comfortably in the end. She'll win again, especially with the assistance of Paul. He's top-class - Jim Goldie, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's challenging but she always has been. It's always been onwards and upwards with her and she has her own way of doing things. She probably needs to race herself fit. She probably needs a couple of runs to get there. It could have been a blindfold issue on her penultimate start and she doesn't make it easy for the jockeys as she knows the rhythm of the stalls and she starts to mess about - she plays games. She couldn't make an impression behind Faylaq at Hamilton last time. She was probably the cheapest of Hamdan's cast-offs and it looked like they were right, but now she's won more races than most of them. He bred her to be better than 78, so we don't know if her mark is too high. 07-05-25

runners.name: Savrola
runners.comment: Benefited from easy lead at Thirsk; this is tougher but still well treated on old form
runners.spotlight: Won at Musselburgh (1m4f, good to soft) on final run last season and reappeared with easy win at Thirsk (1m6f, good) this month; benefited from an easy lead last time and has a much tougher assignment today, but he remains well treated on his old form and could give another good account.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: We've struggled to find the key with Savrola but Paul [Mulrennan, jockey] obviously found that key - Dianne Sayer, trainer.

runners.name: Kitsune Power
runners.comment: Reappeared with near-miss at Thirsk; soundly beaten at York since but not discounted
runners.spotlight: Reappeared with near-miss at Thirsk (1m4f, good to firm) in April; he likes it there and was soundly beaten at York since, but he's capable of running well away from Thirsk and is not discounted; handles various ground.

quotes.race: William Hill Silver Cup Handicap
quotes.quote: We travelled really well around there, but didn't go as quickly as I thought they would do. It turned into a bit of a sprint, which we didn't really want, but I got Kitsune Power rolling 3f down. I'd say he'd easily get 1m4f in time. He was knocking on the door previously - Kevin Stott, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's one we bought at the Newmarket sale and he's been training well. He's come down in the weights and looks reasonably handicapped, although he couldn't go on the heavy ground at Ripon last week. We think his trip will be a mile and a quarter. 23-04-24

He has progressed with each run this year and after two wins and as many seconds he is now on an 18lb higher mark than he started. Last time out at Goodwood he was a little unlucky, getting stopped at a crucial time, yet still finished a running-on second of 16 over 1m1f. He has a couple of options later this month, and he can add to the brace he won earlier in the year. 17-08-22

runners.name: Alnayef
runners.comment: Very lightly raced 4yo; fair 4th on handicap/stable debut and may be able to build on that
runners.spotlight: Fair second at Kempton (1m4f, AW) last October on third and final run for the Gosden yard, and sold for 30,000gns later that month; fairly encouraging fourth of eight on this month's handicap and stable debut over C&D (good to firm) and he may be able to build on that performance.

stable_tour.quote: He's one we have from John and Thady Gosden and he could potentially be nice - he showed some promise behind Faylaq at Ayr on Sunday. He's big, 16.3hh, and a late-maturing type. He's not very quick but they don't need to be if they keep galloping. 07-05-25

runners.name: Destinado

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late K Abdullah

runners.comment: Always behind at Southwell last time but in good form previously and can't be ruled out
runners.spotlight: Returned to form to win at Doncaster (1m2f, good to soft) in March and went close at Lingfield (1m4f, AW) next time; always behind at Southwell (1m4f, AW) subsequently and it's hard to be overly confident on the back of that, but his previous good form this spring means he can't be ruled out.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Build A Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Destinado is a very tough horse who's been very consistent since he joined James. This is his trip, he broke well and travelled nicely throughout the race - Aidan Keeley, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely little horse who helped to put us on the map. He went off the boil a bit but ran really well again when he was third at Southwell just before Christmas. Unfortunately, when he won at Lingfield a few starts back, he won by too far, so he shot up in the handicap and we're just having to fight that a little bit at the moment. 01-01-25

runners.name: Clansman
runners.owner: Mrs C M Clarke, Foulrice Park Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Well handicapped on his two wins last April but not in same form more recently; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Two easy wins on heavy ground last April and well handicapped on that form; lots of rain would be a plus but his form has been mixed across his six starts since last September and others are more compelling; non-runner.

runners.name: Tokyo Bay
runners.comment: Won heavy-ground maiden at Ripon last April but he's failed to kick on since
runners.spotlight: Won heavy-ground maiden at Ripon (1m4f) last April on third start and he's dropped down the weights; however, he's failed to kick on since that win and has failed to threaten on either outing this spring.

runners.name: Two Auld Pals
runners.comment: Well beaten on last two starts but won this 12 months ago and rain may be a help
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at Southwell (2m, AW) in January and same story on sole run since, over this C&D (good to firm) 24 days ago; however, he may have needed that latest run and is 4lb lower than when winning this last year (soft); rain may be a help to his claims and he could bounce back.

runners.name: Cougar

prev_owners.owner: M Tabor & D Smith & Mrs J Magnier & Westerberg

runners.comment: His mark continues to tumble but he's hard to fancy on this year's evidence
runners.spotlight: His mark continues to tumble and it's possible this step back up in trip will be a plus, but he's hard to fancy on this year's evidence.

quotes.race: Value Cabs 3-Y-O Hurdle
quotes.quote: I thought Cougar was very keen which wouldn't be like him. He jumped great and it's great to have a horse like him in the yard. He doesn't mind these  conditions and it is great that he won, I'm delighted to have him. Mark said he jumped well and he is improving all the time. He is a horse to look forward to - Paudie Roche, trainer

quotes.race: gowranpark.ie 3-Y-O Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cougar is an exciting horse to get. When he got going Mark said he really got the hang of it. It was a lovely introduction - Padraig Roche, trainer.

runners.name: Fast Fred
runners.comment: First run on fast ground when 5th of 6 at Doncaster; may take step back in right direction
runners.spotlight: Only fifth of six at Doncaster 11 days ago but he was returning from a 77-day break and it was his first encounter with fast ground; won three in a row last autumn (1m2f/1m4f, soft/AW) and was in fair form earlier this year; could take a step back in the right direction today.

4:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.9)

runners.name: Oriental Prince
runners.comment: Five AW wins this year and off the mark on turf at Haydock last time; respected up 3lb
runners.spotlight: Five AW wins this year (5f/6f) and off the mark at the fifth attempt on turf at Haydock (7f, good to firm) last time, by a short head; ran okay on good to soft ground last year; versatile trip-wise and is just 3lb higher than last time; respected.

quotes.race: Pertemps Handicap
quotes.quote: I thought Oriental Prince had just held on. The race set up nicely, he relaxed and I was able to get a breather into him. He hasn't stopped improving yet - Paul Mulrennan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a brilliant all-weather season. We're at a crossroads with him because we're not sure if he's done enough or not, or if we need to change tactics. He's hard to catch on the all-weather but the turf is slightly different to the all-weather and we're not sure if we're going too hard or not hard enough. He's still quite an exciting horse. If you look at the sectionals at Musselburgh in a very strong race last month it was very good. We probably used up a lot of petrol with Gweedore and I think if we'd have been left alone then we'd have been first or second. That's Ayr Gold Cup form and we're taking on Class 2 handicappers, so he's interesting. He's obviously very fast. 07-05-25

runners.name: Pop Star
runners.comment: A return to form is needed but rain may help and he's from an in-form yard
runners.spotlight: Hit hard by the handicapper for last October's easy win at Bath (5.7f, soft) and merely eighth on both outings this season (5f, good to firm); however, rain may help and he's from an in-form yard; not ruled out.

quotes.race: Simonstown Maiden
quotes.quote: Pop Star got a setback and has missed a lot of time. He was quite green late on but I was more than happy with him. He is quick, if he gets seven he is definitely stakes class - Seamie Heffernan, rider.

runners.name: Illusionist
runners.comment: Didn't run badly on AW last month when back from absence and is below last winning mark
runners.spotlight: 8yo who hasn't been easy to win with in the last few years but he didn't run badly at Southwell (5f, AW) last month when back from an absence and rain would aid his cause; below his last winning mark; chance.

stable_tour.quote: He hasn't added to his four wins yet this season but he's running well and his big target will be the Ayr Gold Cup meeting. He has an entry for the big race but off his mark I suspect he'll run in the Bronze Cup. I may give him one run before then and after that he'll kick on until Christmas as he acts well on the  all-weather - particularly Newcastle. His handicap mark of 83 is fair, as he has won at York in the high 80s. I hope to find a race at York before the end of the year as his mark suggests he'd be very competitive there. 30-08-23

runners.name: Minnie Wildes
runners.comment: Won first two starts but hasn't threatened in either handicap; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Won last year on first two starts (6f, heavy/AW); came up short on handicap debut at Kempton (6f, AW) last October and likewise on last month's reappearance at Southwell (5f, AW), but this 4yo remains lightly raced and has travelled from Newmarket for today's engagement; non-runner.

runners.name: Orbital Chime
runners.owner: Making Headway Racing, Cassie And Wilson

prev_owners.owner: Making Headway Racing And K Scott

runners.comment: Shaped as though he may have needed his reappearance; on a handy mark; slow ground suits
runners.spotlight: Finished last on last month's stable and seasonal debut at Ayr but shaped as though he may have needed the run and he's on a handy mark on last year's best form; interesting if getting his preferred slow ground.

runners.name: Hurt You Never
runners.comment: Below par at Carlisle last time but 2-2 here and could bounce back with a bold show
runners.spotlight: Below par at Carlisle nine days ago but won over this C&D (good to firm) previously to make it 2-2 here; she's probably okay on slow ground; could bounce back with a bold show now back at Hamilton.

quotes.race: BetUK. It's Where The UK Bets Handicap
quotes.quote: She's a really game mare. I thought Hurt You Never might need the run but she showed she's in great form. Early on I thought I'd gone a bit quick but she just kept powering through - Mia Nicholls, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She's been a superstar for us. She hasn't stopped winning and she's honest and tough. The soft ground wasn't ideal for her at Doncaster last week, but she was 4lb well in, so we gave it a go and she ran well to finish fourth behind Jojo Rabbit. She's easy to train and ride. She's won ten times and there'll come a point where the handicapper will have a say, but she'll be winning again. 26-07-24

runners.name: Digital
runners.owner: Fine Claret Racing And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Major question mark regarding current form but he won twice over C&D last year
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at Thirsk only 11 days ago and there's a major question mark regarding current form; however, Hamilton brought out the best in him last season, with two C&D wins (good), and he's 7lb below his last winning mark; versatile ground-wise; interesting now back here for the first time in 2025.

quotes.race: Book Tickets For Ladies Night @hamilton-park.co.uk Handicap
quotes.quote: Ruth (Carr) just said to me, "I can't get Digital any better than he is, he's in real good form." - jockey Paul Mulrennan, speaking to Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: I've always held him in high regard. He jumped a little keen at Newbury and taking him back was probably the wrong thing to do. He hit the line well when third over six furlongs at Southwell so we have the option of that trip but he'll probably stay over five for now. He goes to York this week. 10-05-22

He came from Karl Burke at about this time last year and has won twice for us, both times at Hamilton, a course he likes. I was pleased with his run at Wolverhampton last week, even though he was only fifth of nine. He wants either a stiff 5f or an easy 6f. 09-04-25

runners.name: Parisiac
runners.comment: Down to a dangerous mark but soundly beaten on his four outings this year
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in last September's Ayr Bronze Cup and well treated on form as recent as December; however, he's been soundly beaten on his four outings this year and needs to turn things around.

quotes.race: MansionBet Proud To Support British Racing EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Parisiac was a bit keen early on but he finished the race really well. I gave him one backhander and he just went. I ride him everyday at home, he's a bit tricky but the boss gave me the opportunity to ride him and he showed his ability. He'll learn a lot from today - Gianluca Sanna, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's another I bought at the sales and he looks as though he could be quite nicely handicapped if you delve into his form. He appears to like a bit of soft ground and I hope the change of scenery might rekindle some of what he once had. I'm not sure he was suited by Hamilton on his first run for us and we may try him on a flat track. I'm sure he'll win races for us. He looks quick but sees 6f out well. 26-07-24

3:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.9)

runners.name: Lord Roxby
runners.owner: N Skinner D Jenkins T Goodair J Glover
runners.comment: 5f maiden winner last season; respectable efforts upped to 6f in recent handicaps
runners.spotlight: 5f maiden winner last season; stepped up to 6f this campaign, running well at Ripon and then getting behind before keeping on to some effect in another Class 4 at Doncaster; should run well.

runners.name: Dothan
runners.owner: Julie And David R Martin And Dan Hall
runners.comment: Needed all of the 5f to win at Doncaster off just 2lb lower; interesting returned to 6f
runners.spotlight: Progressed last season and made a successful return (having been gelded) when getting up on the line in a 5f Doncaster handicap (good to firm); has gone up only 2lb and is open to improvement back at 6f.

runners.name: Mr Cool
runners.comment: Made all in a 6f handicap at Nottingham before a disappointing run at Southwell
runners.spotlight: Made all in a 6f handicap at Nottingham before a disappointing run at Southwell; consistent in the main but probably on a high enough mark now.

runners.name: Mae Amor
runners.comment: Returned from a break to finish a 3l third in a new visor at Ripon (6f, good)
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f AW novice during the winter and returned from a break to finish a 3l third in a new visor at Ripon (6f, good); will need more off the same mark but that's feasible.

runners.name: Actin Like A Diva
runners.comment: Hasn't progressed from her maiden win and was tailed off on first run for current yard
runners.spotlight: 6f maiden winner in Ireland but then disappointed in three runs for John McConnell and was tailed off on debut for this yard over 7f at Wetherby (50-1); others preferred.

quotes.race: Irish EBF Auction Series Fillies Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Actin Like A Diva had a very good run at Cork first time, back on good ground today there was plenty of pace and she stayed well. If she hadn't been well beaten at Dundalk she never would have been 50-1 - Nathan Crosse, rider.

runners.name: Top Juggler
runners.comment: C&D maiden winner; later struggled in two handicaps; had wind op and now gelded
runners.spotlight: Won his maiden over C&D (soft) before coming up well short in two handicaps under the same conditions; has since had wind surgery and been gelded, so good reason to believe he might improve again at three.

runners.name: Military Girl
runners.comment: Dual 5f winner; latest run couldn't have been true and perhaps she needs the 6f now
runners.spotlight: Two wins over 5f, the latest a Catterick handicap off 4lb lower; always behind and outpaced at Nottingham (again on good to firm); that latest run couldn't have been true and perhaps she needs the 6f now.

runners.name: Defence Missile
runners.breeder: White Birch SC & Lynch Bages Ltd
runners.comment: No impact in 1m1f/1m handicaps for this yard at odds of 50-1 and 66-1
runners.spotlight: Formerly with Eve Johnson Houghton; no impact in 1m1f/1m handicaps for this yard at odds of 50-1 and 66-1.

runners.name: Stirrup Cup
runners.comment: Often a slow starter and that again the case on reappearance after being gelded
runners.spotlight: Nursery winner last season over 6f on soft off 6lb lower; often a slow starter and that was again the case on reappearance after being gelded; comes with risks.

runners.name: Who Wants Me
runners.breeder: J Hanly, Castlemartin Sky & Skymarc Far
runners.comment: Well behind in comeback race over 7f and questionable whether 6f is her trip
runners.spotlight: Beaten just over 3l in a nursery last season (7f, good) but finished well out the back on her comeback run when 33-1 at Wetherby; questionable whether 6f is her trip.

stable_tour.quote: She has a nice pedigree and looks as though she'll be more a three-year-old, from her physique. She ran very well at Carlisle, making the running until past the furlong pole - the jockey thought she was going to win. 26-07-24

runners.name: Arabian Cobra
runners.comment: No wins in 12 but returns to the right trip after not getting home over 7f last time
runners.spotlight: No wins in 12 but returns to the right trip after not getting home over 7f last time and has been placed in 6f handicaps; blinkered the last twice and the return of a visor might be no bad thing.

runners.name: Larchill Lass
runners.comment: Beaten fav in a seller last time but the winner has since run well in a handicap
runners.spotlight: 1-13; unable to justify short odds in a seller last time (5f; first-time cheekpieces) but did get pestered up front and the winner has since run well in a handicap; dropped 5lb since and won't mind returning to 6f; visor the choice of headgear here.

runners.name: No Nay Nevermind
runners.owner: S Jones, L Donaldson, K Elliott & I Codd

prev_owners.owner: S Jones, L Donaldson, I Jardine & I Codd

runners.comment: Minor promise last season; 125-1 for handicap debut on the AW (7f) and finished last
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit last season over 6f but still went off at 125-1 for handicap debut on the AW (7f) and finished last.

runners.name: East Tyrone
runners.comment: Nursery winner at York last season but hasn't progressed; comeback run was quiet
runners.spotlight: Won a 6f nursery at York last season but gelded afterwards and there's been no further progress; made a quiet return after wind surgery.

quotes.race: John Smith's Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: East Tyrone ran a great race on debut. Beverley was a run too quick after that but he's shown what he's capable of. We've always liked him. There's more to come and he'll improve with racing - Adam Ryan, assistant trainer.

2:00.race_name: Amac Roofing Sheeting & Cladding EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
2:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.9)

runners.name: Azizam
runners.comment: One of two newcomers for trainer who is enjoying an excellent season with his 2yos
runners.spotlight: 46,000euros foal, £46,000 yearling; fourth foal; Havana Grey half-brother to 6f 2yo winner Sweet Sonata (RPR 73); dam 1m AW winner (59) from talented family; one of two newcomers for trainer who is enjoying an excellent season with his 2yos; one to consider, and the betting could be informative.

runners.name: Gemmethegreenlite
runners.comment: £125,000 yearling; trainer had 2yo Listed winner recently but this debut run may be needed
runners.spotlight: 43,000euros foal, £125,000 yearling; by Blue Point; fifth foal; closely related to Italian Listed-placed 1m/1m1f winner, half-brother to Italian winners Miss Profile (7f/1m1f) and Gaeli (5f/6f inc 2yo); trainer had a 2yo Listed winner recently but his newcomers tend to improve for the run.

runners.name: Kodigara
runners.comment: Takes on some very interesting newcomers but sets a good standard for them to aim at
runners.spotlight: Improved upon last month's debut at Musselburgh (5f, good) to finish second of three there (5f, good) last time, behind Meelaf who went close in the Hilary Needler at Beverley on Saturday; takes on some very interesting newcomers but sets a good standard for them to aim at.

runners.name: Mo Of Cairo
runners.comment: 135,000gns 2yo breeze-ups; half-brother to nine winners; could go well on debut
runners.spotlight: 85,000euros yearling, 135,000gns 2yo breeze-ups; 12th foal; Havana Grey half-brother to nine winners including Up Above (5f 2yo; RPR 94) and Thora Barber (6f/6.5f including 2yo; 88); in good hands; could go well on debut.

runners.name: Storm Force
runners.comment: 230,000gns 2yo breeze-ups; purchase price catches eye and trainer does well with 2yos here
runners.spotlight: 95,000euros yearling, 230,000gns 2yo breeze-ups; Starspangledbanner half-brother to winners Janoobi (7f/1m; RPR 103), Celtic Chieftain (5f 2yo; 84) and Lumacho (5f 2yo; 76); dam 5f/6f winner (including 2yo; 99); purchase price catches the eye and his trainer does very well with 2yos here.

runners.name: Victor Cee
runners.comment: Represents top northern trainer, who also saddles fellow newcomer Azizam; watch betting
runners.spotlight: 60,000gns foal; eighth foal; Victor Ludorum half-brother to five winners including Amy C (French/US 5f-8.5f including 2yo/Grade 3; RPR 102) and Albert Cee (6f, RPR 91); represents top northern trainer, who also saddles fellow newcomer Azizam; possible player; watch the betting.

runners.name: Dakota Dawn
runners.comment: 4th of 5 on debut at Ripon; it was a hot little race but she needs a sizeable step forward
runners.spotlight: £52,000 yearling who was 25-1 when fourth of five on last month's debut at Ripon (5f, good); that was a hot little race and she's open to improvement, but she needs a sizeable step forward to make an impact today.

3:00.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.9)

runners.name: Swift Salian
runners.comment: Just one win, in 2yo handicap; running well off reduced mark this year; has big run in him
runners.spotlight: Just one win, in a 2yo handicap (1m, good to soft), but he was high in the weights for much of 2024 and has returned in good form off a reduced mark this year, not giving up his lead lightly at Thirsk (1m, good to firm) in April; looks good for a big run.

runners.name: Al Mudhaffar
runners.comment: Won maiden in Ireland as 3yo; respectable yard debut but ordinary form since; non-runner
runners.spotlight: Winner of 1m AW maiden in Ireland as 3yo; respectable yard debut in August (Polytrack) but in ordinary form on AW and turf since; has something to prove at present; non-runner.

runners.name: Arkenstaar
runners.comment: Five wins here, including this in 2024; not quite at best but revival looks imminent
runners.spotlight: All five wins here, including this race last year, on ground ranging from good to firm to soft; not yet back to full strength but hinted at a revival when meeting some trouble in running over C&D last time and refitting cheekpieces could also help (went close when first wearing them in August).

quotes.race: Hampton By Hilton Onsite Hotel Handicap
quotes.quote: We'll aim to go back to the track as Arkenstaar has never run a bad race there. I thought he showed a great attitude because he was being attacked from both sides. My biggest concern when speaking to Connor [Beasley, jockey] before was that there didn't look like there'd be any pace on, and he grinds it out more than anything. I'm really pleased with him, though - Michael Dods, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's won five races, all of them at Hamilton. There were no options at Hamilton recently but he likes a track with a hill finish - Hamilton, Carlisle, Pontefract, Beverley - so he ran last time out at Pontefract. He ran a good race in second behind Zozimus, a well-handicapped horse for David O'Meara. He just got shuffled out of it at the start and was probably further back than Connor Beasley would have liked but he came home strongly. I hope he can go one better next time. 28-08-24

runners.name: Blufferonthebus
runners.comment: Latest win over about 7f last July; kept to 6f and 7f since but has won at 1m
runners.spotlight: Beverley winner (about 7f, soft) last July; has been kept to 6f and 7f since finishing last of six over 1m1f here in August but she has won over 1m and the return to turf could suit after finishing close up on the AW (7f) in April.

runners.name: Harswell Duke
runners.comment: On losing run but well treated and ran well on AW return; non-runner
runners.spotlight: On a losing run of more than two years but he found only one, who was on a hat-trick, too good on recent return at Southwell (1m, AW); well treated on form as recent as last spring and the more rain to fall the better; non-runner.

quotes.race: Pertemps Network Spring Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: Everything was perfect for Harswell Duke today. The soft ground is what he needs - Roger Fell, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Extra Places Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Harswell Duke is a tough horse and we've waited all year for this soft ground. We've always thought a lot of him and we had a few quid on him; he was 6-1 last night. He's declared for Nottingham on Wednesday but we'll probably give him a break and go for the Spring Mile next year - Mike Kirby, part of Harswell Thoroughbred Racing, owners.

quotes.race: Watch On Racing TV Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: Harswell Duke found plenty and had been crying out for this softer ground. He was gutsy there to fend off the second.- Jason Hart, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He won the Spring Mile for us last year. He's run really well when things have fallen into place for him - he needs soft or heavy ground and a good pace to aim at on a stiff track. He was only just beaten at Pontefract in April and then six days later he was just touched off again at Wetherby. He's dying to land one soon, it's just getting the ground right for him. He's never let us down on testing ground, so he could have a run at Haydock soon. His main target would be a mile handicap at Nottingham on October 2 - you'd hope he'll get his conditions then. He'll probably have a bit of a break during the summer while the ground is like it is. 21-06-24

runners.name: Spun To Gold
runners.comment: AW winner as 2yo for first yard; not beaten many rivals for this one; hard to enthuse
runners.spotlight: AW winner as 2yo but he's had a quiet start for this yard, not beating many rivals, including when finishing remote at Musselburgh in April; down further 4lb but hard to enthuse; one of three for yard.

runners.name: Dingwall
runners.comment: Off the mark with 1m2f win in July; better for recent comeback; trip query over shorter
runners.spotlight: Off the mark with a convincing win when upped to 1m2f at Ayr (good) last July; had few suitable opportunities since and ran as though he'd come on for the run back at Ayr this month; however, he has a trip question back over shorter and any softening of the ground would be a query too.

stable_tour.quote: His work has always been very good at home and we've found the key to him after running him over the wrong trip to begin with. He never got involved first time this year over 7f and we tried a mile at Hamilton but he ran far too free in blinkers, so we put a hood on over 1m2f at Ayr and it worked a treat. I couldn't believe he'd slipped down to a mark of 56 as he's a lovely horse and I hope he'll be on an upward curve now. There are plenty of opportunities for him. 26-07-24

runners.name: Ayr Poet
runners.owner: Adam Mills And Jonnie Delta Racing
runners.comment: Multiple wins include 3 here; in good form and current mark well within reach; bang there
runners.spotlight: Multiple wins include three over 1m1f here and he comes here in good form, with a narrow C&D defeat (good to firm; has won on soft) 12 days ago; back up 2lb but this mark is well within reach; bang there with rain about.

quotes.race: Bet At racingtv.com Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Ayr Poet was super and took me the full way. I just sat there and he did his job. I thought coming to the two-furlong pole that he's travelling very well and then I thought today might be the day for that first winner. Jim said let him jump and sit handy and if not, don't panic and he'd be good for me. There's no racing in my family at all and I'm continuing as an amateur as I'm a bit heavy for an apprentice licence, but Jim's been so generous in helping young people like me progress - Megan Davies, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Tennent's Lager Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I thought we had it on the line but we did it the tough way. Ayr Poet knows where the winning post is here. He's a good doer and is from a family we've done well with here, as he's the fourth winner out of his dam, with Euchen Glen and Sir Chauvelin both running this week too - Jim Goldie, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: His brother wasn't too bad as a 12-year-old and I'm sure he'd be quite good as a 13-year-old if I kept him going. He'll win more races, I wouldn't be keeping him going if I didn't think I could. It's been a very lucky family for me. 07-05-25

runners.name: Bellasio
runners.comment: Runner-up on 2yo debut; just 4 runs since, shaping quite nicely over 7f (AW) latest
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on 2yo debut on AW; limited promise in just four runs since but he did his best work late at Southwell (7f, AW) recently on return from 11 months off and he's worth another go at 1m; open to improvement.

runners.name: Jaminoz
runners.comment: Three wins here, at 1m1f-1m3f; not badly treated but work to do over this short a trip
runners.spotlight: Three of four wins on this track, over 1m1f, 1m4f and 1m3f, on good to soft or slower ground; not badly treated but this hasn't been his trip in previous C&D attempts.

runners.name: Jannas Journey
runners.comment: Big prices and minor form for L Russell, including on handicap debut (AW) in November
