runners.spotlight: Big prices and minor form for Lucinda Russell, including on handicap debut at Newcastle (7f, AW) in November; trainer going well but Ayr Poet is a more obvious contender for the yard.

5:03.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.9)

runners.name: Joyful Sound
runners.comment: Promising in qualifying runs at up to 1m2f; can improve now handicapping at 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Dam bred three Group 1 winners in Italy, two at 1m4f; has run with plenty of credit in qualifying events, considering 1m was inadequate on first two starts before denied a clear run when building up to a challenge at Windsor (1m2f, good to firm) this month; can improve now handicapping at 1m4f.

runners.name: Trojan Soldier
runners.comment: Came from way back to take a late 2nd on handicap debut (1m2f); worth a go at 1m4f
runners.spotlight: Pedigree more about sprint trips on the dam's side but he came from a long way back to take a late second of six on 1m2f handicap debut at Beverley (good) in April; worth a go at 1m4f but this could be a warm race.

runners.name: Gentle Warrior
runners.breeder: Irish National Stud Mare Syndicate II
runners.owner: Hambleton Racing Ltd Xxxv & E Burke
runners.comment: Dour staying 2yo who made light of 1m2f on heavy; better for comeback; 1m4f can suit
runners.spotlight: Dour stayer who made light of 1m2f on heavy ground at Nottingham in October; up 9lb and the return to good ground didn't help there (1m2f) in April when having to be switched cost him momentum; still ran encouragingly, though, and he looks sure to do better over 1m4f with rain about.

runners.name: Hi Ya Mal
runners.comment: Two fair runs in 1m4f AW handicaps; strong stayers in pedigree so might need even further
runners.spotlight: Two fair runs in 1m4f AW handicaps; likely needs more for the return to turf and longer trips might be his destiny as dam was a 1m6f Listed winner who finished third in the 2m4f Ascot Stakes, and whose winning offspring include a 2m winner; still not ruled out for yard that won this in 2024.

runners.name: Eagle Strike
runners.breeder: Michel Dardenne, Scea Haras De Gratte Pa

prev_owners.owner: Yorkshire Moors I & Hzs Stainless Steel

runners.comment: Some promise over inadequate 7f; this is more realistic but takes big step up in trip
runners.spotlight: Bred to appreciate 1m2f and that's the way it's been looking over 7f on AW this year, making some late inroads without threatening each time; open to improvement on handicap debut but stamina remains the key question over this far; had wind surgery after debut, now tongue tied.

runners.name: Bruce Banner
runners.comment: Made it 2-3 over 1m4f on AW when making all at Newcastle; more on plate back on turf
runners.spotlight: Has run for three different trainers in as many starts, making it 2-3 over 1m4f on AW when making all from a subsequent winner at Newcastle in April; needs to show he can do it back on turf against unexposed rivals.

runners.name: Jedhi Knight
runners.comment: Kept on for 3rd over 1m6f on handicap debut; more to do over 1m4f in a higher grade
runners.spotlight: Little to show for efforts before switching to a 1m6f handicap at Redcar (1m6f, good to firm) last week, when keeping on to take third of eight; has more to prove over this trip in a higher grade.

2:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to soft in places (GoingStick: 7.9)

runners.name: Balayaged
runners.comment: Makes handicap debut after 292 days off; wouldn't be certain to appreciate the longer trip
runners.spotlight: Looked promising when second of 12 on her Doncaster debut (7f, good to firm) last summer, but didn't build on it in two subsequent starts; makes her handicap debut after 292 days off and worth a market check, though she wouldn't be certain to appreciate the longer trip on breeding.

runners.name: Obito
runners.comment: Has shown ability in all three starts; of interest now switched to a handicap
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns breeze-up purchase; has shown ability in all three starts since his debut in March and looked to face a stiff task when third of six in a maiden over C&D (good to firm) this month (runner-up has since won a Goodwood handicap off a mark of 86); of interest now switched to a handicap himself; stable also runs Cymbidium.

stable_tour.quote: A big scopey horse who made his debut last month. He tends to be a bit keen, so we rode him cold and he encountered traffic problems. He has the potential to win his maiden and be a decent horse later in the season. 14-04-25

runners.name: A War Eagle
runners.comment: Placed in two of his three starts; makes handicap debut having been gelded; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of his three starts, including when third of 15 in a first-time hood (now discarded) in Thirsk maiden (7f, good; winner, second and fourth won next time) last month; makes his handicap debut having been gelded since last seen and no problem with the return to this trip; shortlisted.

runners.name: Moutai
runners.comment: Nicely bred and not the biggest surprise were he to show more now handicapping
runners.spotlight: 225,000euros breeze-up 2yo; not without ability in three midfield finishes over 7f/1m (gelded before latest outing); nicely bred and not the biggest surprise were he to show more now handicapping.

runners.name: Cymbidium
runners.comment: Patchy form since her successful nursery debut at Thirsk last September; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Patchy form since making a successful nursery debut at Thirsk (1m, good) last September; may be suited by the return to this trip but others hold more compelling claims.

stable_tour.quote: She's the first yearling we've bought who has managed to win, although we've had only a handful. It was a sweet success at Thirsk having gone on that journey with her. She showed a really good attitude and appreciated being stepped up to a mile. She ran well at Ayr last week over 7f but she wants to go back up to a mile. She's a well-bred filly from the family of Study Of Man. She's not a big filly but she stays really well and has a good attitude. She'll stay further than a mile and there should be more improvement from her. 26-09-24

runners.name: Springbok
runners.comment: Some promise last year but out of the frame in both handicaps since returning last month
runners.spotlight: 125,000gns yearling; showed some promise last year but out of the frame in both handicaps since returning (having been gelded) last month; drop in trip may help but a few others make greater appeal.

runners.name: Impartiality
runners.comment: Made a winning return at Beverley last month; considered from 3lb higher
runners.spotlight: Form rather regressed last year, but he was gelded during the winter and made a successful return when edging out a subsequent winner (first two clear) at Beverley (7f, good) last month; longer trip should be within range on breeding and considered from 3lb higher.

runners.name: Say What You See
runners.comment: Easy winer of a Newcastle nursery last November but virtually pulled up on his return
runners.spotlight: Won by 8l on nursery debut at Newcastle (1m, AW) last November and ran well under his penalty at Redcar (1m, soft) four days later, but was virtually pulled up on last month's Chelmsford return; a player on his best form, but he does have a question to answer.

runners.name: Sands Of Indi
runners.comment: Runner-up in her first two starts, but has failed to build on it in four outings since
runners.spotlight: Seemed likely to win races when runner-up in her first two starts at Pontefract (6f, good to firm) and Newcastle (7f, AW) last year, but has failed to build on it in four outings since; cheekpieces made little difference last time; enough to prove.

runners.name: Unforgetable Belle
runners.comment: Won a Leicester nursery last October; might need a deluge now back on turf
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on previous efforts when making winning nursery debut at Leicester (7f, heavy) last October; may have needed last month's Wolverhampton return (8.6f, AW) but she might need a deluge now back on turf.

runners.name: Sure And Stedfast
runners.comment: In the frame in three of his six starts; this stiffer track may suit; possible outsider
runners.spotlight: In the frame in three of his six starts and hasn't always enjoyed the clearest of runs in his other outings; gelded since last seen and this stiffer track may suit; possible outsider.

runners.name: Top Bins
runners.comment: Well held in all three handicaps and has something to prove up in trip; blinkers on
runners.spotlight: Promise in his first three starts in 6f novices last autumn (soft/heavy), but well held in three handicaps over 7f on good/AW since then (gelded before latest outing); down another 5lb, but something to prove up in trip with blinkers now given a go.

3:48.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.18 +42yds, 2.48 +53yds, 3.18 & 4.48 +12yds, 3.48 +18yds and 4.18 +62yds)

runners.name: Deise Aba

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late Trevor Hemmings

runners.comment: Up and down for this yard but ran okay in a Class 2 at Ascot the last time
runners.spotlight: Nearly made a successful stable debut at Wincanton (3m2f, good) in October, after a layoff; twice disappointed afterwards but ran okay in a Class 2 at Ascot last time; won't be overly inconvenienced should conditions ease.

quotes.race: Glenfarclas Cross Country Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Deise Aba has run great and jumped beautifully. Unfortunately at the second last he was a bit slow and lost some momentum at it but he has run really well. It maybe cost him first place, but I'm not totally sure that it did. He hasn't been around here instead we went to a cross country course near us which were allowed to go and get qualified. He was good down there. He had totally lost his way he just needed something to spark him up a bit. There is nothing wrong with him as he has always had plenty of ability. I think a change of scenery and the different obstacles have helped him. We might come back here for the Festival but that is off level weights and will be a different job - Philip Hobbs, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was sixth at Aintree on Saturday. The London National would be an obvious race for him as he tends to run well at Sandown. 08-11-22

He's not won yet this season but three seconds from four runs tells you that he is in good heart and running well. The handicapper has raised him 10lb during that time, but that has helped his cause of getting in the Grand National, for which he has been allotted 10st 2lb, and he is 58th on the list to get in, so it is in the lap of the gods. If he gets balloted out then we have an alternative plan which is the bet365 Gold Cup at Sandown on the final day of the season. He has finished second at Aintree and this season while at Sandown he has filled the same position twice. We know he stays very well so hopefully he will get in the National. 16-03-22

runners.name: Investment Manager
runners.comment: Often leads; has five wins and five seconds to show from 12 previous visits to this track
runners.spotlight: Often leads; has five wins and five seconds to show from 12 previous visits to this track, including a win in this 12 months ago (on soft); returns off a 3lb lower mark and latest 12l defeat here was on good ground that would have been on the lively side; every chance with rain forecast.

stable_tour.quote: He's been in excellent form and we're going to look at regional Nationals for him, maybe at Plumpton or the Devon National at Exeter. It'd be good to have a dabble at those long-distance races as he travels well through his races. The wind op this year has got him going and he's been very consistent with it. 10-11-23

runners.name: Kick Up A Storm
runners.comment: Brings potential into his chasing career but the forecast rain is worrying
runners.spotlight: Brings potential into his chasing career but all three hurdle wins were on good ground (2m7f-3m) and he struggled on good to soft the last time (November); the weather forecast is worrying.

quotes.race: DragonBet Born From The Betting Ring Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: This is the perfect track for Kick Up A Storm, a big, stiff, galloping track as he found Wincanton sharp enough the last day and he loves this ground. He's been on the go for a while and I keep thinking he needs a break but while he keeps winning and we can find some ground good, he'll keep going - Paul Nicholls, trainer talking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Planned Paradise
runners.comment: Exposed but arrives here in fair nick and with form over much further he'll keep going
runners.spotlight: Thoroughly exposed but arrives here in fair nick and with form over much further he'll keep going; fine on all ground.

runners.name: Hold Your Fort
runners.comment: Boasts four wins over C&D and ran another sound race here two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Boasts four wins over C&D and ran another sound race here two weeks ago, for all that he was no match for the winner; hard to knock.

4:18.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to firm in places (GoingStick: 7.1) (Watering) (Rail Movements: 2.18 +42yds, 2.48 +53yds, 3.18 & 4.48 +12yds, 3.48 +18yds and 4.18 +62yds)

runners.name: Paddy De Pole
runners.comment: All wins on good but was second to a course specialist on soft here in September
runners.spotlight: In this month last year he completed a good-ground hat-trick in winning at Hereford (2m3f) when 6lb lower; coped okay with the soft when second to course specialist Investment Manager here in September; chance.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At PlanetSportBet Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Paddy De Pole struggled in the winter on really deep ground, but has done well in his three runs on faster ground. I expect he'll run somewhere before the end of next week before we go novice chasing during the summer - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

quotes.race: Weatherbys nhstallions.co.uk Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: The ground hasn't been in Paddy de Pole's favour but now on good ground he was awesome today. The ground makes so much difference, he was jumping lovely - Freddie Gingell, jockey, speaking to Sky Racing

runners.name: Bagheera Ginge
runners.comment: Potentially well handicapped on this return to hurdling and could be better for a break
runners.spotlight: Chasing when last seen, going close here before two lesser runs; potentially well handicapped on this return to hurdling; peak form is on good ground.

runners.name: Escapologist
runners.comment: Maiden winner; well held in his two handicaps but both were stronger races than this
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner who has been beaten about 18l (2m4f) and 11l (3m) in his two handicaps but both were competitive Class 2 races; respected at this easier level with cheekpieces now turned to; has form on good and soft.

runners.name: Striking A Pose
runners.owner: S Clare G Kennington C Knowles & J Reed

prev_owners.owner: I & C Gosden, M Sharp & G Kennington

runners.comment: Beat one other finisher last time but remains well handicapped on older form
runners.spotlight: Only two finished when edging home at Warwick (3m1f, good) but he's well handicapped on old form and the forecast rain will if anything aid his prospects.

quotes.race: Kenn Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Striking A Pose is rated 130 so he was supposed to win like that. He's a nice chap and a gorgeous-looking horse and it was nice to watch all the way round - his ears were pricked and he didn't put a foot wrong. I think 2m4f is perfect, he's got a bit of class about him so he's not short of speed. I'm sure he'll end up over 3m but this trip is fine on genuine soft ground. I don't think we'll step him up to three this season. We've got some options now, he's qualified for the EBF Final at Sandown in a couple of weeks. He's probably not an Albert Bartlett horse but he might be competitive at Sandown, or he could go to Aintree. I expect we'll lean to Sandown. He'll be a lovely chaser for next season - Joe Tizzard, assistant to trainer Colin Tizzard.

quotes.race: Racing TV Profits Returned To Racing "National Hunt" Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Striking A Pose has learnt his job over two miles and the form from Ascot looked quite nice. He's a point-to-point winner so stepping him up in trip worked a treat. He's a gorgeous-looking four-year-old and is a nice horse who's at the right end of the handicap who we hope will continue progressing through the ranks. He'll go over fences next season and he won't run again until the new year. - Joe Tizzard, assistant trainer

stable_tour.quote: He just seems to love it at Exeter. We could back over fences soon but he was third the other day and that was a good run, so we'll probably pick and choose with him. The handicapper has had his say with him though. 07-11-24

runners.name: Teorie
runners.comment: Early days for this yard and after wind surgery; positive performances the last twice
runners.spotlight: His third run after wind surgery and second for this yard when beaten a head at Exeter (2m5f); stayed on well for an 8l sixth at Worcester (2m4f; again on good; handles softer) last time; considered on this return to further.

stable_tour.quote: He's new to me this season and I was worried before his first run on the Flat because he'd shown me nothing in his work but he ran a perfectly sound race and has another run at Nottingham on Wednesday. He will return to hurdling later this season and he showed some decent form last season. 07-11-24

runners.name: Al Sayah
runners.comment: One Flat win and three hurdle victories, doing it comfortably in the end over C&D latest
runners.spotlight: One Flat win and three hurdle victories, doing it comfortably in the end over C&D three weeks ago (good); might well cope with the 6lb rise and any rain shouldn't hurt her chances.

runners.name: Borderline
runners.comment: Has each-way claims on his best form and has undergone wind surgery since last seen
runners.spotlight: No wins in 13; has each-way claims on his best form and has undergone wind surgery since last seen; could have a part to play if resuming in good order; 1lb out of the weights.

runners.name: Grayland

runners.name: Jack N Jones
runners.comment: Behind Late Note in her final bumper; was favourite so perhaps off colour
runners.spotlight: All runs on good ground; winning pointer; runner-up in a Plumpton bumper on her return from a long absence but then failed favourite backers at Fakenham when behind Last Note; had no excuses from the front that day but perhaps she was off colour.

stable_tour.quote: Has been given time to mature and strengthen since she won in March last year. She'll also start out in a bumper before going novice hurdling. 06-11-24
She was a cosy winner of her point-to-point and looks a more than useful prospect, especially when she goes over hurdles, but a bumper run will come first. 28-09-23

runners.name: Last Note
runners.comment: Promising bumper run but was a long way behind Sharp Glance on hurdle debut
runners.spotlight: Had Jack N Jones behind when second in a Fakenham bumper but she was tailed off on her switch to hurdles at Warwick (2m, good), where Sharp Glance was well ahead of her in third.

runners.name: Miss Jaffa Cake
runners.comment: Failed to complete in two points and likely up against it here on rules debut
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in two points and likely up against it here on rules debut.

runners.name: Sharp Glance
runners.comment: Plenty of promise in bumpers and again when third on hurdling debut at Warwick
runners.spotlight: Plenty of promise in bumpers (on good to soft and soft) and again when third on hurdling debut at Warwick (good) where she travelled well deep into the race; looks the one to be with.

runners.name: And She Was
runners.breeder: Mill House Stud & Alan King Racing
runners.comment: A weak 22-1 chance when beaten 20l in a Huntingdon bumper
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to six winners but she was a weak 22-1 chance when beaten 20l in a Huntingdon bumper; could be capable of better.

runners.breeder: Haras De Saint Voir Sca & Mr Joel Denis
runners.comment: Maiden but has shown enough to be of interest and last run was too bad to be true
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden (0-7 chasing); bitterly disappointing when one of the favourites at Southwell last time but had previously gone close at Doncaster (3m, good to soft); has races in him off this mark, even over this shorter trip.

runners.name: Daring Plan
runners.owner: Miss Jane Edgar & D V Gardner
runners.comment: First run after wind surgery when rallying for a close third at Fontwell 13 days ago
runners.spotlight: Ten defeats under rules include five over fences; however, it was his first run after wind surgery when rallying for a close third at Fontwell 13 days ago (2m3f, good); considered.

runners.spotlight: Only win in 20 starts came over hurdles here last September off 1lb lower; had wind surgery ahead of this chasing debut and hard to rule out, for all that she's not bred for fences.

runners.name: Tellairsue
runners.comment: Capable hurdler but rarely impresses with his jumping and this is his chase debut
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced since sole success in a handicap hurdle more than two years ago; competitive this year over hurdles but rarely impresses with his jumping and this is his chase debut.

runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way at Ffos Las three weeks ago, after a break of 204 days, but has been competitive over fences (2m5f-3m1f) and might be sharper for that recent outing.

runners.name: Sevenofus
runners.comment: Twice placed over fences (0-7) and twice runner-up over hurdles this year
runners.spotlight: Twice placed over fences (0-7) and twice runner-up over hurdles this year; latest run wasn't her best (also over hurdles) but she goes on all ground and the form is there to feature.

runners.name: Blue Ribbon
runners.comment: Winning hurdler; no wins in 11 over fences and hard to make a compelling case
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler; no wins in 11 over fences and hard to make a compelling case; finished last of the four to complete here three weeks ago.

runners.name: Market House
runners.comment: Third Flat win for this yard last week at Brighton; good run over hurdles before that
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish gelding who has had seven races for James Owen and won three times on the Flat, the latest last week at Brighton (1m4f, good); wasn't beaten far over hurdles the time before; should go well, though soft ground could be an issue.

runners.name: Holy Legend
runners.comment: Beaten 29l on handicap debut last time but was only 5-1 so perhaps capable of better
runners.spotlight: His thirds at Uttoxeter were quite remote, as was his fourth when only 5-1 for his handicap debut there in November (on soft); presumably thought capable of a bit better.

runners.name: Privilege
runners.comment: Wasn't far away at Chepstow two runs back and made a bad mistake next time
runners.spotlight: Flat winner who is 0-14 over hurdles; however, wasn't far away at Chepstow two runs back and made a bad mistake next time at Ffos Las; possible; seems to handle any ground.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him off Jessica Harrington. He won his maiden on the Flat for her and showed good form in handicaps. He has jumped well since he joined us and will be ready to start off at Fairyhouse next week and hopefully on to Leopardstown over Christmas. H's owned by The Adders Partnership, who have been lucky with me, as they had Xsquared. Hopefully this lad can give them plenty of fun. 08-12-21

runners.name: La Trattaria
runners.comment: Unexposed profile for handicaps and she's a 4yo filly getting the allowances
runners.spotlight: A glimmer of promise in two French hurdles and again when a 14l runner-up in a novice for mares at Fontwell; unexposed profile for handicaps and she's a 4yo filly getting the allowances.

runners.name: Hurst Hill
runners.comment: Placed the last time she ran on soft ground so rain would bring her into it
runners.spotlight: 0-9; beaten under 6l at Fontwell three runs back (2m5f, soft) but has followed that with remote finishes; does like cut underfoot so rain would bring her into it.

runners.name: Yenaled Dream
runners.comment: Showed very little in five Irish starts, the latest a handicap at Ballinrobe in April
runners.spotlight: Showed very little in five Irish starts, the latest a 2m5f handicap at Ballinrobe in April (100-1).

runners.name: Crystal Mer
runners.comment: Last seen at Plumpton a year ago when beaten 12l into third; has races in him
runners.spotlight: In the same colours but with Paul Webber when a 12l third in a 2m good-ground handicap at Plumpton 12 months ago; likely contender if resuming in similar form; ran well in a bumper on soft ground.

runners.name: Kentucky Bluegrass
runners.comment: Behind Privilege at Ffos Las despite that rival making a bad mistake
runners.spotlight: Underwhelming form in handicaps and behind Privilege at Ffos Las despite that rival making a bad mistake.

runners.name: Saucats
runners.breeder: S A R L Ecuries Babsen Courses
runners.comment: Ex-French; opposable on his form in four British hurdles, the first two for David Pipe
runners.spotlight: Ex-French; opposable on his form in four British hurdles, the first two for David Pipe; this new headgear combination did nothing for him here three weeks ago.

runners.name: Mr Le Philosophe
runners.breeder: Societe Civile De L'Ecurie De Meautry
runners.comment: Nearly won on last week's stable debut at Warwick and good chance here off same mark
runners.spotlight: Two 1m4f wins in France on good to soft and very soft; regressed for previous yard but very nearly made a winning start for James Owen last week at Warwick (2m, good; 5-4f); every chance of going one better off the same mark.

stable_tour.quote: We bought him from France and he was very disappointing at the start of the year. The mistake we probably made was trying him as a juvenile hurdler as it didn't work. He was fit and we kept going with him, but sometimes horses from France need time to acclimatise and come to themselves. He's got a lot to prove and has shown nothing since we've had him, but he's a rarity in that his hurdles mark is lower than his Flat one. We're going to try to run him in a handicap hurdle in November after his summer break. If it clicks with him, he could be thrown in. 26-09-24

runners.name: Daisy Me Rollin
runners.comment: Showed a bit more when 100-1 for a 2m1f novice hurdle here recently; handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Showed a bit more when 100-1 for a 2m1f novice hurdle here recently, finishing about 20l behind the winner; entitled to be more competitive now handicapping.

runners.name: Bears Hug
runners.comment: Tailed off in three runs after running okay in a C&D handicap last May on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in three runs after running okay in a C&D handicap last May on stable debut; absent since September.

runners.name: Stinginhisstep
runners.owner: A Leach And D V Gardner
runners.comment: Big step forward when a 40-1 second on handicap debut here two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Big step forward when a 40-1 second on handicap debut here two weeks ago, despite racing too freely; off the same mark today but may need good ground, so watch the weather.

runners.name: Marley Head
runners.comment: Maiden who didn't run too badly in a couple of handicap hurdles last summer
runners.spotlight: No wins in 12 and exposed as modest under both codes; didn't run too badly in a couple of handicap hurdles last summer (on good ground).

runners.name: Yccs Portocervo

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M C Litton & Countess Cathcart
Mrs M C Litton & Mrs F D McInnes Skinner

runners.comment: Won this last season on soft and got back on track with a respectable fourth at Ludlow
runners.spotlight: Won this last season on soft ground; this year's two non-completions came over a trip too short and over the National fences at Aintree; got back on track with a respectable fourth at Ludlow; should go well.

quotes.race: ABP 'Summer Plate Trial' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: It was a fair effort. I thought Mr Handicapper was mean putting Yccs Portocervo to a career high, but he's proved that sometimes you have to let the horses do the talking. He's a pleasure to ride and was incredibly game - Sm Twiston-Davies, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Cap Du Mathan
runners.comment: Nothing wrong with his third in a deeper race than this at Cheltenham; good chance
runners.spotlight: Former useful handicapper and won a soft-ground 2m hunter chase early last year; back from an absence with a second at Ludlow and nothing wrong with his third in a deeper race than this at Cheltenham (2m4f); good chance.

quotes.race: Summerfield Developments Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Cap Du Mathan won on this day in a hurdle race. He loved it around here, last time at Hereford it was just a bit too heavy. He was much better today and it's great to win for the Stewart family. He stays further than two [miles] so you can be aggressive over that trip and Harry [Cobden] is riding at the top of his game - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's a solid handicap chaser who won twice in his first season over fences. His run at Ascot on Saturday will have brought him on considerably, although he's probably rated up to his best and might switch to hunter chases after Christmas. 05-11-23

runners.name: Ballydesmond
runners.comment: Was struggling in points before another modest effort here two weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Hunter chase winner in Ireland but was struggling in points before another modest effort here two weeks ago.

stable_tour.quote: He ran grand at Exeter behind Stay Away Fay - a Grade 1 performer - last week and jumped and travelled for a long way, but we might do his wind. Gavin [Sheehan] said he had enough pace for two and a half miles, albeit in lesser company, so we'll go novice handicap chasing over that trip to three miles. 15-11-23

He's a lovely horse, a proper three-mile chaser whom we bought in the spring. He'd won a point-to-point and then a hunter chase at Down Royal for Caroline McCaldin. He did that nicely, but he might have been more expensive if he hadn't won because he's got to go chasing with a penalty now. He could go novice hurdling, but I think we'll stick to fences, which could be brave, but he jumps and stays and should be all right. 28-09-23

runners.name: Jacks A Legend
runners.comment: Didn't jump well on his previous attempt over regulation fences and these terms are tough
runners.spotlight: Low-grade winner over hurdles; won his recent point but didn't jump well on his previous attempt over regulation fences and these terms are tough.

quotes.race: Best Odds Guaranteed At PlanetSportBet Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Jack's A Legend has always been a nice horse, it's just been a case of getting him right ? the engine is too big for the frame, I think. We're only a small stable, but he's the best we've got - Alan Jones, trainer.

runners.name: On Springs

prev_owners.owner: Sophie Pauling & Les De La Haye

runners.comment: Five-time winner over fences for Ben Pauling and has won all his points with authority
runners.spotlight: Five-time winner over fences for Ben Pauling and has won all this year's points with authority; needs respecting, though good ground seems ideal.

quotes.race: Virgin Bet Best Odds Daily Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: On Springs loves this good ground. He's normally a summer horse, he won four last summer. He hasn't had his ground this winter - Luca Morgan, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He failed to win any of his first 11 races but since then it has been onwards and upwards. He finally got his head in front at Ffos Las in June and has since added three more wins. His wonderful run has seen him shoot up 23lb, but he is clearly on an upward curve. He will not appreciate heavy ground and will soon be ready for his winter break - he was well beaten when unseating at Cheltenham on Friday. He is clearly on an upward curve and I am sure he will continue to progress. 26-10-22

runners.name: Peacocks Secret
runners.comment: Competitive in this year's four points (on good or faster ground) but a 13yo now
runners.spotlight: Competitive in this year's four points (on good or faster ground) but a 13yo now and may struggle to cope with the best of these.

quotes.race: Your Ultimate Jumps Guide At Attheraces.com Novice Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: His jumping is really good and he's progressed again from the last day. When he's in front he's enjoying it and carrying you so I just let him at it. We got in under the last but other than that he was very good - Rachael Blackmore, rider

quotes.race: September 8th Celebration Race Meeting (Pro/Am) Flat Race
quotes.quote: I will have a look and see about running him in a winners' bumper but he will go jumping hurdles before long. Conor Walsh gave him a super ride and he was very strong in the finish. He is very good value for his 7lb claim - Emmet Mullins, trainer

runners.name: Anjo Bonita
runners.comment: Well treated on 1m1f and 1m2f wins in 2023; not disgraced on 2nd run for yard latest
runners.spotlight: Well treated on the form of two wins in 2023, at Hamilton (1m1f, good to soft) and York (1m2f, good); lightly raced since but she wasn't disgraced on second run for this yard, at Ripon ten days ago; possible squeak.

runners.name: Mighty Quiet
runners.comment: Made all on handicap debut at Bath (1m2f) in October; faded on AW return; more to come
runners.spotlight: Much improved for soft ground and a first-time tongue-tie on handicap debut at Bath (1m2f) in October, when making all in good style; failed to settle when unable to get to the front and faded on recent AW return but an easy lead would play to her strengths back on turf; more to come.

runners.name: Lesrico
runners.comment: Struggling from some way out on handicap debut (1m, AW); lots to prove back on turf
runners.spotlight: Signs of ability but also some temperament in qualifying runs; was struggling from some way out on handicap debut at Newcastle (1m, AW) in December and has a lot to prove back on turf after a break; hood discarded.

runners.name: Bearwith
runners.comment: C&D winner; well treated; had wind op since last seen and has good reappearance record
runners.spotlight: Turf wins on good and good to firm, one over C&D; not at peak in the second half of 2024 but he's had wind surgery since and is well treated now; has won and gone well on reappearance for the last two years; of interest.

quotes.race: Tony Lythgoe Birthday Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Bearwith was very good today and had to be really brave. He was really gutsy, especially from the shabby draw that he had - Harriet Bethell, trainer.

runners.name: Casilli
runners.owner: W H & Mrs J A Tinning & Mrs C Wallis
runners.comment: Five course wins, two over C&D; running into form off reduced mark; solid chance
runners.spotlight: Five of six wins have come on this track, twice over C&D (on good and good to firm), and she looked to be on the way back when a keeping-on third of 12 off reduced mark over the extended 1m here this month; solid.

runners.name: Mystical Maria
runners.comment: Lightly raced; mixed in handicaps but won one over 1m1f in August; satisfactory return
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced filly with a rather mixed record in handicaps but she won one at Carlisle (1m1f, soft) and her comeback third here (about 1m; good) was perfectly satisfactory; should be on the premises.

runners.name: Princess Niyla
runners.comment: Second of two wins came over C&D in July; in good form since return; not far away
runners.spotlight: The second of two wins came over C&D (good to firm) in July; ended the year with a quiet effort but she's been running well since her reappearance in April; unlikely to be far away.

runners.name: Whatacracker

prev_owners.owner: Mrs P A Johnson & C H Stephenson

runners.comment: Best form when 1m3f winner in 2023; running well and a stiff 1m2f can suit
runners.spotlight: Best form when winning over 1m3f at Carlisle (good to soft) in 2023; looked to find 1m2f on the sharp side at Nottingham two starts ago, then 1m4f appeared to stretch him at Leicester, but this stiff test back at 1m2f could be the solution; cheekpieces fitted.

quotes.race: Lake District Handicap (Jockey Club Grassroots Middle Distance Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Ryan (jockey) did a great job and it's just a horse that's taken us a little while to figure him out. We started Whatacracker over seven because he shows lots of speed at home and we've gradually stepped him up. We thought he'd win at Newmarket last time and he disappointed us a bit but what we see at home is what we've seen on the track today - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.name: Dandys Angel
runners.comment: Five C&D wins; weights chance but possibly of more interest when cheekpieces refitted
runners.spotlight: Five of ten wins have come over C&D; has won on good to firm but last four wins have come on heavy and soft so any rain will be welcome; weights chance but may be of more interest when cheekpieces are refitted (last three wins in them).

runners.name: Count Palatine
runners.comment: Dual 7f winner last September and bettered reappearance form last time; player
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner last September and stepped up on reappearance form when third at Ayr last time; no reason why he won't give another good account.

quotes.race: Patrick Hibbert-Foy Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: I said to Connor [Beasley, jockey] that the last time Count Palatine ran we sat him handy and I didn't feel he enjoyed that so I said to just drop him in and ride him to finish. He liked the ground and did it well - Michael Dods, trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Orbaan

prev_owners.owner: J C G Chua & C K Ong

runners.comment: Formerly smart but not a regular winner these days and safely held at Thirsk last time
runners.spotlight: Isn't operating at the level that saw him win a Golden Mile handicap at Goodwood in 2022 and hasn't been a regular winner since; safely held at Thirsk last time and probably one to watch.

quotes.race: Stablemate By AGMA Carlisle Bell Handicap
quotes.quote: Orbaan is nine years old now and dropping in class, and deserves to win a race like this - Danny Tudhope, jockey.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Full Of Surprises Classified Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I checked with the track and they said they put a lot of water on and that the ground wasn't too fast. It was perfect for Orbaan and I wouldn't risk him on quick ground. He's better on softer ground and could go to York for the Ebor meeting - Jimmy Chua, owner.

quotes.race: Coral Golden Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: It's been a long time since Orbaan last won. The last time he won he did it like a Group horse in a handicap and hasn't won since. He's dropped down a bit but he got a good run through and the longer this horse travels, the better. He got the draw and it was the type of race that would suit him - David O'Meara, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was a revelation last year, winning the Golden Mile at Goodwood and at the Shergar Cup. He really seemed to enjoy his racing again. He ran over the sharp seven at Haydock last weekend, but the Victoria Cup will suit him better. His season will be built around the heritage handicaps, particularly Goodwood. 04-05-23

runners.name: Bell Shot
runners.owner: Sbk Racing & B & J Parr Racing Ltd
runners.comment: C&D winner last summer; not won since but he's consistent and has claims back on grass
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last July; consistent sort who should give another good account returned to turf.

runners.name: Finbars Lad
runners.comment: Not won for nearly two years but has run well over C&D and should be better for last run
runners.spotlight: Hasn't won for nearly two years but has run well over this C&D and should be better for most recent outing following a seven-month break; no surprise to see him step up on that.

stable_tour.quote: He won very well at Haydock last year on his second start for us, then he wasn't quite right in the summer - there were a few in the yard under a bit of a cloud. We rested him quite early and he went back to his owner-breeder. He's back in training now and I see no reason why he can't build on that win at Haydock, where he looked like a horse with a lot of natural ability. 20-03-24

runners.name: Triggerman
runners.comment: AW winner who shaped as though the run was needed on reappearance; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: AW winner who shaped as though the run was just needed after six-month break at Thirsk this month; likely to be better for that and he's shortlisted.

stable_tour.quote: He was well held first time, but there was a marked improvement last time at Newcastle when he ran a cracking race to be denied by a short head. To be honest, we've been a little disappointed with our juveniles this year as they've all been green first time out before improving. I think the message to Weekender readers, though, is that all of our two-year-olds will improve for their first runs. Triggerman will run soon when we find a suitable opportunity. For a cheaply bought colt he has ability. 06-09-23

runners.name: Park Street
runners.comment: Ran well, despite meeting trouble, last time and of interest for in-form yard back in trip
runners.spotlight: Yard is going well at present and this one stepped up on reappearance form when fourth over 8.5f here last time, despite enduring a troubled run through; on a good mark and has leading claims.

quotes.race: Chapter House Handicap
quotes.quote: Tina (Jackson, trainer) has done well with Park Street because he's not easy. They've gone a good, even gallop which has suited me and he finished off well - Graham Lee, jockey.

runners.name: Temper Trap
runners.comment: Handles quick ground but goes well on soft/heavy; best watched if it stays dry
runners.spotlight: Handles a sound surface but last five wins and all best recent form has been with on soft or heavy; never figured at Thirsk last time and best watched unless the ground eases.

runners.name: King Sharja
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner who ran respectably back on turf last time; claims back at this venue
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last summer and ran respectably back on grass at Catterick last time; return to this stiffer venue should suit and he's another to consider.

stable_tour.quote: I thought he was very unlucky the other day at Southwell when he dwelt at the start and had to weave his way through, coming with a late lunge which nearly won him the race. As it is he had to settle for second. That race came after a long winter break, so I'm hopeful there's much more to come. He likes the extended 7f at Beverley and he's feasibly handicapped. 09-04-25

runners.name: Twilight Jazz
runners.comment: Bogged down on heavy when last seen in September; one to watch on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Bogged down on heavy ground last September and not seen since; has no great record fresh and one to watch on stable debut from just out of the handicap.

3:10.race_name: Skidby Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Elzour
runners.comment: Has shown nothing in a bumper, a 7f AW maiden and a 1m2f turf novice
runners.spotlight: Has shown nothing in a bumper, a 7f AW maiden and a 1m2f turf novice.

runners.name: Blackanddeckers
runners.comment: Makes little appeal on belated debut
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam well held 7f AW only start (RPR 41), half-sister to winners Bay Mirage (6f) and Wear It Well (6f 2yo), out of maiden half-sister to 7f/1m4f Group 2 winner Halicarnassus; makes little appeal on belated debut.

runners.name: Rogue Invader
runners.comment: Showed ability in both starts last summer; makes the shortlist in an uncompetitive maiden
runners.spotlight: 145,000gns foal; showed ability in 6f novices at Newbury (good to firm) and Chelmsford (AW) last summer; has a 286-day absence to overcome but still makes the shortlist in this uncompetitive maiden.

runners.name: Wadacre Maestro
runners.comment: Has been found a modest maiden on debut and stable won this with a newcomer in 2023
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to winners Pipers Note (prolific 5f/6f including 2yo; RPR 108) and Fast And Loose (6f; 88); dam unraced half-sister to 7f-8.6f winner Bold Diktator and to 2yo winners Rigsby (5f) and Miss Vivien (6f); already gelded, but has been found a modest maiden on debut and stable won this with a newcomer in 2023; considered.

runners.name: Biarritz
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Sir Robert Ogden
runners.comment: Always behind when eighth of ten on this month's Thirsk debut; improvement required
runners.spotlight: 20-1 and always behind when eighth of ten on this month's Thirsk debut (7f, good); improvement is required.

runners.name: Carida
runners.comment: Fifth in two starts on the AW, not enjoying the clearest of runs each time; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Fifth in both starts over 7f on the AW, but has shown ability and she didn't enjoy the clearest of runs on either occasion; can't be ruled out.

runners.name: In A Hurry
runners.comment: Runner-up in first two starts but did too much early at Lingfield last time; hood on
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in her first two starts, including when beaten a neck on her Ayr return (1m, good) last month, but she did far too much early at Lingfield (1m1f, good to firm) eight days ago; major player on her earlier form if settling better in the first-time hood.

runners.name: Saliko
runners.comment: Placed in three of her four starts including when just beaten on stable debut
runners.spotlight: Placed in two of her three starts at around 1m on good/AW for Rae Guest last year and beaten half a length into second of three on her return/stable debut at Brighton (7f, good to firm) this month; should be right there again.

runners.name: Twoforthegutter
runners.comment: Ran best race of the year at Carlisle last time; big chance back in trip and down in grade
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back handicaps at Hamilton last June and, although he's not added to his tally, ran his best race this year over 1m6f at Carlisle last week (winner touched off next time); big chance down in trip/grade from same mark.

runners.name: Laser Focus
runners.comment: Disappointing this year and only of interest if the market speaks in his favour
runners.spotlight: Disappointing this year and down in the weights but, although the switch back to turf and refitting of tongue-tie could help, he'll have to show a more before he's a betting proposition; of interest only if the market speaks in his favour.

quotes.race: Clive Graham Memorial Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Laser Focus is in at Southwell on Friday and we might have to go again as he's won so easily. He's a good ground horse so it makes sense - James Owen trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well for us as a dual-purpose horse. He was a cheap purchase as we got him out of a claimer. He's won a good few for Pontoon Racing. He's currently on a break but will come back and have a spring/summer campaign. 01-01-25

runners.name: Star Delta
runners.comment: Best effort when second upped to this trip at Catterick last time; up 2lb but can go well
runners.spotlight: Turned in just about best effort when second upped to this trip for the first time at Catterick on most recent outing; up 2lb but no reason why he won't give a good account.

runners.name: Arch Legend
runners.owner: S Thompson And Mrs R Carr
runners.comment: Well handicapped on pick of form and ran as though latest run (yard debut) was needed
runners.spotlight: Turf and AW winner last spring but, although yet to match that level, ran as though latest race (stable debut) after a break was just needed; on a good mark if that can be built on.

stable_tour.quote: He came here in February from Charlie Johnston's and I like the look of him. He's a tall, staying type, who has already done well physically and should mature a lot more. We don't have many stayers here, so he's a bit unusual. I'm finding out about him and looking forward to his first run, although he hasn't done any fast work yet. I'm not quite sure whatound will suit him best. He's an exciting addition to the stable. 09-04-25

runners.name: Sawgrass
runners.comment: Ran well on only second handicap start at Brighton last time; claims with Rossa Ryan up
runners.spotlight: Unexposed sort who ran well on only second handicap start at Brighton over this trip last time; Rossa Ryan rides and reproduction of that should ensure she gives another good account.

runners.name: Mythical

prev_owners.owner: Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor & Derrick Smith

runners.comment: Ran in Serpentine's Derby but mainly downhill since; best watched back in this sphere
runners.spotlight: Low-grade form over hurdles this year and although he resumes on the Flat on a career-low mark, his sole win came on second start in 2019; opposable.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Mythical is a beautiful horse. He's probably a very good horse but he's still very raw - Donnacha O'Brien, rider.

runners.name: Inspiring Speeches
runners.comment: 16-race maiden for Michael Dods and bit to prove back in trip after break on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Regressive 16-race maiden for Michael Dods and didn't improve for the step up to 1m2f when last seen in January; enough to prove from wide draw on yard debut.

stable_tour.quote: We gelded him in mid-season, put some headgear on, and he's run well on some of his most recent starts, including when second at Carlisle and third at Redcar. He wasn't quite as good at Musselburgh last time out but I think he's ready to win before too long. 28-08-24

runners.name: Jamih
runners.comment: Below best since last win and off since October; no great record fresh and best watched
runners.spotlight: Dual winner last August at Catterick and Thirsk but has run well at this stiffer venue; below best since last win and off since October so, although yard going well, this one has a bit to prove (no great record fresh).

runners.name: Cloudy Rose
runners.comment: C&D winner who ran well after a break at Brighton last time; can't rule out
runners.spotlight: Triple winner at Brighton but has also won over this C&D; respectable effort after a six-month break at the south-coast venue last time (winner a dual winner since) and can't rule out.

runners.name: Lord Warburton
runners.comment: 1m2f winner who stays this trip but out of sorts when last seen over hurdles in November
runners.spotlight: 1m2f winner who has scored over hurdles and who has run respectably over this C&D; out of sorts when last seen over hurdles in November, though, and best watched.

quotes.race: Bill Carrigill Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: I'm amazed and delighted. Lord Warburton didn't show very much in his runs at Market Rasen so this was a bit of a last chance tonight on the Flat with the tongue-tie and visor back on. We would have been happy if there ended up being more finish behind him than in front so this is brilliant. I never, ever thought he would go out there and do that - Emma Forman, owner.

runners.name: Sassy Glory
runners.owner: Ursa Major & Mark Walford Racing Club
runners.comment: Yet to win and below best last time; probably one to take on from widest draw
runners.spotlight: Bits of ability on turf and AW but yet to win in 16 outings and below best last time; can be taken on from widest draw.

runners.name: Ruler Of The River
runners.comment: Only one win Flat and jumping and off since December; market best guide on yard debut
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner last March but yet to win on the Flat; off since December and only of interest if there's plenty of market support on this stable debut.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: She's been a consistent filly for us and has placed three times over hurdles. Jonathan: She was in the process of running her best race for us until she made a mistake at the last in a Listed fillies' hurdle at Doncaster and I hope she'll pick up a juvenile maiden. She should run well through the summer, and could go back on the Flat too. 08-02-24

runners.name: Phoenix Fire
runners.comment: Heavy ground winner in 2022 but hasn't added to tally; mainly disappointing last year
runners.spotlight: Heavy ground winner in 2022 but not won since and mainly disappointing last year; 11lb lower than at start of last season but might be one to watch this time.

runners.name: Dr Rio

prev_owners.owner: Just Wow Ltd, Mrs Melissa O'Neill & Robert Toogood

runners.comment: Versatile sort trip-wise who likes it at this venue; needs to better this year's form
runners.spotlight: All wins have been at this venue, all over different distances, but hasn't been at best on either start here this season; should be spot on now but needs to raise game.

runners.name: Hostelry
runners.breeder: J A Knox And Mrs M A Knox

prev_owners.owner: J A Knox and Mrs M A Knox

runners.comment: In good form this season and should go well from 3lb higher mark
runners.spotlight: Handles most ground and notched second win of 2025 when winning at Hamilton last time; raised 3lb but still on a reasonable mark compared with pick of last year's form and she's a player.

stable_tour.quote: She's a consistent miler who has won five and come second 13 times. She had a winter break and returned to Southwell last month, where she ran well considering the time off. I'm looking at a race for her at Nottingham on Saturday. 09-04-25

runners.name: Distinction

prev_owners.owner: Nick Willis And Mike And Wendy Yardley

runners.comment: Won this race last year but patchy form since July and may prefer softer ground
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D winner last year, including this race, but form patchy since Pontefract win in July; return to turf and to a track with a stiff uphill finish should suit but all wins have been with give in the ground and may need rain.

quotes.race: Charles Stewart & Co Steve Evans Memorial Handicap
quotes.quote: Distinction has done us proud. The stiff mile and soft ground were ideal. He's declared for Kempton tomorrow but that was just a back-up in case he couldn't run here - John Mackie, trainer.

runners.name: Madame Plaintiff
runners.owner: The Jocks And The Geordies Ii

prev_owners.owner: M Dunphy & Peter McCarrick & E Hughes & J R Brennan

runners.comment: Disappointing after winning last April but shaped well last time (yard debut); big chance
runners.spotlight: Won on handicap debut/reappearance last year but regressive since; however, shaped well on yard debut following a six-month break at Newcastle last time; down a further 2lb and interesting with Rossa Ryan taking over.

runners.name: Very Classy
runners.comment: Moderate maiden who hasn't been out for over a year; best watched on first run for trainer
runners.spotlight: Moderate maiden who has yet to race on turf; not seen for over a year and best watched on first run for trainer.

runners.name: Panama City

prev_owners.owner: Mrs Susan Davis, Mrs Melissa O'Neill & Peter Mitchell

runners.comment: Infrequent turf winner but ran well at Ripon last week; claims from the same mark
runners.spotlight: Multiple AW scorer whose sole win from 23 turf starts came at this venue in 2022; creditable effort from her lower turf rating at Ripon last week and claims from same mark.

runners.name: Mist Rollin In
runners.comment: Yet to win and well beaten on stable debut/reappearance on AW last time; more needed
runners.spotlight: Yet to win and well beaten on stable debut/reappearance on AW last time; plenty more needed.

runners.name: Penny Ghent
runners.breeder: Hellwood Stud Farm & G P Clarke
runners.comment: Inconsistent maiden; should be better for recent reappearance but needs to raise game
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and exposed maiden who should be better for recent reappearance at Pontefract; plenty more needed if she's to win this, though.

5:10.race_name: Racing Again On Tuesday 17 June Apprentice Handicap

runners.name: Golden Rainbow
runners.comment: Six wins last year on turf/AW and ran well last time (form franked); should go well
runners.spotlight: Had a good time of it last year with six wins on turf/AW and back to form when second to a subsequent winner at Redcar last time; only 1lb higher and should give a good account, despite the draw.

quotes.race: Bresbet Rewards Loyalty Handicap
quotes.quote: Golden Rainbow has been brilliant for us. We picked this race out when he won here before and both that and his last run at Musselburgh have worked out. He's the only horse to beat Phil McEntee's Jacquelina on turf this year, who's now rated in the 80s and well thought of. He loves the fast ground and I hope he can continue to progress to pick up a couple more prizes in the Yorkshire area - Rebecca Menzies, trainer.

runners.name: Fortunate Star
runners.comment: Knows how to win and ran well in race that has been franked at Catterick; should go well
runners.spotlight: Dual turf and dual AW winner who ran well when third at Catterick last time (winner has since run well, runner-up has since won); likely to give it his best shot again.

runners.name: Beneficiary

prev_owners.owner: Al Mohamediya Racing & Mrs E Burke

runners.comment: Multiple AW winner; yet to win on turf and below best of late; others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Multiple AW winner who has only run four times on turf and not at best at Musselburgh on penultimate start; below best back on AW last time and may find one or two too good.

runners.name: Desert Master
runners.owner: John And Tony Jarvis And Partner
runners.comment: Triple AW winner who has yet to win on grass and needs to raise game
runners.spotlight: Triple AW winner who has yet to score on turf (0-9); respectable effort after a wind op at Nottingham last time but will have to raise game if he's to notch first turf win.

stable_tour.quote: Another who is bred to be both fast and early. The dam was a useful black-type two-year-old for us but so far hasn't produced anything. Hopefully by sending her to Blue Point she can enjoy some overdue success. I have him entered this week and again he has done plenty of work. 19-04-23

runners.name: Lady Bouquet
runners.comment: C&D winner last June; satisfactory return at Hamilton and isn't without a chance
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last June who posted a satisfactory return at Hamilton last time; could have been better drawn but she's another to consider.

runners.name: Soldiers Design
runners.comment: Maiden winner at Brighton last summer but below that level since; others appeal more
runners.spotlight: Maiden winner at Brighton last year but hasn't matched that form for current trainer; no improvement in tongue-tie last time and probably best watched back on grass.

runners.name: Mrs Trump
runners.owner: R Chapman, G J Daly & R J Parks
runners.comment: Form since last win has a patchy look to it and she may again find one or two too good
runners.spotlight: Triple turf winner last year but form since last win has a patchy look to it; below best at Leicester last time and she may again find one or two too good.

stable_tour.quote: She's a low-grade filly but is a little angel and could easily have won three of her last four starts. Last winter we didn't know whether to keep her in training for this season. There was probably no-one more surprised than me when she won at Redcar in May. I thought she won at Leicester at the start of the month with a little bit more up her sleeve, and to be fair to her if she'd been drawn in the middle of them at Nottingham last time she'd have won there too. She ended up on the stands' rail and didn't quite get there. I'd like to think she'll progress a little bit more, although at a low level. 28-06-24

runners.name: Astapor
runners.comment: Shaped well after a break on AW last time and return to this stiffer venue should suit
runners.spotlight: Isn't the most consistent but knows how to win and shaped well after a break of over five months at Wolverhampton in March (form worked out); on a good mark and interesting.

runners.name: Araifjan
runners.comment: Infrequent winner and, although a respectable run last time, may find a few too strong
runners.spotlight: One-time fair performer but has only won once since late 2022; respectable effort when last seen in April but others appeal more from a win perspective back on turf.

runners.name: Ifonlytheycudtalk
runners.comment: Infrequent winner who needs to better this year's form if he's to get back to winning ways
runners.spotlight: Only one win from 21 starts and has yet to hit form this year; stable remains among the winners but this one needs to raise game if he's to double his tally.

runners.name: Gypsy Nation
runners.comment: Yet to win and, although he ran respectably last time, has work to do from wide draw
runners.spotlight: No wins from 21 starts but, although he shaped with more encouragement at Nottingham last time, he'll have to be at his best to overcome stall 12.

runners.name: Stallone
runners.comment: Has had plenty of chances since last win over a year ago and may prefer softer ground
runners.spotlight: Has had plenty of chances since last win in March last year and, although he handles a sound surface, his best efforts and the bulk of his turf wins came on soft/heavy.

runners.name: Blackcurrent
runners.owner: S Pedersen, S Mcmillan, A Brown

prev_owners.owner: S Pedersen, Mrs L Wymark & A Brown
S Pedersen, S McMillan, A Brown

runners.comment: Bulk of wins have been at Newcastle and best watched on first turf run since 2023
runners.spotlight: Bulk of wins have been at Newcastle and he's not run on grass for over two years; below best on last three starts and one to watch again.

quotes.race: Racing TV Apprentice Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: That's how Blackcurrent has been running for the last 12 months. Most days he'd usually fold up when they head him, but for the last year once they've headed him, he's gone on every time. He's fit and I know what to bring out of him - Alan Brown, trainer.

runners.name: U Turn
runners.comment: Failed to match bit of debut promise debut but claims, despite conceding weight all round
runners.spotlight: Bit of promise in race that threw up winners on debut but failed to match that effort at Doncaster last time; drop in grade should help and claims, despite conceding weight all round.

runners.name: Head For Freedom
runners.comment: Ran as though in need of debut experience but has to show how much ability he possesses
runners.spotlight: Ran as though in need of debut run over C&D this month but has to show how much ability he possesses.

runners.name: Gillali Lass
runners.comment: Has shown ability at a moderate level on both starts and may be capable of better
runners.spotlight: Similar level of moderate form on both starts; should be suited by the return to this stiff track and no surprise should she raise her game.

runners.name: Twist Or Stick
runners.comment: Just a hint of ability at Wolverhampton on debut but may be capable of better
runners.spotlight: No more than a hint of ability at Wolverhampton on debut but open to improvement and no surprise to see her run well.

runners.name: Spartacus Warrior
runners.comment: Limitations exposed both starts and will have to raise game if he's to win this
runners.spotlight: Limitations exposed both starts but drop into this grade should help; needs to raise game if he's to win this, though.

runners.name: Dinamo
runners.comment: Big price and well beaten on debut; needs to fare a good deal better
runners.spotlight: Big price and well beaten at Doncaster on debut; yard always respected but this one has plenty to prove.

runners.name: Rajdad
runners.comment: Last of four on turf debut but this represents a drop in grade; could run well
runners.spotlight: Last of four on turf debut at Bath last time but this represents a drop in grade and in-form trainer doesn't have many runners at this venue; likely to run well.

runners.name: Carnation Queen
runners.comment: Well beaten on debut at Redcar and needs a big step forward
runners.spotlight: Big price and well beaten at Redcar on debut; needs a big step forward if she's to figure.

runners.name: Maledetta Minerva
runners.comment: No show following a tardy start over C&D on debut and best watched
runners.spotlight: No show following a tardy start over C&D on debut and makes no appeal.

7:40.race_name: Go Green Solar Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
7:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 6.2)

runners.name: Gale Mahler
runners.comment: Listed hurdle winner last summer but has very mixed record since; chase debut today
runners.spotlight: Launched hurdling career with four consecutive wins on good ground last spring/summer, the latest in Galway festival Listed race, but has very mixed record since; versatile regarding trip but it's hard to know what to expect from her on this chasing debut and she'll have something to prove if the ground turns soft.

quotes.race: COLM QUINN BMW Novice Hurdle (Listed)
quotes.quote: We had to step Gale Mahler up in grade to see what we had and she was very impressive. We can now go home and start making proper plans. She doesn't mind that ground, she'll handle slow ground but she wouldn't want winter-heavy ground. She is very straightforward and genuine. She is a very good mare and we can target some of the big races in the autumn and next spring - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

quotes.race: Read Nico De Boinville's Unibet Blog Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Gale Mahler is very straightforward and an improving mare, she did as well as ever there. She's got a real good turn of foot and if all comes well she's off to Galway. She's a very versatile little mare who takes plenty of racing and is great like that. She's not your typical mare, she's very hardy - Henry Brooke, jockey.

quotes.race: Never Ordinary At bet365 Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: I was there soon enough but I was worried we hadn't gone much of a gallop so I didn't want to be sit waiting around. Two out I went for home and although Gale Mahler felt company at the last, she went on again and she's a very straightforward horse - Henry Brooke, winning jockey.

runners.name: Great Pepper
runners.breeder: P Noue & S A R L Ecurie Silgezam
runners.comment: Low-mileage 7yo; moves back up in trip after very encouraging chase/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Dual point and dual hurdle winner in 2023; very lightly raced since but returned from layoff with pretty good third on chase/handicap debut at Carlisle (2m, soft) in February and ought to be suited by this move back up in trip; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: I love him, he's a little dude. He's not the biggest but he's really well put together. He's owned by Darren Mills Racing and he owned Rapid Flight, who we've just had to retire due to an injury he picked up in last season's Becher Chase. It's nice he's got another good horse. This one ran a little bit green when winning at Hexham and then won well enough at Kelso. He's a brilliant jumper, he's tough and he stays three miles all day long. He's peaking now and I'm really pleased with him. He's from the same family as Princess Zoe, so it's a lovely pedigree. He'll go to Haydock on Saturday for the Albert Bartlett trial, a race we won with Chief Dan George, and we'll dip our toe in the water to see where we are. He's got the entry in the main race at Cheltenham and will go there if he comes through his test at Haydock. There's a possibility we might look at the Sefton at Aintree, but it's one step at a time. He'll go chasing next season when his jumping will stand him in good stead. 14-02-24

runners.name: Coqolino
runners.breeder: S A R L Haras Du Logis Saint Germain
runners.comment: Has 7lb penalty for 2m1f win here on Saturday but this longer trip should suit him better
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to score here (2m1f, good) on Saturday, getting off the mark over fences at the 20th attempt; has 7lb penalty to shoulder today but the longer trip and likely slower ground will both be in his favour.

quotes.race: Navan Members Maiden Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Coqolino gave us a scare at the last but he did it well and was entitled to. He's a gorgeous horse and a chaser in the making - Denise Foster, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Didn't run in the second half of last season so he remains a maiden over fences. Hopefully he can pick up a chase somewhere along the way. He wants a trip and plenty of cut in the ground. 24-10-23

runners.name: Hurricane Ali
runners.comment: Respectable third behind Coqolino on chase debut here on Saturday; recent rain not ideal
runners.spotlight: 7-40 over hurdles; very respectable third of five behind Coqolino here (2m1f, good) on rather belated chasing debut on Saturday; 7lb better off with that rival today and will be fine over the longer trip but the forecast rain is not ideal for him (albeit he has run quite well on soft/heavy).

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Hurricane Ali is progressing nicely and likes this ground. Running him over 2m is clearly working but he will stay 2m4f down the line - Stan Sheppard, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse we've just bought from John Mackie. John has looked after him really well and was sad to see him go, and I think he's going to have a good summer campaign. He's an older horse who's been really consistent over hurdles. I like these good-ground horses for Cartmel and he could be one to jump a fence. 14-02-24

runners.name: Militaire
runners.breeder: R D & J S Chugg & Millhouse Stud
runners.comment: In the frame in all four chases; could have a say if new headgear has positive effect
runners.spotlight: Left behind by clear winner when second at Uttoxeter (3m, good) two months ago but has now made the frame in all four chases; 5lb out of the weights here but ought to cope if the ground softens and can play a part if the first-time cheekpieces have a positive effect.

8:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 6.2)

runners.name: El Jefe
runners.comment: Out of form over hurdles last season; makes rather belated chase debut today
runners.spotlight: 6-42 over hurdles; caused 40-1 surprise at 2024 Aintree festival but was badly out of form last season and has left it rather late in the day to launch his chasing career.

quotes.race: Alder Hey Handicap Hurdle (Conditional Jockeys' And Amateur Riders' Race) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: El Jefe was was 66-1 last night and I couldn't believe the price. That was a class ride, like a professional. I said not to go too early - Andrew Hamilton, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Nifty 50 Conditional Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: El Jefe never lifted the bridle at all last year and I couldn't get to the bottom of it but he's come back this year like a new fella, he loves life. I was glad to see so much rain because he loves the muck and he was getting a lot of weight from the other horses. He never finds a lot, but he will keep galloping. I'm delighted - Andrew Hamilton, trainer.

runners.name: Lermoos Legend
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner; returns here after good second in higher-grade race last month
runners.spotlight: Gained two of his seven chase wins over C&D (including this race in 2022); returns here after clear second in higher-grade contest at Ffos Las (2m, good) three weeks ago and is versatile ground-wise; major player.

runners.name: Shillanavogy
runners.comment: Second to rejuvenated subsequent winner last time; contender if drop back in trip suits
runners.spotlight: Opened chasing account at Fontwell (2m5f, soft) in December and bumped into a rejuvenated subsequent winner when second at Wincanton (2m4f, good) on latest outing in March; contender if this drop back in trip suits.

quotes.race: Hereford Countryside Raceday This Sunday Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Shillanavogy always shown plenty but he's just been a bit of a slow burner - Warren Greatrex, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has plenty of ability and I always thought he wanted soft ground, but he doesn't handle it. He was third over 3m½f at Southwell on Monday. He'll go on into the spring, he gets 3m and he jumps much better on better ground. There's a bit of scope for improvement but he's been a work in progress. 05-03-25

runners.name: Dusky Days
runners.comment: Form nosedived after last May's Stratford win; back from break for new stable
runners.spotlight: Won over fences at Stratford (2m1f, good) for Jamie Snowden just over a year ago but his form nosedived last summer; changed hands for £3,500 in October; revival needed on stable debut.

stable_tour.quote: He is an interesting horse in that he has only had one run to date, when winning a bumper at Stratford last May. He is a cracking individual who is a full-brother to the ill-fated Fontsanta, who was a smart stayer. Dusky Days won his bumper nicely and his schooling over hurdles has been very encouraging ahead of his return over 2m, although I expect him to get further later on. I would suggest he is one to follow for the season ahead. 28-09-21

runners.name: Neigh Botha
runners.comment: Below form over hurdles last month but ran well in a chase two starts ago; a possible
runners.spotlight: Below form when back over hurdles last month but gave very good account when clear second to all-the-way winner in Bangor chase (2m1f, good) two starts ago and has possibilities here.

stable_tour.quote: He won a bumper at Musselburgh for Donald Whillans before joining us. He ran well enough in a maiden hurdle at Listowel last month but will come on a ton for that and leave that form well behind. 18-10-22

runners.name: Ascension Day
runners.comment: Placed a few times over hurdles but his two chasing attempts did not go well; stable debut
runners.spotlight: Placed four consecutive times over hurdles fo Shaun Lycett in spring 2024 but his two chasing attempts during the winter did not go well; returned from break with satisfactory hurdle run this month but still has a lot to prove over fences; makes stable debut today.

runners.name: Sword Of Fate

prev_owners.owner: Galloping On The South Downs Partnership

runners.comment: Triple C&D winner; lurks on a dangerous mark but has been out of form this spring
runners.spotlight: Veteran with three C&D wins and seven other chase victories on his CV; lurks on a dangerous mark but has been out of form this spring (cheekpieces added last time) and the ground may turn against him today.

quotes.race: Betfair #racingstaff Week Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Sword Of Fate had to come here after his Stratford win the other night as it was the last time he would have been off his old mark as he is due to go up 6lb. He has now had two runs in four days so he will have a little break and be back in three weeks or so - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: Central Roofing South Wales "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle
quotes.quote: We did not really want to run Sword Of Fate so quickly after his win here last week, but this looked too good an opportunity to miss. He wants this ground and when the rain comes he will be off on his holidays until next spring - Tom Lacey, trainer.

quotes.race: 7bets4free.com EBF "National Hunt" Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier)
quotes.quote: Sword Of Fate was weak last year, but he loved that ground and we like him - Tom Lacey, trainer.

runners.name: Ensel Du Perche
runners.comment: Ended last season in good form and won over C&D on only previous Cartmel visit
runners.spotlight: Made all in two small-field chases at Catterick (1m7f, good/soft) last season and is still in good form; scored over C&D (heavy) on only previous visit to Cartmel (July 2023) and ought to give this a good shot.

runners.name: Couldbeaweapon
runners.comment: Well held over 3m last time but made quite encouraging stable debut over 2m3f
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten when tried over 3m this month but made quite encouraging stable debut over 2m3f in April and has become very well handicapped on older form; interesting to see whether combination of drop back in trip, refitted cheekpieces and first-time tongue-tie enables a revival.

runners.name: Judicial Review
runners.comment: 2m5f course winner last summer; tailed off over 3m1f here on Saturday; hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Made all in first-time blinkers here (2m5f, soft) last summer, his second chase start, but was tailed off when reappearing over 3m1f here on Saturday and is not sure to be suited by this drop back to 2m1f.

runners.name: Robins Field
runners.comment: 0-22 under all codes but ran big race when second in this contest a year ago
runners.spotlight: 0-22 under all codes but ran big race when second in this contest a year ago (soft) ground and is effectively 1lb lower today; reverts to chasing after respectable hurdle run in March; could have a say.

runners.name: Importateur
runners.comment: 0-5 over hurdles; makes stable/chase debut after 422-day absence; 4lb wrong
runners.spotlight: 0-5 over hurdles and absent since modest third on handicap debut for Tom Gretton in April 2024; 4lb wrong for stable/chase debut; could be considered only if lively in the betting.

runners.name: Chantilly Rose
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D Futter & Mrs R Patterson
runners.comment: Didn't run badly at Hexham last week but is effectively 5lb higher here
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden; ran better than eventual 36l defeat suggests when today's headgear combination was used at Hexham (2m4f, good) last Tuesday but is effectively 5lb higher from out of the weights here.

6:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 6.2)

runners.name: Flying Scotsman

prev_owners.owner: John P McManus, Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor
John P McManus, Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: Won a low-grade AW handicap in January but current hurdling ability hard to gauge
runners.spotlight: Seen only once over hurdles since 2023, when pulled up last summer, and his AW win in January came in a low-grade handicap; needs to prove he can still be competitive off a mark this high over jumps.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: We'd been scratching our heads with Flying Scotsman, he'd been a hard horse to get right. The application of blinkers seemed to help and he's just a horse you have to catch at the right time - Ben Haslam, trainer.

quotes.race: Listowel Printing Works Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: That was some ride from Wayne [Lordan]. He said Flying Scotsman was always coming back underneath him, was on and off the bridle, but knew once he turned in he would stay the trip well. He said he is a genuine horse when you do ask him. He has been disappointing over hurdles and it is nice to win another nice handicap. He goes flat through a race, but is genuine when it comes to the business end, and with that light weight on his back he must have thought he was loose - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: caulfieldindustrial.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Flying Scotsman is a versatile little sod and he's as tough as nails. The cheekpieces made a bit of a difference as they sharpened him up. He's in again at Leopardstown on Friday and we'll just have to see about that - Brendan Powell, assistant trainer

quotes.race: Eventus Handicap
