quotes.quote: I think the step up in trip and soft ground suited him. Last time he ran a nice race when they just quickened away from him on quicker ground at Leopardstown. He got into a bit of trouble and it probably suited him as well. He's declared again tomorrow but I'll leave that to Joseph and see how he is. He's had a tough enough race today to win. It was a good performance today, it wasn't the greatest race in the world but he's a Galileo and the step in trip suited him - Brendan Powell, assistant to Joseph O'Brien, trainer of Flying Scotsman

stable_tour.quote: He won twice in as many days on the Flat at Galway. We've gelded him and are looking forward to sending him over hurdles, when I hope there will be some fun to be had with him. 09-11-20

runners.name: Curley Finger
runners.comment: Didn't run badly on latest outing but needs a boost from today's headgear switch
runners.spotlight: Failed to win during light campaign last season; didn't run badly when fifth of six at Doncaster (3m, good) in March and will be suited by the forecast rain here but still needs a boost from today's change of headgear.

quotes.race: Racing TV Go North Brindisi Breeze Hurdle Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Curley Finger loves the track and probably appreciated the better ground. We changed the tactics, putting cheekpieces on and bouncing him out, and he's jumped brilliantly. It was a lovely ride by Nathan, he got the fractions perfect - Rebecca Menzies, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He did really well last season, notably winning a Pertemps qualifier at Musselburgh, beating Springwell Bay. We'll probably follow the same sort of route as last season - Pertemps qualifiers are worth £30,000 and he's a capable horse at that level. The Go North stayers' final will also be on his agenda. 16-10-24

runners.name: Shantwopointfive
runners.comment: C&D winner; creditable fourth in valuable series final at Cheltenham last month
runners.spotlight: Won C&D maiden a year ago and made good progress in handicaps towards end of last season; creditable fourth of 16 in valuable mares' series final at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) last month and commands respect here.

stable_tour.quote: I'm very fond of her. She had a few little niggles and had trouble tying up at the beginning of the season. When she went to Southwell she wasn't fully ready and was a bit fresh, but she won very well that day. Her race at Exeter cut up but I thought dropping her back to 2m on that ground wasn't going to be the worst scenario. She did very well to finish second and was probably beaten by a good horse. She's now qualified for the mares' hurdle final in April at Cheltenham, which is worth a few quid. She's going to be a chaser. Sean [Bowen] thought she struggled a bit in heavy ground last time, but she definitely handles soft ground and she'll jump a fence. She's off 114 now but is much better than that. 05-03-25

runners.name: Fourofakind
runners.owner: Mrs G Jenkinson And Mrs B Butterworth

prev_owners.owner: Any Excuse For A Holiday Syndicate

runners.comment: Won twice at Perth last year; not yet proven here but won't mind of the ground softens
runners.spotlight: Did well for new stable last season, winning twice over 2m4f on good ground at Perth; not yet proven on this track but made a satisfactory reappearance this month and won't mind if the ground softens.

quotes.race: Haydock Park Welcomes Racing To School Maiden Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hurdle Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: The first time Fourofakind was a bit disappointing and didn't jump properly, but he ran really well at Newbury last time behind a nice horse of Nicky's [Henderson]. I thought this was an appropriate opportunity and he stepped forward and took the chance. The reason he lugs left is his breathing isn't perfect and I'll definitely get that done in the summer. I'm going to take him to Ascot on April 2nd for a valuable handicap, if he gets in, and I think a nice gallop there will bring out the best in him - Harry Derham, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He's another four-year-old who did well for me last season at a level. He'll stay hurdling and I might run him on the Flat a couple of times at some stage. I suspect he won't start until late November or early December. He'll begin over 2m but I suspect he'll go up in trip. He's a fun horse. 18-10-23

runners.name: Belvedere Blast
runners.comment: Began this year with a win and has remained in good form since; each-way claims at least
runners.spotlight: Began this year with a win at Market Rasen (2m7f, good to soft) and has remained in good form since; not beaten far when fifth in competitive Ayr race (3m, good to soft) at last month's Scottish National meeting and has each-way claims at least off same mark here.

quotes.race: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Belvedere Blast likes it here, but the trip was a bit of an unknown. We've tried everything with him - headgear, trips and ground - but the slower pace helped him and he started to like it late on. This is his level - Adrian Keatley, trainer.

runners.name: Our Sam
runners.comment: Never really got going last season and weakened into eight here (3m1f) on Monday.
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner over 3m1f in 2023; on a good mark now and versatile ground-wise but never really got going last season and weakened into eight here (3m1f, good to soft; first-time cheekpieces) on Monday.

stable_tour.quote: Bred down the road out of a mare I trained to win a couple of races, he was feral to train and ride at home, right up until 18 months ago. He questioned everything we did, but it all started to click and he's won four races. He's got that bit of steel about him and he keeps improving. He came up against Bushypark at Haydock last time and was just beaten by a well-handicapped horse on a going day. He's not run a bad race for more than 12 months now and I think he might go to Haydock on Saturday for the Pertemps qualifier. He's not going to get into anything at Cheltenham but it could be a race with a lot to offer. I'm looking at it as a £30,000 handicap hurdle - it's good prize-money. 14-02-24

runners.name: Rock Hurley
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs G Calder & P M Warren

prev_owners.owner: S Dufresne, B Milpied & G Luyckx

runners.comment: Front-runner; looked in excellent nick at Bangor last month; hiked up 10lb for that win
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who dominated the final circuit at Bangor (2m3f, good to soft) last month, winning by 14l; went up 10lb for that but could take some catching on this tight circuit.

runners.name: Mojo Ego
runners.comment: Unplaced all five stable starts but too well handicapped to rule out
runners.spotlight: Won twice as a juvenile hurdler in 2023-24 season; unplaced all five starts for new stable last term but his best run was at this track (2m1f); goes beyond that trip for first time today; too well handicapped to rule out.

stable_tour.quote: He's a new horse from Highclere who starts next Sunday at Kempton. He's a juvenile hurdler who had a couple of runs in France over hurdles. He had some good Flat form for Jean-Claude Rouget and he goes nicely. 18-10-23

runners.name: Rioja Alta
runners.comment: Won on first-time blinkers in February and ran well in defeat off new mark in March
runners.spotlight: Made all to score by 7l in first-time blinkers at Sedgefield in February and ran well in defeat off new mark at Newcastle (also 2m4f, good to soft) the following month; moves up in grade here but, after only six hurdling starts, may still have a bit more to offer.

quotes.race: Vickers.Bet Independent Family Owned Bookmakers Handicap Hurdle (Cab On Target Qualifier) (Div I)
quotes.quote: The first-time blinkers certainly sharpened up Rioja Alta, who ran a good, honest race - Micky Hammond, trainer.

runners.name: Topkapi Star
runners.comment: 20-1 winner in first-time cheekpieces in January but two disappointing runs followed
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with a 20-1 win in first-time cheekpieces at Ayr (2m5f, soft) in January but her next two runs were disappointing and she's 5lb out of the weights here.

quotes.race: Final Furlong Podcast Juvenile Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: She's couldn't put it together on the Flat. She's schooled really well at home, and today went round there with confidence and stayed all the way to the line. Topkapi Star has been a bit keen, but she had her eye on her hurdles and did her job. She looks small but doesn't ride anywhere near as small as she looks. Hopefully she'll continue to improve - Jack Quinlan, rider.

5:40.race_name: Hales Of Cartmel Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
5:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 6.2)

runners.name: Celestial Reign
runners.comment: Penalised for winning run-of-the-mill Sedgefield maiden this month but still considered
runners.spotlight: Showed some fair Flat form when based in Ireland and has taken pretty well to hurdling this year; carries penalty for winning run-of-the-mill Sedgefield maiden (2m4f, good) two weeks ago and is unproven on ground slower than good but still features prominently in calculations.

runners.name: Amdoinmebest
runners.comment: Struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for recent stable/hurdle
runners.spotlight: Safely held in three Irish points this spring and struggled to get competitive when a big-priced outsider for recent stable/hurdle debut.

runners.name: Flat Jack
runners.comment: Pulled up when 50-1 for recent debut at Hexham; can only be watched here
runners.spotlight: Pulled up when 50-1 for recent debut at Hexham; can only be watched here.

runners.name: Jysuis
runners.comment: Unplaced all nine hurdling starts and difficult to enthuse over; hooded for first time
runners.spotlight: Easily reeled in after blasting off in front off her lowly handicap mark at Worcester (2m4f, good) two weeks ago and has now been unplaced all nine hurdling starts; drops back in trip with hood added here.

runners.name: King Gris
runners.breeder: Earl Trinquet, O Trinquet & M Trinquet
runners.comment: Placed in an Irish point in February but struggled on both recent hurdling starts
runners.spotlight: Showed improvement when close third in Irish point in February (yielding ground) but has struggled on both recent hurdling starts (2m3f/2m1f).

runners.name: Ryebridge
runners.comment: Beaten about 49l when 80-1 for Perth bumper last month
runners.spotlight: Out of a well-connected mare; not disgraced in three Irish points in spring 2024 but beaten about 49l when 80-1 for Perth bumper last month.

runners.name: Sang Pour Sang

prev_owners.owner: Ecurie Hugo & Pierre Pilarski, Jose Louis Da Silva Et Al

runners.comment: Won over fences in France in the autumn; makes British debut in a modest race
runners.spotlight: Won a heavy-ground chase in France in October and wasn't beaten far when fifth of 15 in claiming hurdle at Auteuil (2m2f, heavy) six weeks ago; makes British debut in a modest race; market likely to guide.

runners.name: Spit Spot
runners.comment: Largely consistent over hurdles and easily won modest maiden on latest outing in March
runners.spotlight: Fair on the Flat; largely consistent over hurdles for Lucinda Russell since December 2023 and easily drew clear to win modest Musselburgh maiden (2m1f, good to soft) in March; likely contender under penalty here.

runners.name: At Vimeiro
runners.owner: Cartmel Racecourse With Old Gold Racing
runners.comment: Bought for 34,000gns after 2m AW win in January; makes stable/hurdle debut here
runners.spotlight: Did not fulfill his early promise on the Flat for Jane Chapple-Hyam but won off much reduced mark on AW in January (2m; RPR 80); changed hands for 34,000gns soon afterwards and ought to be very competitive at this level if he takes to hurdling.

runners.name: Terrorise
runners.comment: Fair Flat racer; clear third over hurdles at Market Rasen this month; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer; predictably struggled in Aintree Grade 1 on last month's hurdling debut but his clear third at Market Rasen (2m, good) 19 days ago was quite promising, and he has scope to build on that performance here.

stable_tour.quote: He's done well from two to three. His first run last year was good as he finished third at Newcastle, one place behind a smart horse of Adrian Keatley's [Ballymount Boy]. He then went downhill because he was too weak, but he didn't run badly at Newcastle on Tuesday on his return. 03-04-24

runners.name: Love True

prev_owners.owner: James Finch, Samuel Sutton & Tobias Jones

runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles but was consistent last season; probably won't be far away
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles and seemingly exposed now but she was consistent on good/good to soft ground last season and won't be far away if conditions remain suitable for her here.

runners.name: Bittalemon
runners.comment: Won on the Flat in October but well held when fourth in C&D mares' hurdle on Monday
runners.spotlight: Signed off on the Flat for William Haggas with clearcut win in October (1m4f, soft; RPR 77) but made a very underwhelming stable/hurdle debut when well-held fourth in C&D mares' race on Monday.

8:40.race_name: NPG Fire And Safety Open Hunters' Chase
8:40.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 6.2)

runners.name: Linelee King
runners.comment: Useful handicapper who won on hunter chase debut in March; leading contender
runners.spotlight: Useful handicapper who returned from long absence to make winning hunter chase debut at Southwell (3m, good to soft) in March; remains lightly raced for his age and ought to be a tough nut to crack here.

quotes.race: Betway Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Linelee King is a nice horse. He didn't achieve as much as I'd hoped over hurdles but his schooling over fences has been very good and for a horse running first time over fences I thought his jumping was immaculate. He's going to carry on improving hopefully and I hope he'll make a nice middle-distance handicapper - Olly Murphy, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He missed last season after coming back sore from a run at Sandown but has returned in good form and will start in a handicap chase in mid-November. He's one to look forward to and will hopefully take high rank in some nice three-mile handicap chases through the winter. 26-10-23

He missed last season after coming back sore from a run at Sandown but has returned in good form and will start in a handicap chase in the middle of next month. He's one to look forward to and will hopefully take high rank in some nice three-mile handicap chases through the winter. 01-11-23

runners.name: Great Notions
runners.comment: Held on gamely for Hexham win this month but contests a stronger race here
runners.spotlight: Dual point winner who held on gamely to make winning rules debut in Heart Of All England at Hexham (3m, good; also suited by good to soft) this month; evidently in good nick but contests a stronger race here.

runners.name: Autonomous Cloud
runners.comment: Useful stayer; found 2m4f on good ground too sharp last time; can fare much better here
runners.spotlight: Thorough stayer; seemingly on the downgrade now but ran well for a long way when eighth in last month's Aintree Foxhunters' and probably found the good ground too lively when below that form at Cheltenham (2m4f; first-time cheekpieces) four weeks ago; can make his presence felt here.

quotes.race: Pektron Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Autonomous Cloud is an enormous horse and a great jumper. Win, lose or draw we're going to the Welsh National after this - Paddy Brennan, rider.

quotes.race: Extra Furlong With Trinity Create Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Autonomous Cloud has loads of ability and he'll be one for the staying handicap chases down the line. He has plenty of scope and the Midlands National could be a race for next season - Adrian Heskin, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a lovely young horse but is still a baby and probably won't be out before Christmas. He's a gorgeous, big horse and will make a fine chaser in time. He looks great and is well bred too, as his dam was placed in a Grade 3 novice chase. I think we'll stick to bumpers with him this season and look forward to him in the future. 09-11-20

runners.name: First Lord De Cuet
runners.comment: Badly out of form under rules last season but easily won a point on latest outing in March
runners.spotlight: Useful handicapper in his prime and versatile regarding ground; badly out of form under rules last season but easily won five-runner point on latest outing in March, and it will be interesting to see whether he enjoys a new lease of life in hunter chases.

stable_tour.quote: He had a good season without getting his head in front last term. He's had a wind operation during the summer and will be going for some of those long-distance chases. He ran well in the Grand National Trial at Haydock and handles soft or heavy ground well. We think he's handicapped to win, and the wind op should bring out some more improvement. 31-10-23

His last win was at Wincanton 12 months ago when ploughing through the heavy ground. Since then he has not run a bad race, but he's finished second on five occasions, which as you can imagine it rather frustrating. He ran well when fourth in the Grand National Trial at Haydock on Saturday. He possibly prefers softer ground but he proved he stays well enough. 22-02-23

runners.name: Galileo Silver

prev_owners.owner: Walters Plant Hire & James & Jean Potter

runners.comment: In very good form in points in recent weeks; can make presence felt on hunter chase debut
runners.spotlight: Formerly a useful handicapper for Sam Thomas; 3-6 in points this year, the latest success gained by 20l this month, and seems very versatile ground-wise; must be considered on this hunter chase debut.

quotes.race: Evans & Co Amateur Jockeys' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Sam [Thomas] is doing well at the moment and he'd said this one would run a race. It wasn't the strongest of fields, he's a bit of a thinker and has a quirky way of doing things but he's got ability. He got jumping and has just run well. We tried him in cheekpieces but Sam felt the blinkers might make a bit of a difference. Will Biddick, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He has been a real start for us with five wins and numerous seconds. He is such a consistent performer and having had a break after his last run at Market Rasen (second) in the summer he is back in full work and hopefully he can continue to progress. He possibly finds it harder jumping those big fences, but I think we will go down that route again. 09-11-22

runners.name: Shantou Moon

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late W G Young

runners.comment: Modest second in four-runner hunter chase at Perth this month; others looks stronger here
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in some small-field points this spring and battled on to take modest second in four-runner hunter chase at Perth (3m, good) a fortnight ago but others in this line-up look much stronger.

runners.name: Torngat
runners.comment: Out of form this year and faces a tough assignment here
runners.spotlight: Won two points in 2023 but has been out of form this year and faces a tough assignment here; cheekpieces refitted.

6:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 6.2)

runners.name: Gemini Man
runners.comment: Pulled up on last month's handicap hurdle debut and now 0-23 overall
runners.spotlight: Lowly rated Flat maiden; made the frame in two Musselburgh maiden hurdles (1m7f/2m1f, good to soft) in February/March but was pulled up on last month's handicap hurdle debut; others look more likely.

runners.name: Lawmans Blis
runners.owner: G P S Heart Of Racing Ltd & Partner
runners.comment: In good form at Sedgefield this spring; contender here if recent rain not an issue
runners.spotlight: Drew clear to win Sedgefield maiden (2m1f, good) in March and also ran well when second in handicap over that C&D (good; wore cheekpieces) last month; may not be favoured by the recent rain here but still considered.

runners.name: Mr Sundancer

prev_owners.owner: Miss Rachel O'Neill & John C Hurley

runners.comment: Returned from break with respectable run Sedgefield this month; more appealing than most
runners.spotlight: Just 1-20 over hurdles but hasn't been with Mark Walford all that long and returned from break with respectable fourth at Sedgefield (2m1f, good to firm) this month; ought to cope if the ground eases here; shortlisted.

runners.name: Im Too Tired
runners.comment: Back hurdling on a good mark but looked badly out of sorts in his latest chase
runners.spotlight: Won small-field Sedgefield chase (2m, good to soft) on Boxing Day and reverts to hurdling on a good mark but looked badly out of sorts when tried in a visor in March and has become very unreliable; usual cheekpieces refitted here; not an easy one to predict.

stable_tour.quote: He had his first run over fences at Musselburgh last week. It was a nice experience and he shaped with promise to finish third. He jumped okay and easier ground around Sedgefield, over 2m5f, would be perfect, so that's the plan for him. 05-12-24

runners.name: Chillhi
runners.comment: Useful on the Flat in his prime but has uninspiring record over hurdles
runners.spotlight: Useful on the Flat in his prime; not beaten far on handicap hurdle debut at Newcastle (2m1f, good) in October but his run there in February was disappointing and the forecast rain is probably not in his favour here.

stable_tour.quote: A nice horse who had kissing spines and has been operated on. There were a few times last year when he went to win his races and his head came up. We were wondering whether he was thinking about the game, but we found out he had severe back problems. He's back in now and working away well and should be ready to run in a month. We think a lot of him and I reckon he could be all right. 03-04-24

runners.name: Top Of The Bay
runners.comment: Emphatic chase winner last month and had excuse when well beaten last time
runners.spotlight: Came good for Sam England at third attempt, readily winning Carlisle chase (2m5f, good) by over 8l last month, and reportedly boiled over in the preliminaries before this month's poor run at Hexham; can be dangerous if back on song for this return to hurdling.

runners.name: Cocardier
runners.comment: Safely held on handicap debut last May but still worth keeping an eye on in the betting
runners.spotlight: Safely held when 25-1 for handicap debut at Ffos Las (2m, good to soft) just over a year ago and not seen again since but remains very unexposed and is well worth keeping an eye on in the betting; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Vocal Duke
runners.comment: Without a win since 2022 but runs this track well and is very well handicapped
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at Perth last month, after a break, and remains without a win since 2022 but is now 13lb lower than when placed over C&D (soft) in much stronger race than this last summer; worth a second look.

runners.name: Belle Of Annandale
runners.comment: On good mark and versatile ground-wise but needs to better her recent efforts
runners.spotlight: Very well treated on some of last year's form for Adrian Keatley and seems versatile ground-wise but has not been firing on all cylinders in recent months.

runners.name: Winds Of Winter
runners.comment: Ran poorly in cheekpieces this month but was placed three times in a row beforehand
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in first-time cheekpieces (now removed) three weeks ago but was placed three consecutive times beforehand (2m2f-2m5f, good/good to soft) and has good claims here if judged on those efforts.

runners.name: Benito
runners.breeder: Erick Bec De La Motte & F Cottin

prev_owners.owner: George Houghton And Mrs E J Quinlan

runners.comment: Course winner in 2022 but has not shown a great deal this year, following a long layoff
runners.spotlight: Won over 2m6f here in 2022 and ought to cope better than some of these if the ground softens but has not shown a great deal since returning from a long layoff this year; wore cheekpieces the last time; visor tried today.

runners.name: Fairland

prev_owners.owner: John P Bowe & Michael J Bowe

runners.comment: Made low-key reappearance last month and now 0-12 over hurdles; others preferred
runners.spotlight: Began last season with two fairly respectable efforts both (2m4f, good) but made a low-key reappearance last month and is now 0-12 over hurdles; others have more pressing claims.

runners.name: Chantilly Moon
runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs D Futter & Mrs R Patterson
runners.owner: Mrs M Rooke And Hard Held Partnership

prev_owners.owner: Clova Farms And P D Niven

runners.comment: Showed no significant promise in his qualifying races; makes handicap debut today
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on first three hurdling starts and achieved very little when fifth of six in recent Market Rasen maiden (2m, good); has basement mark for handicap debut but still needs significant improvement.

7:10.going_detailed: GOOD TO SOFT, Soft in places (GoingStick: 6.2)

runners.name: Sea The Clouds
runners.comment: C&D winner last summer but soundly beaten here on stable debut on Monday
runners.spotlight: Dug deep to score over C&D (good) in first-time cheekpieces for Jamie Snowden last summer but was soundly beaten on seasonal/stable debut here (3m1f, good to soft) on Monday and seems reliant on good ground.

stable_tour.quote: He ran well in his three bumpers last season, being placed each time, and strengthened up over the summer. He won a Stratford bumper early last month and followed that up with a more impressive performance at Newton Abbot on his hurdling debut, coming home three and a half lengths clear. He'll go for another novice with a penalty but I'm not sure he wants the ground too soft, so he could have one or two more runs before having a break until the spring. 05-10-22

runners.name: Harper Valley

prev_owners.owner: Exors Of The Late John Wade

runners.comment: Four hurdle wins, the latest in February; current mark demands a career-best performance
runners.spotlight: Four-time hurdle winner, most recently at Musselburgh (2m4f, good to soft) in February; unable to land a telling blow when fourth at Kelso (2m6f, good) this month and current mark demands a career-best performance; swaps cheekpieces for refitted visor.

stable_tour.quote: A real yard favourite as he always runs his race. He's lightly raced and should remain competitive off his mark. I don't think he quite stays three miles on soft ground, but on summer ground it would be no problem. He's already schooled over fences and jumps well and might be one to go chasing with after March. He likes better ground and will probably keep going into late spring/early summer. 24-01-24

runners.name: Golden Maverick
runners.comment: Quirky customer who sometimes races lazily; won two runs ago but is hard to predict
runners.spotlight: Rewarded determined ride when keeping on strongly from poor position to lead on the post at Carlisle (2m1f, soft; visored) in February but again raced lazily at Stratford (2m, good to soft; first-time blinkers) in March, where he was beaten before final-flight fall; worth a go over this longer trip but it's hard to predict the extent to which he'll warm to the task; visor refitted.

quotes.race: Go North Grey Bomber Juvenile Hurdle Series Final (A Handicap Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Golden Maverick has done it well in the end. They picked up the pace quite early and I had to get him rolling but when I did he ended up finding for me - Gavin Sheehan, jockey.

quotes.race: Maximum Eco For Super Concentrated Cleaning Juvenile Hurdle (Go North Grey Bomber Series Qual) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Golden Maverick deserved to win a race like that. We went to Ludlow last time to qualify for a 100,000GBP novice handicap at Sandown on the last day of the season and we might see if we can head towards that. The other beauty of winning at this time of the season, is that we remain a novice in the first part of next season as well. He's a tough little horse who will cope with most types of ground, but he hasn't got much of a knee action, so you'd assume he'd be better on slightly nicer ground - Jamie Snowden, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He has untapped potential in a fast-run handicap on soft ground over two miles. We might start him off in a novice handicap at Cheltenham's Paddy Power meeting. 06-11-24

runners.name: Ashington
runners.comment: Good-ground winner in March but below that form since; recent rain here no help
runners.spotlight: Suited by return to good ground when scoring off 1lb lower at Doncaster (2m5f, good) in March but has not been in the same form again since, and the recent rain here further reduces his appeal.

quotes.race: Cartmel Female Jockeys' Handicap Hurdle (Pro/Am Race)
quotes.quote: I rode Ashington in this race last year when the ground was a bit softer and he still ran well, but he's off a lower mark this year and the ground's more suitable. Mark and the team have him in incredible form, he's been knocking on the door and I snapped up the chance to ride him - Becky Smith, rider, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: England V Belgium Betting At 188Bet Handicap
quotes.quote: Ashington was staying on well over a mile and a quarter last time and he really enjoyed this extra quarter mile - Andrea Atzeni, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's been a great horse, winning lots of prize-money without actually winning for us - but he's been placed nine times and has run regularly. He didn't stay 3m on soft ground at Hexham last time out, but he's well handicapped and one to watch on good ground back over hurdles. 14-06-24

runners.name: Achnamara
runners.comment: Dual hurdle winner last season (2m4f/2m3f); may still have potential over jumps
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner last season, latterly at Catterick (2m3f, good to soft) in February; unseated rider on next outing and was below form on the Flat this month but tries a new trip here and could still have untapped potential over jumps.

runners.name: Dalyotin
runners.comment: Back from 23-month break with very disappointing chase run here on Monday
runners.spotlight: Hurdle and five-time chase winner; very well handicapped on old form but returned from 23-month absence with very disappointing run over fences here on Monday and it takes a big leap of faith to support him today.

stable_tour.quote: A four-time winner in France, he has been a great addition to the team, winning his latest start at Sedgefield over 2m5f over fences. He was impressive that day, beating The King of May by eight lengths. I think he is one for readers to follow over middle distances when the ground is soft. He is much better over fences than hurdles. He has had time to really acclimatise from France and looks much stronger now and I expect plenty of improvement, particularly on testing ground. 28-09-22

runners.name: The Jewellers Pet
runners.comment: Dual winner at Ayr in February; not quite at best on latest outing but may progress again
runners.spotlight: Won twice on slow ground at Ayr (2m4f) in February and placed over that C&D on good to soft last month; slightly below form at Perth since and not yet proven on this track but further progress remains possible.

runners.name: Vroomoz Eile
runners.comment: Carlisle novice winner in February; unsuited by good ground on handicap debut on Saturday
runners.spotlight: Came good under rules at third attempt, in Carlisle novice (2m3f, soft) in February, and was reportedly unsuited by the good ground when well-held sixth here (3m1f) on handicap debut on Saturday; remains unexposed, and the recent rain ought to aid her cause today.

runners.name: Evenwood Sonofagun
runners.owner: Mrs D Chapman & Mrs E Quinlan

prev_owners.owner: Frank J Lynch & Michael Hartnett & W O'Brien & A M Ryan

runners.comment: Won quite comfortably over C&D on Monday; carries penalty in higher-grade race today
runners.spotlight: Showed the benefit of his latest wind operation when keeping on strongly to win quite comfortably over C&D (good) on Monday; has 7lb penalty to carry in a higher-grade race today but will still need to be taken very seriously if he makes a quick reappearance.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Evenwood Sonofagun has been super consistent and ran a mighty race at Catterick where he jumped the last in front but ended up sixth. He's such an honest little horse and is the type who could benefit from a confidence boost like that - Lizzie Quinlan, trainer, speaking to Racing TV.

4:55.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watered)

runners.name: Beacon Edge
runners.comment: Seven wins over hurdles, best form over staying trips, retains a high level of ability
runners.spotlight: Winner of nine races; 7-34 record over hurdles, including a four-runner Grade 2 event over 3m at Wetherby last October; ran creditably when seventh in the 26-runner Coral Cup at Cheltenham; down the field at Aintree subsequently; trip is short of his best but he won a stronger race than this over 2m2f at Ballinrobe a year ago; amateur rider, 2-11 over hurdles.

quotes.race: bet365 Hurdle (Grade 2) (Registered As The West Yorkshire Hurdle) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge is a lovely genuine horse, he runs his race every time and I couldn't have been more happy with the way he did it there.  Small-runner fields can get quite tactical, we picked it up turning into the straight and I didn't want to be too far away because I knew my lad stays. He's done it well - Danny Gilligan, jockey.

quotes.race: He'llberemembered Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge looked in trouble a long way out but he stuck at it and took off on the run to the last. There is going to be improvement fitness-wise so hopefully he can keep going the right way - Jack Kennedy, rider.

quotes.race: BARONERACING.COM Drinmore Novice Chase (Grade 1)
quotes.quote: Like every one else, I thought we were struggling at halfway and we were looking like we weren't at the races. I don't think Denis could go any quicker but from three out I thought we were getting back into it. You'd have to think three miles is his trip and the three-mile race at Leopardstown over Christmas is the obvious next race for him. Beacon Edge has a bit of blood on his nose - I've never seem him bleed before but sometimes they can get that from up high (in his nostril) or sometimes it can happen when they hit a fence. It didn't stop him today anyway - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Ireland Boyne Hurdle (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge had a colic at Christmas and spent nearly a week in Kildare (veterinary clinic). He was just wasn't himself in Naas last time, but he's a fair horse. I wondered about him getting the trip but he stays. He's a very nice horse. Michael (O'Leary) had it in his head that he'd go to the Aintree Hurdle but he's in the Stayers. We have Diol Ker as well and we'll see what turns up in it. He was meant to go over fences this year but when we thought about what was coming out over fences we said we might be as well staying where we are. We got it right the way it looks at the minute anyway. That was a nice prize today and a nice race to win - Noel Meade, trainer.

quotes.race: Marlin Hotel Dublin, Supporting The National Breast Cancer Institute Hurdle (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge can go now for the Hatton's Grace, that's the obvious race for him. I felt that when he went up in trip it would help, they didn't go much of a gallop there but he was cantering throughout - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Randox Health Hurdle
quotes.quote: He couldn't have done it any easier. We'll have to talk with Eddie and Michael (O'Leary) about whether he goes over fences or stays over hurdles. I suppose we didn't learn a lot there other than the fact he is well and that he jumped brilliant. Sean said he didn't really handle the track that well and when he was in front he was a bit lairy. If he stays over hurdles he will go for those conditions hurdle races. I think two and a half (miles) might suit him better and I've felt that all along. He can be dragged into a race rather than sort of push it a bit over two miles - Noel Meade, trainer

quotes.race: Bangor-on-Dee Annual Members Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Beacon Edge disappointed me a little bit. I thought he would have travelled a little bit better and I thought he was a bit lairy when he was left on his own. I do think he's a very nice horse though - Noel Meade, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He might not be the horse he once was, but he's still running to a pretty high level and he ran well again at Cheltenham on Saturday. He's very consistent. 28-10-24

runners.name: Must Meet Cecil
runners.comment: Three of his five hurdle wins have been in races of this type, up against it this time
runners.spotlight: Three of his five hurdle wins have been in races of this type, at Sligo and Ballinrobe in August 2023 and at Tramore last month on his return from a lengthy absence; has to bounce back from a disappointing handicap run at Killarney.

quotes.race: Book Your Winter Festival Tickets Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Getting Must Meet Cecil's head in front in the first claimer really helped him and he's enjoying it a lot more now. He was passed up the run-in but battled back, it was a very brave effort. He'll stay going now as long as the ground doesn't get too heavy - Cian Collins, trainer.

quotes.race: Bright Motor Group Claiming Hurdle
quotes.quote: Must Meet Cecil loves good ground and to make plenty of use of him, he's just a big galloper - Cian Collins, trainer.

runners.name: Redwood Queen
runners.comment: Weight structure gives her a clear chance against Beacon Edge who would prefer further
runners.spotlight: Won four of her five starts between May and July last year before failing to adapt effectively to a switch to the Flat; slump has continued with an undistinguished run at Killarney on her recent return to hurdling; however, she could be a different proposition; weight structure gives her a clear chance against the class-act Beacon Edge who would prefer further.

quotes.race: Butlerstown Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Redwood Queen s very hard on herself, the good gallop helped settle her. It's a long run-in and from two out I thought I might get there. She's very small but she jumps very well and is all heart - Philip Byrnes, rider

runners.name: Tasmanian Girl
runners.comment: Long-priced winner of a 2m handicap at Thurles in March, no appeal at these weights
runners.spotlight: Long-priced winner of a 2m handicap at Thurles in March; down the field off her revised mark at Downpatrick; no appeal at these weights.

runners.name: Robindevidastar
runners.comment: Experienced hurdler with 3-33 strike rate, out of form since Clonmel second in January
runners.spotlight: Experienced hurdler with 3-33 strike rate; out of form since Clonmel second in January.

quotes.race: William Hill Ireland Extra Places Every Day Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Robindevidastar had never had a gallop on grass but I was confident he would run a big race, I don't think he would want very heavy ground - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: Rockview Roman
runners.comment: Three-time Flat winner, yet to shine over hurdles (0-10), unplaced in a claimer on latest
runners.spotlight: Three-time Flat winner; yet to shine over hurdles (0-10); fifth of seven finishers in a weaker race in this category at Clonmel 13 days ago.

quotes.race: Crowne Plaza Leading Jockey & Trainer Championship Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: We knew he had a race in him off that mark but the draw was putting me off and it was his first time on the surface. He's run at a mile and three but hadn't shown anything before either, so there were unknowns heading into tonight, although we knew he had ability. He had a very bad accident as a two-year-old around this time last year. He got a very bad cut and we nearly lost him, that's why he was off the track for so long. Hopefully he'll make up for lost time now - John McConnell, trainer of Rockview Roman

runners.name: Single Edition
runners.comment: Fell on chase debut at Tramore, fair placed form in handicaps last autumn, limited appeal
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner in 2022; runner-up in three handicap hurdles, including at Downpatrick and Roscommon last September; fell on chase debut at Tramore last month after a winter break.

5:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watered)

runners.name: The Big Doyen
runners.comment: Mixed form chasing last season; changed yards and reverts to hurdles off reduced mark
runners.spotlight: Dual bumper and hurdles winner for Peter Fahey but not as good a chaser last season; changed yards and reverts to hurdles off reduced mark and goes well fresh.

quotes.race: Knockcroghery Flat Race
quotes.quote: The Big Doyen is a nice horse but one that wants an ease in the ground. We'll keep to bumpers for now but he's not one we will over-face and we'll give him a bit of time - Peter Fahey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a cracker at Cheltenham in the Grade 2. He has an entry in the Grade 1 Future Champions Novice Hurdle at Leopardstown over Christmas and he might go there before we head for some of the big handicaps in the spring. 27-11-23

H's been cantering away since winning at Punchestown and I wouldn't be against the idea of going straight to the Champion Bumper with him. There was a huge amount of interest in the horse after he won at Punchestown, but in fairness to the boys who own him they came back and said no amount of money will buy him. I wouldn't like to overface him before Cheltenham because h's thriving the whole time and I'd rather keep him plenty fresh than give him a hard race. H'll have a couple of racecourse gallops and that will leave him spot on for the Champion Bumper and you'd have to say h's a hugely exciting horse to have in the yard. 08-12-21

runners.name: Any Road
runners.comment: Safely held in handicaps of late and offers hold greater appeal
runners.spotlight: Two hurdle wins include 2m5f rated hurdle at Fairyhouse last season (good); safely held in handicaps of late (well-backed favourite at Killarney last time when hampered) but don't rule out.

quotes.race: Fairyhouse Membership 2025 Rated Hurdle
quotes.quote: Any Road disappointed me last season. I wasn't confident today, it being his first run. He should get into the good handicap here at the end of the month. I was very pleased with him, especially on the ground - Edward O'Grady, trainer

runners.name: Arctic Bresil
runners.comment: Folded tamely on last month's hurdles return in Cork handicap; something to prove now
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle win came at Cork (2m1f) and most of racing since has been over fences, folding tamely on last month's hurdles return in Cork handicap; something to prove now; cheekpieces tried.

quotes.race: Bar One Racing Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: I don't think we need to rush and there is the Grade 2 Moscow Flyer Hurdle at Punchestown in the middle of January and that might be the race for Arctic Bresil. He has a lot of pace so we will stick to two miles - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: We liked him a lot last season but he disappointed us in his last two runs. He goes over fences now and the aim is to get him out in a beginners' chase over the next few weeks. His schooling has been really good and hopefully fences will help him fulfil his potential. 20-11-23

He made a bright start to his career when beating the highly rated Mercurey at Cork in December, which didn't come as a surprise as he'd looked a nice prospect. On the back of that we sent him to Sandown for the Grade 1 Tolworth but he simply never turned up and Rachael [Blackmore] pulled him up before the second-last. It was a very disappointing effort and clearly not what he's capable of. The plan is to bring him back at the Fairyhouse festival. 01-03-23

runners.name: Farfromnowhere
runners.comment: Unbeaten mare back from year's absence but goes well fresh; very interesting
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 7yo mare unbeaten in point-to-point and in April/May 2024 in bumper here (yielding) and impressive in 2m3f Limerick mares maiden hurdle (easily beating a now 121-rated rival 5.5l)); long absence since suggests training issues but goes well fresh and very interesting

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares INH Flat Race
quotes.quote: Farfromnowhere is a great mare to jump. We'll see what's coming but we won't run her on too fast ground. We'll treat her like she's good until she proves us wrong - Paul Nolan, trainer.

runners.name: Sunchart
runners.comment: Classy flat performer comes into the mix here if ground softens
runners.spotlight: Classy flat performer won Naas Listed in March on favoured testing ground but couldn't handle quicker ground in Group 2 early this month; hurdles win came here in maiden last summer and equally good form when clear second in Tipperary Grade 3  novice; predicted rain sure to suit, doesn't want fast ground.

quotes.race: TOTE Irish EBF Devoy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Sunchart has never run a bad race at this track so it's a pity there's not more races like this here and he loves an ease in the ground. It's great to have a servant like him. It took him a long time to win a race and he's now won two Listed races one year after the other. We might go travelling this year, somewhere like Germany where he'll get soft ground over a mile and a quarter or mile and a half. We're going to have to as he's an eight-year-old now. He could go back over hurdles and the ground suits him over hurdles as it's watered - Andy Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Devoy Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Sunchart deserved that more than any of us. Pat has kept persevering with him. He is a hard horse to place but he likes this track and likes soft ground. It was a good opportunity, he had the highest rating - Andy Slattery, trainer.

quotes.race: Athassel House Stud Irish EBF Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: Ben said he improved from Listowel and he'll improve again as he was green enough. He was green enough in the parade ring today as well and I think we'll give him another run in the Eyrefield Stakes. He has a fancy entry in the Epsom Derby next year and we think a good bit of him. He'll be a better three-year-old and I just think he'll need another run. The Eyrefield will give him a bit more education and I think he'll need it - Andy Slattery, trainer

runners.name: Grimaud

prev_owners.owner: Riviera Equine Sarl, Haras D'Etreham Et Al

runners.comment: 5yo  remains relatively unexposed hurdling and rain will help his cause
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in France; made it fourth-time lucky in maiden hurdles when comfortably landing odds at Gowran (2m, soft) in March but didn't count in much more competitive Aintree handicap following month on quicker ground; remains relatively unexposed hurdling and rain will help his cause.

quotes.race: Golf Classics At Gowran Park Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: Grimaud had the form and would have wanted to be winning that so it's nice for him to get off the mark. He wouldn't mind the ground a bit better. It's very testing and he did well to get through it - Jack Kennedy, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He ran a few times in France, winning at La Teste De Buch, and looks nice a nice recruit. 28-10-24

runners.name: Duke Of Leggagh
runners.comment: Recent flat winner on good but relishes soft so rain will suit; contender
runners.spotlight: Won back-to-back Naas handicap hurdles in February on soft/heavy and proved his versatility ground-wise when recording a third flat win on good ground at Roscommon recently; in rare order and certainly won't mind rain.

quotes.race: William Hill Keep Your Raceday Positive Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: It was ideal conditions for Duke Of Leggagh. He jumped a lot better today. I knew he had improved from the last day, but I didn't think he had improved that much. We'll probably go back to the Flat with him now and he really does like that ground - Mick Mulvany, trainer.

quotes.race: Adare Manor Opportunity Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Duke Of Leggagh ran well last day and on his Flat form he was entitled to win that. Guts won it for him. We'll mix it between this and the Flat but he wants ground like that - Mick Mulvany, trainer

quotes.race: Bective Restaurant Handicap
quotes.quote: Duke Of Leggagh had to win today, trying to win going up 12lb was going to be hard, but he's a lovely horse in the making. It took a while for the penny to drop last year, but it did on his last run at Galway and he is improving all the time. Gary said he had a bit left - Mick Mulvany, trainer

runners.name: Black Heather
runners.comment: Let down by jumping on yard debut latest; likely improver if getting jumping sorted
runners.spotlight: Ballinrobe bumper winner last summer readily landed Naas maiden (2m, good to yielding) on hurdling debut last month; slowly away when narrowly beaten on the flat at Bellewstown two days later but let down by jumping on yard debut in Cork rated novice latest; likely improver if getting jumping sorted.

quotes.race: Pat O'Hare Bookmakers Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: Black Heather is a smart horse. I've liked him for a long time. He doesn't handle that real winter ground. We have him in on Saturday in a Flat maiden [at Bellewstown] and I don't think he got overextended today so all roads might lead there. He's a lovely dual purpose horse. He's for sale, like a lot of mine, and could be one for Galway - Harry Kelly, trainer.

runners.name: Club Manager
runners.comment: Bellewstown winner for Gavin Cromwell; no show on yard debut on the flat last month
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose 5yo with wins on flat in Britain and over hurdles this time last year for Gavin Cromwell in Bellewstown handicap; no show on yard debut on the flat at Navan last month, others preferred.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Club Manager jumped better and Sean gave him a lovely ride. He took his time and they went very fast, it sort of fell into his lap really - Gavin Cromwell, trainer

runners.name: Jake Peter
runners.comment: Dual winner last autumn but struggled off revised mark when last seen in November
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose sort won back-to-back handicap hurdles last autumn at Punchestown and Cork but struggled after aggregate 15lb rise at former venue in November and given plenty of time off since; may need this.

quotes.race: Irishinjuredjockeys.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Jake Peter picked up well and I think that he's a horse that's improving. Hopefully he keeps going that way - Gary Halpin, rider

quotes.race: www.thurlesraces.ie Maiden Hurdle
quotes.quote: He is rated 100 so I thought if I could pick the right race for him he might have as good a chance in a maiden as a handicap. He will go handicapping now after that and the handicapper can't be too hard on him. Winter ground mightn't be what he wants but we might give him one try on it anyway, and he is a horse I'd still like to try at Dundalk at some stage - Pat Flynn, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: It was hard not to be impressed with the way he won his point. He's a big, imposing horse, so we have given him plenty of time. We haven't rushed him. I would say two and a half miles might be his trip. Everything we ask him to do, he does very easily, so he's one we're looking forward to. 28-10-24

7:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watered)

runners.name: Lieutenant Mayne

quotes.race: I.N.H. Stallion Owners EBF Maiden Hurdle

We might try and find a nice novice hurdle for him, maybe across the water, and then step up in grade - John McConnell, trainer.

quotes.race: Pepsico (Walkers Snacks) Hurdle

quotes.race: Bulmers Original Novice Chase

quotes.race: JP & M Doyle Celebrating 70 Years In Business (C & G) Flat Race
quotes.quote: Tag Man is a real galloping horse and fair play to Davy, he gave him a super ride. He's a key member of our team and I'm delighted for him - Henry de Bromhead, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had a nice win over hurdles at Down Royal in August but didn't quite run to his best last time at Clonmel. We might go back over fences with him - he won first time out over fences this summer but was only ninth in a handicap chase afterwards. He stays three miles well and the better the ground the better for him. 18-11-24

runners.name: Ash Tree Meadow
runners.breeder: E A R L Elevage Des Loges
runners.comment: Smart chaser, well suited by the race conditions and will be hard to beat if jumping well
runners.spotlight: Dual Grade 2 chase scorer and 2023 Galway Plate winner; has only a maiden win to his name from seven starts over hurdles and was beaten at odds-on at Punchestown last June on his only start in this discipline last season; ran in good company over fences at Killarney 16 days ago; well suited by the race conditions and will be hard to beat if jumping adequately.

quotes.race: BoyleSports An Riocht Chase (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: Ash Tree Meadow did it very well, travelled well and jumped brilliant. Two miles was too sharp for him the last day but he went well on that ground today and his jumping was exceptional - Sam Ewing, rider.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Webster Cup Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: It wasn't really the plan to run Ash Tree Meadow but when the race looked like it would cut up we decided we'd declare him and then make our mind up what to do. We let him run and it has worked out great. He's a very good horse. Sam [Ewing] said he hated that ground and he'll be better on better ground. There is a race in Fairyhouse, a Grade 2, and a race in Aintree for him so we'll see what happens. He'll be entered in the Irish National and we'll see what Eamon [Waters, of Alymer Stud] wants to do. It's just whether he'd get that trip would be my only concern - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: racingtv.com/freetrial Chase (Grade 2)
quotes.quote: I don't think Ash Tree Meadow wants winter heavy ground. We didn't put him in the John Durkan. We will probably give him a break now as he has been in all summer and we will train him back for some of the Grand Nationals next year - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Tote Galway Plate (Handicap Chase) (Grade 3)
quotes.quote: This race has been the plan since last year for Ash Tree Meadow - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

quotes.race: Graigs Lane Maiden Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: I think Ash Tree Meadow is a nice horse. He's a big chaser really and he's a horse for the future. Davy [Russell] said that while it looked like he didn't jump that well he was travelling so well that he didn't let him wing hurdles because he would have made up too much ground. He's a grand horse. He likes that nice ground - Gordon Elliott, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Unfortunately he bled at Gowran Park last time. We're going to give him a very easy time of things for a while now and maybe train him for the Nakayama Grand Jump next April. I would like to get a prep into him before that, though. 28-10-24
