runners.name: Thedeviluno
runners.comment: Clear second last two starts; major chance of going one better
runners.spotlight: Went close over 2m here in March (good-to-yielding) when clear of the remainder and again finished a clear second when chasing home an easy winner at Cork (2m3f) following month on yielding; major chance.

runners.name: Times A Wastin
runners.comment: Staying on Naas third suggests this longer trip will suit; more required though
runners.spotlight: Much improved on previous efforts last month after a short break when staying on third in 2m Naas bumper (good-to-yielding); longer trip here should suit but more required.

runners.name: Woodie Campelltown
runners.comment: Placed on only completed point-to-point, interesting jockey booking for rules debut
runners.spotlight: Workforce 5yo cost 10,000 euros as a 3yo; fourth foal; dam unraced half-sister to Felix Yonger (bumper winner and high-class 2m-2m4f hurdler/chaser); placed on only completed point-to-point, pulled up when favourite at Dromahane last time; interesting jockey booking for rules debut.

runners.name: Absolute Bliss
runners.comment: Some ability so far but lot more needed to feature here
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressing in bumpers, notably third at Tipperary, only midfield at Kilbeggan latest; good bit more needed here.

runners.name: Cappaho
runners.comment: Idaho mare soundly beaten in both point-to-points
runners.spotlight: Idaho mare soundly beaten in both point-to-points.

runners.name: Lakewood Rose
runners.comment: Points' winner shaped promisingly so far in 2m bumpers; longer trip should suit
runners.spotlight: Won Knockanohill point-to-point in March (good-to-yielding) and shaped okay since in 2m bumpers at Cork and Kilbeggan; step up to 2m4f here should suit.

runners.name: Big Ned
runners.comment: Beaten favourite in point'; interesting to see if support arrives on rules debut; reserve
runners.spotlight: First reserve; pulled-up when favourite in maiden point-to-point in March at Ballyragget; interesting to see if market support arrives here on rules debut.

runners.name: Kamikaz Du Plessis
runners.breeder: Mlle Severine Sourd & M Jean-Pierre Andriau
runners.comment: Placed on both point-to-points and hurdle debut last night; respected from top yard; reserve
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; Karaktar 5yo cost 78,000euros as a 3yo; second foal; dam French 1m7f AQPS Flat winner, half-sister to French 1m4f AQPS winner Duc Du Plessis; placed on both point-to-point runs and on hurdling debut at Ballinrobe yesterday

runners.name: Anniewithan E
runners.comment: Newcomer best watched if getting a run; reserve
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; Wings Of Eagles mare is first foal of an unraced half-sister to winners Born Survivor (smart 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase) and Theatre Flame (2m hurdle/chase); newcomer best watched if getting a run.

6:30.race_name: Fleadh Cheoil Wexford August 3rd - 10th Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
6:30.going_detailed: GOOD, Good to yielding in places (Watered)

runners.name: Pampar Lady
runners.comment: Held by Ballycommon Castle on Fairyhouse running last October and that rival is race-fit
runners.spotlight: Placed four times in maidens; useful standard overall; however, appears held by Ballycommon Castle on Fairyhouse running last October and that rival is race-fit.

runners.name: Buckaway Freddie
runners.comment: Second in a bumper on debut when with Gordon Elliott, career has not progressed
runners.spotlight: Second in a bumper on debut when with Gordon Elliott; career has not progressed; no handicap experience.

stable_tour.quote: He's had a nice break and he should be well up to winning a bumper judging by the way he ran first time out at Naas. 28-10-24

runners.name: Polly Poppins
runners.comment: Made a lot of the running before fading into fourth in a maiden last time, handicap debut
runners.spotlight: Made a lot of the running before fading into fourth in a maiden last time; not without a chance on handicap debut

runners.name: Only A Dollar
runners.comment: No sign of worthwhile form since winning a maiden hurdle at Clonmel 12 months ago
runners.spotlight: No sign of worthwhile form since winning a maiden hurdle at Clonmel 12 months ago; not an obvious contender.

runners.name: Ricky Langford
runners.comment: 4-37 over hurdles including twice at this venue; won over fences last season
runners.spotlight: 4-37 over hurdles, including twice at this venue; won over fences last season and may retain enough ability to be competitive here.

quotes.race: Daily Jackpots At BoyleSports Vegas Handicap Hurdle (Div I)
quotes.quote: Ricky Langford wants good ground. He has a similar mark over fences and he could go for a handicap chase before the summer is out - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

runners.name: You Played Well
runners.comment: Two less encouraging displays since a Cork run last December that was mildly promising
runners.spotlight: Showed promise when seventh behind subsequent Cheltenham Festival winner Puturhandstogether at Cork last December; two less encouraging displays since then.

runners.name: Hay Baby
runners.comment: Point-to-point winner, needs to jump better than on her handicap debut at Limerick
runners.spotlight: Soft ground point-to-point winner; jumped left at times on her handicap debut at Limerick; may be better going left-handed here.

runners.name: Hatfield Hammer
runners.comment: Placed four times last year over longer trips than this, below best twice at this track
runners.spotlight: Placed four times last year over longer trips than this; appeals as one of the more reliable members of this field, though he has failed to reproduce his best form in two visits to this track.

runners.name: Telnobody
runners.comment: Handicap debut was dismal, showed winning potential when third at Down Royal
runners.spotlight: Handicap debut at Downpatrick was dismal; showed winning potential when third at Down Royal early this month; one for the short list.

runners.name: Gortmore Lady
runners.comment: Considerable improvement needed from her first two handicap attempts, still early days
runners.spotlight: Showed a glimpse of ability in three maidens last year; considerable improvement needed from her first two handicap attempts; still early days

runners.name: Ballycommon Chapel
runners.comment: Big chance after chasing home the favourite at Tipperary two weeks ago, ground should suit
runners.spotlight: Managed two solid placed efforts on good ground last October, notably when second over 2m at Gowran; poor form in November/December; much more like it when returning from a break to finish second to the well-fancied Gimme A Buzz at Tipperary two weeks ago.

runners.name: Fear The Deere
runners.comment: Fair fifth over 2m4f at Thurles in November on penultimate start, others make more appeal
runners.spotlight: Ran one of his better races when fifth over 2m4f at Thurles in November; down the field over 2m at Limerick in December and absent since; others make more appeal.

runners.name: Mrs Wemyss
runners.comment: Has failed to complete in three handicap attempts, can be left out of calculations.
runners.spotlight: Has failed to complete in three handicap attempts; can be left out of calculations.

runners.name: Special Protector
runners.comment: Low-rated Flat maiden, 0-10 over hurdles, lacks a recent outing, hard to make a case
runners.spotlight: Low-rated Flat maiden, 0-10 over hurdles; lacks a recent outing; new headgear combination; hard to make a case for her.

runners.name: Stormy Jenn
runners.comment: First reserve, a long time since her two Flat wins, weak form over hurdles, up against it
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose mare whose two Flat wins came at Gowran in 2021 and 2022; 0-6 hurdling, weak form; out of contention when unseating her rider after the last at Sligo on recent return; first reserve.

runners.name: Falcon Park
runners.comment: Second reserve, won twice for Paul Hennessy last winter, yet to hit form for this stable
runners.spotlight: Won twice for Paul Hennessy last winter and went close to making it a hat-trick at Gowran in January; yet to hit form for this stable; second reserve.

quotes.race: Lisronagh Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Falcon Park is just in good humour at the moment. I've no idea why he's hitting form but he's always shown more at home than he showed at the racecourse - Paul Hennessy, trainer.

runners.name: Splendid Choice
runners.comment: Third reserve, tailed off last week six days after C&D win, another quick reappearance
runners.spotlight: Tailed off at Downpatrick last week six days after C&D win; another quick reappearance is scheduled so some excuse may have emerged for last Friday's performance; third reserve.

runners.name: Vigor Elleegant
runners.comment: Posted a career best effort in January but three underwhelming efforts have followed
runners.spotlight: 0-9; posted a career best effort when finding only one too good over C&D in January but three underwhelming efforts have followed; today's ease in grade at least aids his chances.

runners.name: Accolade Start
runners.comment: Failed to build on an improved effort in March; needs to find plenty more
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden; posted an improved effort when finishing a respectable fifth in March but has failed to build on that run in four subsequent starts; needs to find plenty more.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C/D) (EBF Restricted Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Wahaaj has always shown us that ability and the thing about him is that he is a well-built horse and he is athletic. He does things nicely and he does things very well at home. He has really stepped up mentally and as a two-year-old you don't know how they're going to take to their second run. If he had run today and was getting stressed, then it would be a concern. However, he coped really well and it makes our planning for the future a lot easier - Patrick Owens, trainer.

runners.name: Winning Heart
runners.comment: Made amends for some narrow defeats last month; 6lb rise and wide draw to overcome today
runners.spotlight: Made amends for some narrow defeats early in his current campaign when staying on strongly to score over C&D last month; 6lb rise and wide draw makes things much tougher today.

runners.name: Sky Prophet
runners.owner: Kwan Shiu Man,Jessica Kwan Mun Hang & Jeffrey Kwan Chun Ming
runners.comment: Took a step forward on his penultimate outing but was soundly beaten here a month ago
runners.spotlight: 0-13; took a step forward when suffering a narrow defeat at Sha Tin on his penultimate outing but was soundly beaten when last seen here a month ago; needs to get back on track returning to today's shorter trip.

runners.name: Ever Smart
runners.comment: 0-14 but knocking on the door in recent times; warrants plenty of respect here
runners.spotlight: Yet to make his breakthrough after 14 starts but has been knocking on the door in recent times; heading in the right direction and warrants plenty of respect here.

runners.name: Joyful Life
runners.comment: Hinted at a breakthrough early this season but has since gone off the boil
runners.spotlight: Suggested a breakthrough was near early in the season but has gone off the boil since the turn of the year; should be showing plenty more off his current mark.

runners.name: Speedy Smartie
runners.breeder: Mrs V A & W K Pike
runners.owner: Dr Andrew Yu, Dr Alvin Yu Man Ho & Dr Bernice Yu Man Yan
runners.comment: Has hinted at another visit to the winner's enclosure this season; on a workable mark
runners.spotlight: Yet to snap a long losing sequence but has hinted at another visit to the winner's enclosure this season; dangerous to ignore off his current mark.

runners.name: Gallant Goody
runners.comment: Has shown some improvement this season but still needs to find something extra
runners.spotlight: Disappointing for the majority of last season but has shown slightly more in four outings this term; still needs to find something extra to stand any chance.

runners.name: Almighty Kick
runners.comment: 0-13 and yet to get seriously competitive; can only be watched
runners.spotlight: 0-13 and yet to get seriously competitive; will need to bounce back from an underwhelming effort two weeks ago to play any sort of role today.

runners.name: Double Show
runners.comment: Gained second career victory in October; held off his elevated mark since
runners.spotlight: Gained his second career victory when scoring over the minimum trip here in October; held off his elevated mark since so another step forward is required.

runners.name: Flying Phantom
runners.comment: Hinted at his ability in December but has failed to really kick on in seven outings since
runners.spotlight: Longstanding maiden; hinted at his ability when a close second over 7f at Sha Tin in December but has failed to really kick on in seven outings since; should be showing more.

runners.name: Wind Speeder

prev_owners.owner: Newgate Bloodstock, China Horse Club Racing Pty Ltd Et Al

runners.comment: Snapped a long losing run when scoring at Sha Tin last month; held off revised mark since
runners.spotlight: Snapped a long losing run when scoring over today's trip at Sha Tin last month; held off his revised mark latest but remains on a workable mark.

runners.name: Oriental Tycoon
runners.comment: Has shown very little ability in 15 local starts; impossible to recommend at present
runners.spotlight: Has shown very little ability in 15 local starts so far; impossible to recommend at present.

runners.name: Solar Up
runners.breeder: Sf Bloodstock Llc & Blake Sandblom Pty Ltd
runners.owner: Kong Wing Ming & Edmond Kong Chun Man
runners.comment: Showed minor improvement earlier this season but recent efforts have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Showed some minor improvement earlier this season but recent efforts have been underwhelming; revival needed.

runners.name: Oriental Surprise
runners.comment: Showed some ability in December but subsequent efforts have been poor; drops into Class 5
runners.spotlight: 0-7; showed some ability when finishing a respectable fifth on only his second start in December but subsequent efforts have been poor; now drops into Class 5.

runners.name: Concorde Star
runners.owner: Philip Yu Chi Wai & Dr Jennie Peterson Yu
runners.comment: Modest in novice events last season and has failed to make any impact in handicaps
runners.spotlight: Modest in novice events last season and has failed to make any impact since being introduced to handicaps this term; today's ease in grade still not enough to tempt.

runners.name: Sweet Diamond
runners.comment: Posted consecutive C&D victories last season but yet to run up to that form this term
runners.spotlight: Posted consecutive C&D victories towards the end of last season but yet to run up to that form in nine outings this term; 6lb below his last winning mark.

runners.name: Camp Fire
runners.comment: Posted an improved effort over the minimum trip here last month; now needs to kick on
runners.spotlight: Generally disappointing in nine career starts but did post an improved effort when finishing a creditable fifth over the minimum trip here last month; now needs to kick on.

runners.name: Notthesillyone
runners.comment: Safely held in eight career starts so far; a more convincing performance is needed
runners.spotlight: Safely held in eight career starts so far; a more convincing performance is needed before being considered.

runners.name: Ragnarr
runners.comment: Longstanding local maiden but has been knocking on the door since the turn of the year
runners.spotlight: Longstanding local maiden but has been knocking on the door since the turn of the year; looks one of the likelier ones today.

runners.name: Hoss
runners.comment: Yet to snap a long losing sequence but has proved competitive this season; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Yet to snap a long losing sequence but has proved competitive this season, notably when second over C&D in February; high on the shortlist today.

runners.name: The Prime
runners.comment: 0-11 and has struggled to get consistently competitive; needs to turn things around
runners.spotlight: 0-11 and has struggled to get consistently competitive; recent efforts have been a long way below par so will need to turn things around quickly to stand any chance.

runners.name: So Awesome
runners.owner: Eddie Law Kar Chung, Ada Ng Wai Hing Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Eddie Law Kar Chung, Ada Ng Wai Hing & Edwin Law Pok Hin

runners.comment: Yet to add to his career tally this season but he has made his presence felt; contender
runners.spotlight: Yet to add to his career tally this season but he has made his presence felt in the majority of outings this term; dangerous to ignore off his current rating.

runners.name: Sonic Boom
runners.owner: George Lee Hing Fai, Wong Che Leung Et Al
runners.comment: Yet to strike in nine outings this term and recent efforts have been underwhelming
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark on the Sha Tin dirt on his final outing last season; yet to strike in nine outings this term and recent efforts have been underwhelming; revival needed.

runners.name: Wood On Fire
runners.comment: Gained his seventh career victory last season; arrives on a tempting mark; not dismissed
runners.spotlight: Gained his seventh career victory last season; has posted some creditable efforts in defeat this term and does arrive on a tempting mark; not dismissed.

runners.name: Multidarling
runners.comment: 1-31; back on track over C&D last month; more than capable of striking off current mark
runners.spotlight: Modest strike rate of 1-31; got back on track when finishing a close second over C&D last month; more than capable of striking off his current rating; chance.

runners.name: Ace Talent
runners.comment: Far from disgraced in defeat this season; considered if getting a run today
runners.spotlight: Far from disgraced in defeat this season, finishing third on four occasions; a long way below his last winning mark so has to be considered if getting a run today.

runners.name: Vantastic Choice
runners.comment: Now 7lb below his last winning mark but yet to make his presence felt this season
runners.spotlight: Now 7lb below his last winning mark but yet to make his presence felt in five outings this season; should be showing more.

runners.name: Beauty Viva
runners.comment: 0-8 in Hong Kong; 1.5l second when upped to 1m1f last time; not bred to stay this trip.
runners.spotlight: British import who was unplaced in his first seven local starts prior to an improved second when upped to 1m1f a month ago; may continue to progress though his pedigree suggests that 1m3f will be too far.

quotes.race: Federation Of Bloodstock Agents Handicap
quotes.quote: Validated was a straight forward ride, There was a no pace on early but he picked up nicely out of the Dip - James Doyle, jockey.

quotes.race: AK Bets Home Of Free Bets Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We've always thought Validated would be a nice horse since we got him. He looks a picture and I was thinking of going for a novice contest next as it would've been a free hit, but his handicap mark might be affected now - Joseph Parr, trainer.

runners.name: Serangoon

prev_owners.owner: D Mason, Dr C A Broxham Et Al

runners.comment: Usually runs well over this C&D; latest run suggested busy season may be taking its toll.
runners.spotlight: C&D winner off 3lb lower in February; has only run well in one of his four subsequent appearances and finished behind four of these over C&D last time.

runners.name: Dilbagh

prev_owners.owner: R T D Racing, Flopsyandfriends Et Al

runners.comment: No real sign of ability in six local starts to date; tongue-tie longer trip tried here.
runners.spotlight: Australian 1m110y winner; yet to make the top eight in six local starts; going beyond 1m1f for the first time with a tongue-tie also applied.

runners.name: Joyful Prosperity
runners.owner: Dr & Mrs Silas S S Yang & Michelle H Y Yang
runners.comment: Had a purple patch late last year but much less effective in six 2025 outings.
runners.spotlight: Has lost his way since completing Sha Tin hat-trick (1m1f & 1m2f) in December; now 1lb lower than for most recent success.

runners.name: Romantic Fantasy
runners.comment: C&D winner; off colour in recent runs though penultimate effort displayed some promise.
runners.spotlight: Front-running C&D scorer off precisely this mark 15 months ago; has run well just once in three starts since a nine-month break and was beaten by three of these rivals last time.

runners.name: Perpetual Power
runners.comment: Showed a little more last time but still likely to be a big outsider; up from 1m.
runners.spotlight: Followed two last place finishes with slightly better 3.25l seventh over 1m a fortnight ago; possible that this big jump up in distance could suit; huge odds on all three runs.

runners.name: Management Folks
runners.comment: Followed C&D success (four of these behind) with fair third off this mark; major player.
runners.spotlight: In form dual C&D hero who was ill suited by a steady pace when 3l third to Perfect Pairing and Hakka Radiance three weeks ago; should go well again though is 2lb above highest winning mark.

runners.name: Perfect Pairing
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Jerry Chow Shiu Ming
runners.comment: Finally broke his duck by 1.25l over C&D last time; leading candidate off 6lb higher mark.
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the 15th attempt when beating Hakka Radiance and three more of these rivals over C&D three weeks ago; 6lb higher here but it would be no surprise if he goes in again.

runners.name: Kingly Demeanor
runners.comment: Front-running 1m1f scorer last time; may struggle to lead this time after 6lb rise.
runners.spotlight: Dual front-running winner in November (including over C&D) then shot back to form with surprise 12-1 1m1f success a fortnight ago; may not be able to dominate here following 6lb weight rise.

runners.name: Hakka Radiance
runners.comment: Knocking hard at the door of a first local success; four times beaten favourite this term.
runners.spotlight: Yet to get his head in front in 20 local tries but has been placed in three of his last four appearances; 5lb better off for the 1.25l beating Perfect Pairing gave him over C&D three weeks ago; must surely win some time soon.

stable_tour.quote: I have always liked this horse since the day he first set foot in the yard. He opened his account on his third outing, a 1m2f novice stakes at Chelmsford, although he is actually bred to be a miler. Next time out at Goodwood was a bit of an experiment but he failed to stay the extra trip of the Cocked Hat and didn't enjoy the undulations of the South Downs. He goes for the Britannia next week where the straight mile will suit. He is still on the upgrade, his work on fast ground has been good and we are looking forward to next week with him. 14-06-23

runners.name: Lucky Banner
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Stephen Ho Wai Man, F Ho Ka Chun & D Ho Ka Chung
runners.comment: Front-runner who is enduring a two-year win drought and is unlikely to stay 1m3f.
runners.spotlight: Only victory from 34 tries was over 6f on dirt over two years ago; way below his best in five 2025 starts and this first try at beyond 1m1f is unlikely to suit; usually makes the running.

runners.name: Ping Hai Comet
runners.comment: 0-8 but still lightly-raced and posted one of his best efforts last time; up from 1m1f.
runners.spotlight: Yet to manage a place in eight career attempts but came as close as he ever has when fourth over 1m1f a month ago and is now 2lb lower in the ratings; trying this far for the first time.

runners.name: Bright Inheritance
runners.owner: 23/24 Dennis C H Yip Trainer Syndicate

prev_owners.owner: Darby Racing, A R Burfoot Et Al
Darby Racing, G Bachell Et Al

runners.comment: Broke losing run with 1m victory last month; this trip looks too far; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Dual 1m winner including off 6lb lower mark last month; lesser effort on Sunday and all his previous tries over beyond 1m have ended in disappointment.

runners.name: Firefoot
runners.comment: Usually runs creditably but could find 1m3f too far; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Has finished in the top six (but never the top two) in six out of seven runs since a 1m win off 1lb lower in January; not sure to stay 1m3f.

runners.name: Oliner

prev_owners.owner: T T Ngo, Dr W K A Lee & Bjorn Baker Racing

runners.comment: C&D winner who showed pace on comeback last time; may try to make all; dropped in class.
runners.spotlight: Front-runner whose only Hong Kong victory came over C&D back in 2023; only beaten by 4l on return from five-month break last time; looks dangerous dropping down to Class 4 for the first time.

runners.name: Genius Baby
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Pang Wai Hak, Frankie Pang Ka Yeung & A Pang Ka Wai
runners.comment: Huge odds and unplaced in four Hong Kong starts (all 6f); slight improvement last time
runners.spotlight: Was only beaten by 2.5l last time but has still failed to crack the top six in any of his first four Hong Kong starts and has been treble-figure odds each time; cheekpieces added.

runners.name: Sweet Briar
runners.owner: Sammy To Ping Kwan & Cheng Shenn
runners.comment: Three-time 6f winner; his last six runs suggest that he is way short of peak condition.
runners.spotlight: Triple 6f scorer who has lost his form badly since prevailing over this C&D off 3lb lower mark on his seasonal debut in September; needs to leave recent form well behind to get involved in the finish.

runners.name: Up With Charm
runners.comment: Poor Hong Kong form thus far; tailed off three times in a row; new headgear today.
runners.spotlight: Won in his native New Zealand but his form in all four local starts has been of such a low level that he cannot be recommended, even with new headgear applied.

runners.name: Thunder Prince
runners.owner: Wilson Chu Kwok Yiu, Paul M F Cheng Et Al
runners.comment: Working his way into form before poor effort last time; 2lb lower here; back up to 6f.
runners.spotlight: Seemed to be getting down to a workable handicap mark when 1l fourth here last month but much less convincing last time; down another 2lb and back to 6f after three 5f tries.

runners.name: Island Buddy
runners.comment: Second off 2lb higher in December; close fourth last time; another big run expected.
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden who returned from a two-month break to finish 0.5l fourth over C&D three weeks ago; should go well again though lower draw would be preferable.

runners.name: Country Dancer
runners.comment: Worst effort in a while when ninth two weeks ago; that may herald a downturn in his form.
runners.spotlight: Twice a winner already this term but ended a long run of good efforts when ninth of 12 last time and has come up short off this kind of mark in the past.

runners.name: Bits Superstar

prev_owners.owner: R L Roulston, G T Ryan Et Al

runners.comment: His best local run was 0.5l C&D third three weeks ago; needs to prove that was no fluke.
runners.spotlight: Finally showed some sparkle after ten unplaced efforts when returning from 11-week break to finish 0.5l third for this rider over C&D three weeks ago; needs to build on that.

runners.name: Rewarding Twinkle
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Never better than fifth in six local runs; first run for new trainer after two months off.
runners.spotlight: Just one glimmer of ability (1.75l fifth over C&D) in six starts to date; returning from two months off having changed trainer in the meantime.

runners.name: Always My Folks
runners.breeder: S F Bloodstock L L C
runners.comment: Unreliable but has sound claims if repeating the level of two C&D second places.
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent; has posted six modest displays but also twice been second over C&D, once off a 4lb higher mark and then when beaten by a short head three weeks ago.

runners.name: Super Charizzard
runners.comment: Dual C&D scorer late last year but his form has dipped a little in recent months.
runners.spotlight: Dual C&D scorer this season but remains 3lb above his highest successful mark and is held by two of these from a C&D clash three weeks ago.

runners.name: Devildom
runners.breeder: B J Lindsay Mnzm & Mrs J E A Lindsay
runners.comment: Useful in New Zealand but has finished outside the top four in all 16 local appearances.
runners.spotlight: Group 2-placed in New Zealand but 0-16 in Hong Kong and has beaten a grand total of three of his 39 rivals in his three most recent outings.

runners.name: Alls Well
runners.breeder: Mrs H G & W G Bax
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Alan Leung Wai Zen
runners.comment: Has shown promise in both starts to date; up from 5f and dropped 2lb; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Twice sixth, beaten by 1.5l and then 2.25l, in two 5f starts since arriving in Hong Kong; down 2lb here and trying an extra furlong.

runners.name: Candlelight Dinner
runners.comment: New personal best when caught on line a week ago; poorly drawn; reserve.
runners.spotlight: Went oh so close to breaking his duck at the ninth attempt when making the running and caught on the line over C&D a week ago; poor draw; upped 2lb.

runners.name: Prestige Good
runners.comment: Placed off today's mark here (1m-1m1f) on the last three of his six Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Placed off today's mark here (1m-1m1f) on the last three of his six Hong Kong starts; obvious contender.

runners.name: Comet Splendido

prev_owners.owner: York Forty Four Ltd And Grant Tuer

runners.comment: Ended last season with a C&D win but yet to be placed after eight runs this term
runners.spotlight: Ended last season with a C&D win but is yet to be placed after eight starts this term and needs to up his game.

runners.name: Multidutch
runners.comment: Safely held in four sprints this year; tries a new trip today
runners.spotlight: Won when based in Australia but has been safely held in four Hong Kong sprints this year; tries a new trip today; not the most obvious answer.

runners.name: Jubilant Winner
runners.comment: Ran quite well when upped to 1m this but has another awkward draw today
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden; consistent over 6f/7f this season and was very respectable sixth over C&D from wide stall when upped to 1m this month; might have a bigger run in him over this trip but has another poor draw today.

runners.name: Sight Supreme
runners.comment: Did well when switched to dirt in middle part off season; back on turf after a break
runners.spotlight: Scored on dirt debut in December and began this year with another two good runs on that surface; off the track for four months since, though, and needs to prove he can transfer his improvement back to turf.

runners.name: Silver Up
runners.owner: E C H Wong & Ms A S C Chu
runners.comment: Bettered low-key stable debut when placed over C&D this month; still on good mark
runners.spotlight: No longer the force of old but bettered his low-key stable debut when placed over C&D three weeks ago and remains well handicapped; big player if able to build on that recent effort.

runners.name: Daily Trophy
runners.owner: Peter Cheng & Jerry Cheng Chun Ho
runners.comment: Gained all three wins over 6f on dirt; opposable over this C&D
runners.spotlight: Gained all three wins over 6f on dirt, the latest in February; soundly beaten on both starts since and looks opposable over this C&D.

runners.name: Jolly Jumper
runners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate (2)

prev_owners.owner: 23/24 Benno Yung Tin Pang Trainer Syndicate

runners.comment: C&D winner when dropped to Class 5 this month; quickly back up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Benefited from combination of step up in trip and ease in grade when opening account in C&D Class 5 race this month, his ninth start; evidently in good nick but has more to do on this quick return to Class 4.

runners.name: Amazing Run
runners.comment: Out of form in recent months and not yet proven over this far
runners.spotlight: Began season with five good runs, including a 7f win, but has lost his form badly in recent months and is yet to convince stamina-wise over 1m.

runners.name: Chill Master
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Francis Lee Bing Kwong & Yves Lee Kun Fun
runners.comment: Unplaced all five starts and makes only limited appeal
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all five starts; unlucky not to finish a bit closer than ninth over C&D three weeks ago and remains unexposed over this trip but still makes only limited appeal.

runners.name: Jumbo Fortune
runners.comment: Has very poor strike-rate in Hong Kong but scores good points for consistency
runners.spotlight: Has very poor 1-56 strike-rate in Hong Kong and has the outside draw today but, on the other hand, he scores good marks for his consistency and has edged his way down to a good mark; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: Super Sicario
runners.owner: Tony Lau Yiu Tong & Thomas Lau Sum Fai
runners.comment: Suited by step up in trip when respectable sixth over C&D two weeks ago; place claims
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all six runs but looked suited by the step up in trip when respectable sixth over C&D a fortnight ago and is another 2lb lower today.

runners.name: Carryon Smiling
runners.owner: Charley Chan Wing Chin & Li Kit
runners.comment: In the frame off this mark over 1m since shock 7f win in February; could have a say
runners.spotlight: Improved to cause 84-1 shock at Sha Tin in February, his sixth start, and made the frame off today's mark there when upped to 1m this month; could have a say if he gets a run here.

runners.name: New Forest
runners.comment: 0-6 in Hong Kong but very competitive in Class 3 this year; eased in grade today
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australia 4yo; 0-6 in Hong Kong this year but has made the frame three times in Class 3 and is sure to appreciate this ease in grade.

runners.name: California Deeply
runners.comment: Fourth over C&D when returned to Class 4 this month; not so well drawn today
runners.spotlight: C&D winner in December; appreciated return to this grade when fourth here a fortnight ago but is not as favourably drawn today and others appeal more.

runners.name: Young Arrow
runners.breeder: G S A Bloodstock Pty Ltd
runners.comment: 0-11 in Hong Kong but has made the frame in three higher-grade C&D races this year
runners.spotlight: 0-11 in Hong Kong but has made the frame in three C&D Class 3 races this year and looks very interesting on first start in this lower grade.

runners.name: Tactical Command
runners.breeder: Simms Davison & Mrs M P Schick
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner in February/March but seemingly on a tough mark now
runners.spotlight: Struck form with consecutive C&D wins in February/March but recent efforts suggest he's on a tough mark now.

runners.name: My Day My Way
runners.comment: Went very close over C&D this month; can be dangerous from off the pace again
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who came second over C&D on two of his last three appearances; lost out only by a short head from stall 11 on latter occasion and can be dangerous from off the pace again today.

runners.name: Crystal Powerful

prev_owners.owner: L K Fernie, K Doak Et Al

runners.comment: Dual 5f course winner in March/April but well held over C&D on latest outing
runners.spotlight: Recorded narrow 5f wins on consecutive appearances here in March/April and is also suited by 6f but his latest run was disappointing and he needs to prove he can still cope with a mark this high.

runners.name: King Victor
runners.comment: Struggled when a big-priced outsider for debut over C&D last month
runners.spotlight: Struggled when a big-priced outsider for debut over C&D last month.

runners.name: Rewarding Buddy
runners.comment: Well down the field on debut in November; not seen again since
runners.spotlight: Weakened quickly and finished well down the field on debut at Sha Tin in November; not seen again since; favourable draw not enough to make him of interest here.

runners.name: Super Pace
runners.comment: Has not lived up to his name in recent trials; makes official debut today
runners.spotlight: Out of a mare who was placed over 5f; has not lived up to his name in recent trials and can only be watched on this official debut; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.name: Noble Fans
runners.comment: Placed over 7f on debut; second run was disappointing; drawn wide for first 6f attempt
runners.spotlight: Made very promising debut when staying-on third at Sha Tin (7f) in January but his run over that C&D 18 days later was disappointing and he's drawn wide for this first 6f attempt.

runners.name: Telecom Power
runners.owner: Cheung King Shek, Billy Cheung King Shan Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Pulse Dream Genie, P M O'Shea Et Al

runners.comment: Off the mark in Hong Kong with narrow C&D win this month; back up in grade today
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in Hong Kong at 19th attempt, prevailing by a short head in Class 5 C&D contest three weeks ago; back up in grade today, though, and needs to kick on again.

runners.name: Rich Horse
runners.comment: Unplaced all nine Hong Kong starts and makes very limited appeal from stall 10
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all nine Hong Kong starts and was particularly disappointing when last in action; makes very limited appeal from stall 10.

runners.name: Team Happy
runners.comment: Latest run was big step back in right direction; still well handicapped and has good draw
runners.spotlight: In good form in early part of this season and took big step back in right direction when fifth from double-digit stall over C&D three weeks ago; on a very tempting mark now and has much better draw today; shortlisted.

runners.name: Warriors Dream
runners.breeder: Razza Del Sole Societa Agricola Srl
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Stephen Ho Wai Man, F Ho Ka Chun & D Ho Ka Chung
runners.comment: Fair handicapper in Britain but has made low-key start to Hong Kong career
runners.spotlight: Fair 6f-1m handicapper for Sean Woods in Britain last year but has made a low-key start to his Hong Kong career (four runs); drops in grade today but still has a lot to prove.

runners.name: Mega Bonus
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Tser Yiu Cho, J Tser Ka Ho & Johnson Tser Ka Yu
runners.comment: Consistent since visor was refitted in February; probably won't be far away
runners.spotlight: Finished fifth from stall 11 over C&D last month and has now performed well five consecutive times since the visor was refitted in February; probably won't be far away.

runners.name: M Unicorn
runners.comment: Emphatic C&D winner in March but two disappointing runs have followed; still on tough mark
runners.spotlight: Late-maturing 6yo who posted a career-best performance when winning emphatically over C&D in March; two disappointing runs have followed, though, and he remains on a tough mark.

runners.name: Aestheticism
runners.comment: Deserved his C&D win two starts ago but others in this line-up look better handicapped
runners.spotlight: Consistent 5yo who deserved his C&D win two starts ago and was a perfectly respectable sixth off his new mark a fortnight later; ought to give another good account but others in the line-up look better handicapped.

runners.name: Hameron
runners.comment: C&D winner off much reduced mark in February but younger rivals appeal more
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to capitalise upon a favourable mark over C&D in February and posted another couple of good efforts here last month but younger rivals have more appealing profiles.

runners.name: Jumbo Legend
runners.comment: Dual course winner this season (1m/1m3f); current mark demands a career-best effort
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner this season (1m/1m3f); never really got involved after sluggish start here (1m1f) last month, though, and current mark demands a career-best performance.

runners.name: Flying Fortress
runners.owner: 23/24 Cody Mo Wai Kit Trainer Syndicate
runners.comment: Won cosily over C&D last month and has gone close here since; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Came good in Hong Kong with cosy C&D success last month, his sixth attempt, and lost out only by a neck here three weeks later; may still be on the upgrade; good chance.

runners.name: Lucky Touch
runners.comment: In the frame nine consecutive times on turf/dirt since C&D win in November; respected
runners.spotlight: In the frame nine consecutive times on turf/dirt since C&D win in November; holds no secrets from the handicapper and is drawn on the outside today but seems very likely to be on the premises again.

runners.name: Samarkand

prev_owners.owner: Mrs M E Baker, Mrs R E Nicholson Et Al

runners.comment: Four course wins; placed over 1m1f here recently and still on a good mark; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Won four times here last season (1m-1m1f) and is back on a good mark now; drops back in trip after third here (1m1f) two weeks ago; shortlisted.

runners.name: Absolute Honour

prev_owners.owner: Derrick Smith & Mrs John Magnier & Michael Tabor

runners.comment: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but safely held on first four Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: A very promising 2yo in Ireland last year but safely held on first four Hong Kong starts, most recently when upped to 1m here three weeks ago.

quotes.race: Tipperary Races Median Auction Maiden (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Surpass is a work in progress, he's still very babyish and when he puts it all together he has the makings of a lovely horse. He could go for a race like the Tyros Stakes now - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

runners.name: Allcash
runners.comment: Made the frame on dirt this month but this switch back to turf may not be ideal
runners.spotlight: Unplaced all ten Hong Kong starts; posted sound effort when keeping-on fourth on dirt at Sha Tin (1m) this month but may not be ideally suited by today's return to turf.

runners.name: Win Beauty Viva
runners.comment: Always towards the rear over C&D when 66-1 for recent Hong Kong debut
runners.spotlight: Won 1m maiden in Australia in November but was always towards the rear over C&D when 66-1 for recent Hong Kong debut.

runners.name: The Azure
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Alan Ho Pui Lun & Mr & Mrs Norman Tang Fai Ng
runners.comment: Led close home to score by a nose here last month, his third C&D success of the season
runners.spotlight: Strong-finishing 4yo who led close home to score by a nose here four weeks ago, his third C&D success this season; another 6lb higher today but likely to appear late on the scene again.

runners.name: Viva Graciousness

prev_owners.owner: Bells & Phil Syndicate, Mrs V A Heathcote Et Al
Mrs A Borges, C L Lagerroth Et Al

runners.comment: Both runs last month were very disappointing and he remains on a fairly tough mark
runners.spotlight: Remained in good form for a good while after his C&D win in November but both runs last month were very disappointing and he remains on a fairly tough mark.

runners.name: Sky Vino
runners.comment: In the frame all three starts since C&D win in March; likely contender again
runners.spotlight: In the frame three consecutive times since opening account with C&D win in March and, after only eight starts, he's not yet fully exposed; likely contender.

runners.name: Satirical Fan
runners.owner: T W Wong, S S S Yang & C K Ho
runners.comment: Went very close off his reduced mark over C&D three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Generally very disappointing this season but suggested he might be ready to capitalise upon some help from the handicapper when very close second to Amazing Award over C&D three weeks ago; well drawn again.

runners.name: Amazing Award
runners.owner: Chan Kwok Yuen, Terence Lun Tin Yeu & Paul Li Cheuk Wai
runners.comment: Dual C&D winner this year; latest 6lb rise might leave him vulnerable, though
runners.spotlight: Led close home to thwart Satirical Fan three weeks ago and has now won twice over C&D this year; latest 6lb rise might be enough to leave him vulnerable, though.

runners.name: Swagger Bro
runners.comment: 0-8 over 6f in Hong Kong; needs this new trip to unlock some improvement
runners.spotlight: 0-8 over 6f in Hong Kong; kept on for respectable fifth here a fortnight ago but needs this longer trip to unlock some improvement.

runners.name: I P O Bros
runners.comment: Didn't run badly over 7f this month but is yet to be placed after seven Hong Kong starts
runners.spotlight: Shaped quite well when sixth at Sha Tin (7f) recently but has now been unplaced in all seven Hong Kong starts; back up in trip today; needs to find something extra.

runners.name: Iconical
runners.comment: Made all over C&D last month and had some excuses when only fifth here three weeks ago
runners.spotlight: Evidently suited by the move up in trip when making all over C&D last month, his seventh start; only fifth off new mark here three weeks ago but was drawn wide and the race did not pan out favourably for him; remains very much of interest.

runners.name: Raging Rapids
runners.comment: Flopped when upped to 1m last month but may yet build upon earlier 6f/7f promise
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo; ran as though something was amiss when upped to 1m here last month, but his earlier 6f/7f form was very encouraging and he probably still has untapped potential over this trip.

runners.name: Fortune Star
runners.owner: Kelvin Chan Kam Kei & Eddie Chan Kam Kong
runners.comment: Began career with three respectable runs (6f-7f) but needs improvement
runners.spotlight: Began career with three fairly respectable runs (6f-7f) but needs to take a good step forward on this first attempt at 1m.

runners.name: Run Run Timing
runners.breeder: G W Holdings A T F The Edwina Trust
runners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

prev_owners.owner: Tang Ming, Tang Chak Leung Et Al

runners.comment: Ran well before fading into fifth over C&D this month and has the inside draw
runners.spotlight: Campaigned mainly as a sprinter but has looked suited by 1m in recent months; ran well before fading into fifth over C&D three weeks ago and is another 2lb lower today; might give this a good shot from stall 1.

runners.name: Quick Quick Win
runners.comment: A well-beaten outsider on all five appearances (7f-1m1f)
runners.spotlight: A well-beaten outsider on all five appearances (7f-1m1f) and seemingly on a beeline for Class 5.

runners.name: California Banner
runners.comment: Safely held in first two handicaps; headgear switched on this reappearance outing
runners.spotlight: Placed in 6f novice at Sha Tin last July but safely held in two handicaps towards end of last year (7f/1m); swaps cheekpieces for first-time cheekpieces on this first start for seven months.

runners.name: Top Peak
runners.comment: Dual 7f winner at end of last season and in good form over 6f in recent months; new trip
runners.spotlight: Dual 7f winner at end of last season and in good form over 6f in recent months; could have a say if this new trip suits.

runners.name: Chateauneuf
runners.comment: Clearcut C&D winner from stall 1 this month; 9lb higher and drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Posted career-best performance when winning in good style from stall 1 over C&D three weeks ago, but combination of 9lb rise and much wider draw makes things much tougher.

runners.name: Bundle Of Charm
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Colin Lo Chor Cheong
runners.comment: Ran quite well on dirt ten days ago and remains well handicapped for this turf return
runners.spotlight: Stayed on for very respectable fourth on dirt at Sha Tin ten days ago and remains very well handicapped on some of this season's turf form; one to consider.

runners.name: Spicy Gold
runners.comment: Progressive 5yo; three C&D wins this season; good second last month; respected
runners.spotlight: Progressive 5yo who has collected three C&D wins this season and ran a big race in defeat here on latest outing four weeks ago; respected.

runners.name: Golden Empire
runners.comment: Back in very good form last month but faces tough assignment from stall 12
runners.spotlight: Kept on strongly for narrow C&D success last month and his subsequent fifth here was perfectly respectable, but he faces a tough assignment from stall 12.

runners.name: Sports Legend
runners.owner: Mr & Mrs Boniface Ho Ka Kui
runners.comment: Front-runner; sure to be suited by return to this C&D; might be the answer
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who was placed over C&D on consecutive starts in March; below that form on both subsequent outings but one was on dirt and the other was over 5f; back over his preferred C&D today and quite well drawn; might be the answer.

runners.name: Gracious Express

prev_owners.owner: G Doyle, K Ivory & F Young

runners.comment: Well handicapped on early-season 6f/7f form but not firing on all cylinders lately
runners.spotlight: Well handicapped on early-season 6f/7f form but not firing on all cylinders lately; headgear switched in bid to perk him up.

quotes.race: Visit racingtv.com Handicap
quotes.quote: Sharp Power is bordering on being a seven-furlong horse so I will let him do the talking there. He could be a Victoria Cup horse one day. I think the stronger he is getting the quicker he is getting? I won't throw him in the deep end this year. That was a fifty-thousand-pound race and I'm glad to get that. We won't be too hard on him this year as I think we will benefit for it next year - Richard Hughes, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely horse who has been placed in four of his five races. He made his debut at Kempton in February when second to Desert Cop and then finished third, beaten less than a length, in a race at Southwell after that. Last week at Lingfield I thought he had a winning opportunity but he was very free and had to settle for second. I think when things go his way he is the sort who can really progress and easily outperform his current mark of 74. 29-06-23

runners.name: Very Grateful
runners.comment: Absent since winning over 7f on debut in New Zealand in November; might need this run
runners.spotlight: Won 7f maiden on debut in New Zealand in November but makes Hong debut debut after six-month break and is entitled to benefit from this outing; blinkers removed; tongue-tie added.

runners.name: Wukong Jewellery
runners.breeder: B J & Mrs J E A Lindsay

prev_owners.owner: Ciaron Maher Racing, Cobra Et Al

runners.comment: Made just a mildly encouraging Hong Kong debut over C&D this month
runners.spotlight: Delivered on debut promise when winning 7f maiden in Australia last October, but made just a mildly encouraging Hong Kong debut over C&D a fortnight and needs that run to have brought him on.

runners.name: Wave Garden
runners.comment: 2-2 in New Zealand but has made a low-key start to his Hong Kong career this year
runners.spotlight: 2-2 when based in New Zealand but has made a quiet start to his Hong Kong career this year and is seemingly in need of more help from the local handicapper.

runners.name: Goko Win

prev_owners.owner: Mrs W M Duncan, Mrs M Shaw Et Al

runners.comment: Ended long losing run with narrow C&D success this month; back up in grade, though
runners.spotlight: Led close home to end long losing run over C&D three weeks ago and has the plum inside draw again, but recent 5lb rise forces him back up in grade.

runners.name: Watch This One
runners.comment: Blew the start over C&D last month but began HK career with two promising 5f runs
runners.spotlight: Ex-Australian 3yo who kept on for fourth over 5f here on first two Hong Kong starts; lost all chance after blowing the start over C&D last month but could still have untapped potential over 6f and is well drawn.

runners.name: Sky Cap
runners.comment: Surprise C&D winner last month but soundly beaten in this higher grade since
runners.spotlight: Stayed on well to cause 29-1 surprise in Class 4 C&D contest two starts ago, but finished well down the field in this higher grade a fortnight ago and has double-digit draw.

runners.name: Lucky Eight
runners.comment: Resurgent 6yo who will have good each-way claims if he gets a run
runners.spotlight: Resurgent 6yo who went close over C&D on consecutive appearances in March/April and ran well from a tough draw a fortnight ago; will have each-way claims at least if he gets a run.

runners.name: Star Performer
runners.comment: Made quite promising Hong Kong debut over 5f but latest run was a backward step
runners.spotlight: Made quite promising Hong Kong debut over 5f at Sha Tin in March, but his run over that trip here last month was a backward step; others have more pressing claims.
